1615.description: An Act Making A Reappropriation To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Reauthorize The Expenditure Of Special Funds Previously Appropriated For Construction And/or Repair And Renovation Projects At Various State Agencies And Institutions, For Fiscal Year 2019.

1616.title: Appropriations; additional for various state agencies for Fiscal Year 2018.
1616.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of General Funds, Capital Expense Funds, And Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Governor-division Of Medicaid For Fiscal Year 2018; The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019; The Wireless Communication Commission For Fiscal Year 2018; The Department Of Human Services For Fiscal Year 2018; Office Of The Attorney General For Fiscal Year 2018; The Board Of Tax Appeals For Fiscal Year 2018; The Department Of Information Technology Services For Fiscal Year 2018; The Department Of Rehabilitation Services For Fiscal Year 2018; Department Of Corrections For Fiscal Year 2018; Oil And Gas Board For Fiscal Year 2018; Jackson State University Board For Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019; Mississippi State University Alcohol Safety Education Program For Fiscal Year 2018; The Public Employees Retirement System For Fiscal Year 2018; Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance For Fiscal Year 2018; Department Of Public Safety For Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019; Department Of Insurance For Fiscal Year 2019; And For Related Purposes.

1617.title: Town of Seminary; authorize to establish a town cemetery fund and cemetery advisory committee.
1617.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Seminary, Mississippi, To Establish A Cemetery Fund For Certain Purposes; To Provide That The Board Of Aldermen Of The Town May Appoint A Cemetery Advisory Committee; And For Related Purposes.

1619.title: City of Fulton; authorize expansion of water services provided by.
1619.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Fulton, Mississippi, To Expand Its Water Distribution System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Fulton; And For Related Purposes.

1620.title: City of Fulton; authorize expansion of gas services provided by.
1620.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Fulton, Mississippi, To Expand Its Gas Distribution System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Fulton; And For Related Purposes.

1621.title: Income tax; authorize a deduction for state income taxes paid.
1621.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Individual Nonbusiness Deduction Under The State Income Tax Law For State Income Taxes Paid; To Provide That The Amount Of State Income Taxes Paid Is Allowable As An Individual Nonbusiness Deduction Under The State Income Tax Law Without Regard To Any Limitation On The Amount Allowable For Federal Income Tax Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1622.title: City of Charleston; authorize to make payment to Michael Simms for certain medical costs caused by his assisting a police officer.
1622.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Charleston, Mississippi, To Pay Michael Simms A Certain Amount For Actual And Medical Costs That Accrued Due To His Assisting A City Police Officer Who Was Acting In His Official Duties; And For Related Purposes.

1623.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt certain interests provided by railroad authorities to others in railroad properties.
1623.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-29-39 And 27-31-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Any Lease Or Other Contract Entered Into By A Railroad Authority Providing A Leasehold Or Other Interest To A Person In Railroad Properties And Facilities Owned Or Controlled By The Railroad Upon A Finding Made By The Railroad Authority That The Exemption Of Such Interest Is Necessary To Assist With Or Make Possible The Repair, Rehabilitation Or Reconstruction Of The Railroad Properties And Facilities; To Provide That The Exemption May Be For A Period Not To Exceed A Total Of Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1624.title: Town of Byhalia; authorize expansion of natural gas system to a certain area outside the town limits.
1624.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Byhalia To Expand Its Gas System Within A Certain Area Outside The Corporate Limits; And For Related Purposes.

1625.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of bonds for capital improvements at the Mississippi State Fire Academy.
1625.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The Mississippi State Fire Academy; And For Related Purposes.

1626.title: Sales tax; exempt retail sales of certain food for human consumption, increase of state sales tax.
1626.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Food For Human Consumption Not Purchased With Food Stamps But Which Would Be Exempt From Sales Tax If Purchased With Food Stamps; To Amend Sections 27-65-17, 27-65-19, 27-65-22, 27-65-23, 27-65-25 And 27-65-26, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The State Sales Tax Rate Of Seven Percent To Nine Percent; And For Related Purposes.

1627.title: City of Brandon; extend repealer on hotels/motels to fund amphitheater and other ancillary improvements.
1627.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 935, Local And Private Laws Of 2016, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2020, To July 1, 2030, On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Brandon, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals From Hotels And Motels Within The City For The Purpose Of Funding An Amphitheatre And Other Ancillary Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

1628.title: City of Brandon; extend repealer on tax on sales of prepared food and drink at restaurants and bars.
1628.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 946, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Chapter 922, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, As Amended By Chapter 941, Local And Private Laws Of 2016, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2020, To July 1, 2024, On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Brandon, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Sale Of Prepared Food And Beverages In Restaurants And Bars Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

1629.title: Clay and Chickasaw Counties; authorize receipt of certain funds from Chuquatonchee Consolidated Drainage District.
1629.description: An Act To Authorize The Boards Of Supervisors Of Chickasaw And Clay Counties To Receive Certain Funds From The Chuquatonchee Consolidated Drainage District; And For Related Purposes.

1630.title: Bonds and grants; authorize to assist the Rank-Hinds Pearl River Flood and Drainage Control District flood control project.
1630.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $50,000,000.00 To Assist The Rankin-hinds Pearl River Flood And Drainage Control District In The Construction Of A Flood Control Project On The Pearl River In Hinds And Rankin Counties; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Use Not More Than $45,000,000.00 Out Of The Unobligated Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act As Grants To Urban Flood Control Districts For The Purpose Of Aiding In The Construction Of A Flood Control Project That Enhances The Economy Of The District Area; To Amend Section 57-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1631.title: Appropriation; IHL for training of personnel involved in investigation and resolution of campus sexual assault allegations.
1631.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of The State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Training Of Higher Education Institution And Community And Junior College Personnel Involved In The Investigation Or Resolution Of Alleged Sexual Assault, Domestic Violence, Dating Violence, Or Stalking, Or In The Confidential Advising Of Students For The Fiscal Year 2019.

1632.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for Reunion Parkway project in Madison county.
1632.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Preconstruction, Design, Engineering, Land Acquisition, Right-of-way Acquisition, Construction And Development Of The Reunion Parkway Project From Bozeman Road To Parkway East In Madison County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1633.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for East Metro Corridor project in Rankin County.
1633.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The East Metropolitan Corridor Commission, Which Is A Commission Operating As A Local Public Agency Representing The Jackson Municipal Airport Authority, The City Of Brandon, Mississippi, The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, And The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Land Acquisition And Implementation Of The East Metro Corridor Project In Rankin County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1634.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements to the Mississippi School of the Arts.
1634.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Repair, Renovation And Upgrades Of And Improvements To The Mississippi School Of The Arts In Brookhaven, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1635.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for Capitol Complex Improvement District and City of Jackson projects.
1635.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvement Projects Within The Capitol Complex Improvement District; To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Repairs, Upgrades And Improvements To The City's Water And Sewer Systems And Related Infrastructure, And To Assist The Jackson Public School District In Paying Costs Associated With Construction, Repair, Renovation, Replacement And Improvement Of District School Buildings And Facilities And Related Infrastructure; To Provide That The Principal Of And Interest On The Bonds Will Be Paid Primarily From Monies In The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Fund; To Amend Section 29-5-215, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1636.title: City of Jackson; extend the repeal date on the Jackson Convention and Visitors Bureau and the tax that supports it.
1636.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Chapter 937, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Revise The Membership Of The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau; To Require The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review To Conduct An Evaluation Of The Bureau; To Extend Until July 1, 2019, The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Impose A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

1637.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements at state parks.
1637.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair And Renovation Of Capital Facilities, Improvements, Dams, Roofing, Wastewater And Water Well Mandates, And Other Facility Maintenance Items And Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1638.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist the City of Farmington with sewer system improvements.
1638.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Farmington, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Expansion Of And Upgrades And Improvements To The City's Sewer System And Related Infrastructure; And For Related Purposes.

1639.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist the Town of Burnsville with water system improvements.
1639.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Burnsville, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Expansion Of And Upgrades And Improvements To The Town's Water System And Related Infrastructure; And For Related Purposes.

1640.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements to the Mississippi Museum of Natural Science.
1640.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Repair, Renovation And Expansion Of And Additions And Improvements To The Mississippi Museum Of Natural Science In Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1641.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for construction of the Chickasaw Heritage Center in Tupelo.
1641.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of The Chickasaw Heritage Center In Tupelo, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1642.title: Lee County; authorize to create a second county court judge position to be designated as Lee County Court Judge Post Two.
1642.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County, Mississippi, To Create A Second County Court Judge Position; To Provide That Such Created Judgeship Shall Be Designated As Lee County Court Judge Post Two With The Current County Court Judge Position Designated As Post One; To Provide That Each Judgeship Shall Be Separate And Distinct; To Provide That The Most Senior Judge Shall Assign Cases; And For Related Purposes.

1643.title: Excise tax on gasoline and diesel; increase rate.
1643.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax; To Amend Sections 27-55-519 And 27-55-521, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax On Diesel Fuel; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Revenue From The Increased Gasoline Excise Tax And The Special Fuel Excise Tax On Diesel Fuel Shall Be Deposited Into Special Funds In The State Treasury And Used To Assist Counties And Municipalities In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Maintenance And Reconstruction Of Roads, Streets And Bridges In Counties And Municipalities; And For Related Purposes.

1644.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for Byram-Clinton Parkway project and other road projects.
1644.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hinds County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction And Development Of The Byram-clinton Parkway Project; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The East Metropolitan Corridor Commission, Which Is A Commission Operating As A Local Public Agency Representing The Jackson Municipal Airport Authority, The City Of Brandon, Mississippi, The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, And The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Land Acquisition And Implementation Of The East Metro Corridor Project In Rankin County, Mississippi; To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To A Portion Of Scott Road In The City Of Lucedale, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1645.title: Tax Credit Scholarship Act; enact.
1645.description: An Act To Create The Tax Credit Scholarship Act; To Provide That Qualifying Students Shall Be Eligible To Use A Scholarship From Certain Scholarship Organizations To Cover Eligible Educational Expenses; To Provide For A Tax Credit Not To Exceed 50% Of The Taxpayer's Tax Liability For Contributions To Certain Scholarship Organizations; To Stipulate The Requirements For Nonpublic Schools Accepting Students For Enrollment Who Receive Scholarships Under The Provisions Of This Act; To Prescribe The Requirements For Scholarship Organizations Administering Tax Credit Scholarships; To Require The Department Of Revenue To Provide An Annual Legislative Report On The Tax Credits Allowed Under This Act; To Allow Parents To Request An Assessment Of Educational Progress Of Students Enrolled; To Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Department Of Revenue With Regard To The Administration Of This Act; To Provide That Nonpublic Schools Which Admit Students Receiving Tax Credit Scholarships Are Not Agents Of The State Or Federal Government; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Amounts Received As Tax Credit Scholarships To Pay Educational Expense Shall Be Excluded From Gross Income; And For Related Purposes.

1646.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for realignment of U.S. Highway 51 and Main Street roundabout.
1646.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With The Realignment Of U.s. Highway 51 And Main Street - Roundabout Project, Department Of Transportation Project Number Spr-1(102); And For Related Purposes.

1647.title: Greene County; authorize to construct or acquire a county jail anywhere in the county.
1647.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Greene County, Mississippi, To Construct Or Acquire A County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1648.title: Bonds; authorize for various purposes.
1648.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning And Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of $45,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt And/or Dedicating A Certain Amount Of Funds For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $50,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 35, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, To Increase From $29,843,000.00 To $32,843,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 511, Laws Of 2016, To Revise The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For Capital Improvements At Jackson State University May Be Used; To Amend Section 28, Chapter 511, Laws Of 2016, To Revise The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The City Of Saltillo, Mississippi, May Be Used; To Amend Section 8, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, To Revise The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The John C. Robinson Mississippi Aviation Museum Fund May Be Utilized; To Amend Section 63, Chapter 511, Laws Of 2016, To Revise The Purposes For Which Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For A Bypass In The City Of Philadelphia, Mississippi, May Be Used; To Amend Section 37, Chapter 472, Laws Of 2015, To Clarify Certain Provisions Regarding Bonds Authorized To Be Issued To Provide Funds For Improvements At Mt. Olive Park In Bolton, Mississippi; To Amend Section 65-4-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Reallocate Certain Funds In The Economic Development Highway Fund Previously Allocated For Certain Highway Projects; To Amend Section 6, Chapter 472, Laws Of 2015, To Authorize Certain Excess Proceeds Of Certain Bonds Issued For The Purpose Of Assisting The City Of Taylorsville, Mississippi, In Paying The Cost Of Certain Projects, To Be Utilized By The City For Road Projects In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1650.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for certain railroad purposes.
1650.description: An Act To Amend Section 45, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Section 9, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, As Amended By Section 16, Chapter 530, Laws Of 2014, To Increase The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund And To Extend The Time Within Which Such Bonds May Be Issued; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Highway-railroad Grade Crossing Safety Account Within The Railroad Revitalization Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying A Portion Of The Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of The Existing Railroad Line And Related Facilities Running From The City Of Amory, Mississippi, To The City Of Fulton, Mississippi; To Repeal Section 7, Chapter 520, Laws Of 2010, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For A Grant To The North Central Mississippi Regional Railroad Authority To Pay A Portion Of The Costs Incurred By The Mississippi Regional Railroad Authority For The Repair, Reconstruction And Improvement Of The Existing Railroad Line From The City Of West Point, Mississippi, To Greenwood, Mississippi; To Amend Sections 19-29-39 And 27-31-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Any Lease Or Other Contract Entered Into By A Railroad Authority Providing A Leasehold Or Other Interest To A Person In Railroad Properties And Facilities Owned Or Controlled By The Railroad Upon A Finding Made By The Railroad Authority That The Exemption Of Such Interest Is Necessary To Assist With Or Make Possible The Repair, Rehabilitation Or Reconstruction Of The Railroad Properties And Facilities; To Provide That The Exemption May Be For A Period Not To Exceed A Total Of Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1651.title: Jackson County; authorize to engage in retail sales of merchandise at county-owned golf course.
1651.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Engage In Retail Sales Of Merchandise At The County-owned Golf Course; And For Related Purposes.

1652.title: City of Clinton; authorize use of golf carts on certain public roads and streets.
1652.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Clinton, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within Certain Subdivided Residential Neighborhoods In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1653.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Rankin County with extension of Gunter Road.
1653.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Rankin County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Related To The Extension Of Gunter Road; And For Related Purposes.

1654.title: City of Ocean Springs; authorize use of golf carts and/or low speed vehicles on certain public roads and streets.
1654.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ocean Springs, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts And Low-speed Vehicles On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart Or Low-speed Vehicle To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; And For Related Purposes.

1655.title: City of Starkville; extend repeal date on economic development, tourism/convention tax.
1655.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 950, Local And Private Laws Of 1994, As Last Amended By Chapter 929, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Extend The Repeal Date From June 30, 2018, To June 30, 2022, On The City Of Starkville's Economic Development, Tourism And Convention Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1656.title: City of Clinton; authorize levying of additional tourism tax on hotels and motels.
1656.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Clinton, Mississippi, To Impose An Additional Tourism Tax Of One Percent On The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals Within The City And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of Clinton; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Additional Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1657.title: City of Clinton; authorize to impose special sales tax to fund certain infrastructure improvements.
1657.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Clinton, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than One Percent On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of Seven Percent Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least Sixty Percent Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City Solely To Fund The Establishment Of Storm Drainage Or Sewerage Systems, Construction, Repair, Rehabilitation, And Reconstruction Of Roadways, Sidewalks, Driveways, Parkways, Walkways Or Public Parking Facilities; And For Related Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1658.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for mental health diversion program facilities.
1658.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Acquisition, Construction, Repair, Renovation, Furnishing, Equipping And Expansion Of And Additions And Improvements To Buildings And Facilities For Use Relating To Mental Health Diversion Program Activities Under The Rivers Mcgraw Mental Health Diversion Pilot Program Act; And For Related Purposes.

1659.title: Town of Tishomingo; authorize expansion of gas distribution system.
1659.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of

1660.title: Bay St. Louis; may authorize the use of golf carts or low-speed vehicles on certain streets.
1660.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City Of Bay St. Louis; To Require Individuals Operating A Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License And Proof Of Insurance; To Require Low-speed Vehicles Or Golf Carts To Be Registered With The City; To Authorize The City To Charge A Registration Fee; And For Related Purposes.

1661.title: City of Long Beach; authorize use of low-speed vehicles or golf carts on certain public roads and streets.
1661.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Long Beach, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; To Require Individuals Operating A Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; To Require Certain Registration Of Such Low-speed Vehicles Or Golf Carts; And For Related Purposes.

1662.title: Oktibbeha County; authorize contribution to Institute of Community Services, Inc., for purchase of school bus.
1662.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Oktibbeha County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Institute Of Community Services, Inc. (ics), Also Known As Head Start, For The Purpose Of Assisting In The Purchase Of A School Bus For The Use And Benefit Of Ics; And For Related Purposes.

1663.title: City of Moss Point; authorize the levying of a tax on restaurants.
1663.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Moss Point, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Sales Tax Of Not More Than Two Percent Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From The Sale Of Prepared Foods By Restaurants In The City; To Provide That The City May Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation In The City; To Require An Election Be Held On The Question Of Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1664.title: City of Columbus and Lowndes County; extend repealer on restaurant tax and revise composition of Columbus-Lowndes Convention and Visitors Bureau.
1664.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 870, Local And Private Laws Of 1986, As Amended By Chapter 958, Local And Private Laws Of 1997, As Amended By Chapter 968, Local And Private Laws Of 2000, As Amended By Chapter 949, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 948, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend Until July 1, 2022, The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law That Authorize The Mayor And City Council Of The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Lowndes County, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax On Retail Sales Of Beer, Alcoholic Beverages And Prepared Food Sold By Restaurants; To Amend Chapter 935, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Revise The Composition Of The Columbus-lowndes Convention And Visitors Bureau; To Require The Bureau To Annually Contribute $250,000.00 To The Golden Triangle Development Link; To Require The Bureau To Keep A Monthly Claims Docket; And For Related Purposes.

1665.title: City of Pearl; authorize to impose special sales tax to fund certain infrastructure improvements.
1665.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than One Percent On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of Seven Percent Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least Sixty Percent Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City Solely To Improve Infrastructure Within The City To Include The Overlay And Resurfacing Of City Streets; And For Related Purposes.

1666.title: City of Pearl; authorize a tax on restaurants, hotels and motels to promote tourism, parks and recreation.
1666.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Of Not More Than 3% Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And To Impose An Additional Tax Of Not More Than 1% Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation In The City; To Provide For An Election Be Held On The Question Of Whether Such Taxes May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1667.title: City of Natchez; authorize the imposition of hotel/motel tax to promote tourism, parks and recreation.
1667.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Of Not More Than One And One-half Percent Upon Hotel And Motel Room Rentals, Which Shall Be Used To Promote The City's Tourism, Parks And Recreation; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of Natchez; To Require An Election Be Held On The Question Of Whether Such Taxes May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1668.title: City of Jackson; authorize to create special local improvement assessment districts.
1668.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By The Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

1669.title: City of Waveland; authorize use of low-speed vehicles or golf carts on certain streets.
1669.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Waveland, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City Of Waveland; To Require Individuals Operating A Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; To Require Certain Registration Of Such Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart; And For Related Purposes.

1670.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
1670.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Warren, Washington, Issaquena, Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And We Care Communities, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1671.title: Jackson County; authorize the cleaning of certain blighted property within.
1671.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Conduct Hearings To Determine Whether Certain Property Within The County Is Blighted Property; To Require The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Notice To The Owners Of "blighted" Property; To Provide The Form And Manner Of The Notice; To Authorize The County To Charge The Actual Costs Of Correcting The Blighted Property; And For Related Purposes.

1672.title: Panola County; authorize to employ a certified professional evaluator to approve or disapprove residential wastewater disposal systems.
1672.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Panola County, Mississippi, To Employ A Certified Professional Evaluator To Grant Or Deny Approval For Residential Wastewater Disposal Systems; To Provide That Such Approval Will Be Granted Only If The Systems Comply With State Law And The County Ordinance Pertaining To Such Systems; And For Related Purposes.

1673.title: Jackson County; extend repealer on hotel/motel tax levy that has revenue paid to MS Gulf Coast Regional Convention and Visitors Bureau to promote tourism.
1673.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 932, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2018, To July 1, 2022, On The Provisions Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon Hotel And Motel Room Rentals In The County And Provides That The Revenue From Such Levy Shall Be Used For The Promotion Of Tourism On The Mississippi Gulf Coast By The Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention And Visitors Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

1674.title: Jackson County; authorize contributions to MS Maritime Museum, Inc.
1674.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Mississippi Maritime Museum, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1675.title: Jackson County; authorize contributions to Junior Auxiliary of Pascagoula-Moss Point.
1675.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Junior Auxiliary Of Pascagoula-moss Point; And For Related Purposes.

1677.title: City of Hattiesburg; authorize additional tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1677.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Tax On Hotels, Motels And Restaurants; To Provide That The Proceeds Of The Tax Shall Be Used By The City To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; To Authorize The City To Distribute A Portion Of The Tax To The University Of Southern Mississippi To Be Used By The University For Improvements To Its Athletic Facilities; To Authorize The City To Receive And Expend Revenues From Any Source For The Purposes Authorized In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1678.title: Jackson County Utility District; clarify that commissioners of the district serve at will and pleasure of Jackson County Board of Supervisors.
1678.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 831, Local And Private Laws Of 1966, As Last Amended By Chapter 955, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Provide That Commissioners Of The West Jackson County Utility District Serve At The Will And Pleasure Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1679.title: City of Meridian; authorize by way of quitclaim deed to relinquish the reverter clause and other interests in American Legion property.
1679.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Meridian, Mississippi, To Convey And Relinquish To The T.c. Carter, Jr. Post No. 21, Department Of Mississippi American Legion By Quitclaim Deed The Reverter Clause As Well As Certain Other Interests The City Holds In Certain American Legion Property As Long As The Proceeds From The Sale Of The Property Will Provide Certain Benefits To The City Of Meridian; And For Related Purposes.

1680.title: City of Meridian; authorize provision of wastewater treatment services to Naval Air Station Meridian which is a certain distance outside of corp. limits of.
1680.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Meridian, Mississippi, To Provide Wastewater Treatment Services To Naval Air Station Meridian, Which Is Located A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Meridian; And For Related Purposes.

1681.title: City of Crystal Springs; may authorize operation of golf carts and/or low-speed vehicles only on public roads/streets designated by ordinance.
1681.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Crystal Springs, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts And Low-speed Vehicles On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; To Require Any Individual Operating A Golf Cart Or Low-speed Vehicle On Such Public Roads And Streets To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; And For Related Purposes.

1682.title: DeSoto County; authorize to contribute funds, in-kind donations and support to Economic Development Council, Inc.
1682.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Donate Funds, Make In-kind Donations And Provide Support To The Desoto County Economic Development Council, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1683.title: Lafayette County; authorize the creation of the Lafayette County Utility Authority.
1683.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Create And Establish A Public Body Corporate And Politic Constituting A Political Subdivision Of The State Of Mississippi To Be Known As The Lafayette County Utility Authority For The Purpose Of Providing Natural Gas, Solid Waste, Storm Water, Water And Wastewater Systems For The Anticipated Growth Within Lafayette County And Economic Development Activities Within Lafayette County; To Provide For A Board Of Directors To Exercise The Powers Of The Authority; To Provide For The Membership Of The Board Of Directors; To Provide For The Powers, Duties And Responsibilities Of The Authority; To Authorize Public Agencies To Enter Into Contracts With The Authority For Certain Purposes; To Provide That Any Municipality, Public Agency, District, Public Utility Or Other Person Authorized By Law To Provide Natural Gas, Water, Sewer And Wastewater Services To Transfer Its Powers, Duties And Responsibilities To The Authority; To Authorize The Authority To Borrow Money And To Issue Revenue Bonds And Interim Notes In Such Principal Amounts As The Authority May Determine To Be Necessary To Provide Sufficient Funds For Achieving One Or More Of The Purposes Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1684.title: Wayne County; increase contribution amount to Multi-County Community Service Agency, Inc., by.
1684.description: An Act To Increase From $10,000.00 To $50,000.00 The Contribution Amount That The Board Of Supervisors Of Wayne County, Mississippi, Is Authorized To Make To The Multi-county Community Service Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1685.title: City of Magee; authorize use of golf carts on certain public roads and streets within.
1685.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Magee, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

1686.title: Suffrage; restore to Patrick Joseph Fick.
1686.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Patrick Joseph Fick Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1687.title: Suffrage; restore to Sandra Beard of Lowndes County.
1687.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Sandra Beard Of Lowndes County, Mississippi.

1688.title: Hancock County; provide manner in which revenue from a hotel/motel tax may be expended.
1688.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1019, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Last Amended By Chapter 927, Local And Private Laws Of 2017, To Provide That The Revenue From The Hancock County, Mississippi, Hotel And Motel Tax May Be Used By The Hancock County Tourism Bureau And/or The Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention And Visitors Bureau In The Discretion Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County; To Provide That The Board Of Supervisors Shall Have The Sole Right To Designate What Portion Or Amount Of The Proceeds From The Hancock County Hotel And Motel Tax Are Expended By The Hancock County Tourism Bureau And/or The Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention And Visitors Bureau; To Provide That The Board Of Supervisors May Direct All Of The Proceeds From The Tax To Either Entity; And For Related Purposes.

1689.title: Suffrage; restore to John Henry Nabors of Lee County.
1689.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To John Henry Nabors, Of Lee County, Mississippi.

1690.title: Suffrage; restore to Stanley E. Stubbs of Prentiss County.
1690.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Stanley E. Stubbs Of Prentiss County, Mississippi.

1691.title: Copiah County; authorize to provide labor and materials for construction of roadways for campsite for Mississippi's Toughest Kids Foundation.
1691.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Copiah County, Mississippi, To Provide Labor And Materials To Assist In The Construction Of Roadways For The Campsite For Mississippi's Toughest Kids Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

1692.title: Warren County; authorize contribution to We Care Communities, Inc.
1692.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To We Care Communities, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1693.title: City of Ridgeland; authorize levying of additional tourism tax on hotels and motels.
1693.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ridgeland, Mississippi, To Impose An Additional Tourism Tax Of One Percent (1%) On The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals Within The City And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax For The Promotion And Improving Of Tourism For Enhancing Recreational And Parks Facilities And Ancillary Improvements Of Such Facilities; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of Ridgeland; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Additional Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1694.title: Suffrage; restore to Catina Faulkner Taylor of Marshall County.
1694.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Catina Faulkner Taylor, Of Marshall County, Mississippi.

1695.title: West Rankin Utility Authority; require payments made by public agency members be used solely to pay certain bonds.
1695.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 977, Local And Private Laws Of 1994, As Last Amended By Chapter 955, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Provide An Efficient And Effective Procedure For Payments To Be Made By Public Agency Members To Pay Principal And Interest On Bonds Issued By The West Rankin Utility Authority; To Require That The Payments Be Used Exclusively For The Payment Of Such Bonds And Be Pledged Exclusively To Secure The Bonds; To Prohibit Such Members From Entering Into Contracts With The Authority That Impairs The Authority's Ability To Repay Certain Loans; And For Related Purposes.

1696.title: Chickasawhay Natural Gas District; authorize expenditure of certain funds for infrastructure repairs within the district.
1696.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Directors Of The Chickasawhay Natural Gas District To Expend Certain Funds For Infrastructure Repairs Within The District; To Provide That The Funds Shall Be Disbursed To The Municipalities That Are Within The District For Such Repairs; And For Related Purposes.

1697.title: City of Oxford; authorize use of golf carts on certain public roads and streets within.
1697.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

1698.title: Suffrage; restore to Kamal Karriem, Jr., of Lowndes County.
1698.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Kamal Karriem, Jr., Of Lowndes County, Mississippi.

1699.title: Suffrage; restore to Valeska Summerville of Lowndes County.
1699.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Valeska Summerville Of Lowndes County, Mississippi.

1700.title: Suffrage; restore to Jay W. Jackson of Hinds County.
1700.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Jay W. Jackson Of Hinds County, Mississippi.

1701.title: Council on American Islamic Relations; urge law enforcement and government agencies to avoid contacts with.
1701.description: A Resolution Urging All Law Enforcement And Governmental Agencies In Mississippi To Avoid And Suspend All Contacts And Outreach Activities With The Council On American Islamic Relations (cair).

1702.title: Delta Sigma Theta; commend for Delta Days.
1702.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Clinton, Madison County And Jackson Chapters Of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc., Along With Jackson Association And Development Enterprise, Inc. (jade), On The Occasion Of Mississippi Delta Days At The Capitol In 2018.

1703.title: Monica T. Barnes "Mississippi Monica"; commend success as producer of The Steve Harvey Morning Show.
1703.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Success Of Monica Theresa Barnes, "mississippi Monica," As Producer And Talent Booker For The Steve Harvey Morning Show.

1704.title: Emma Funk; commend upon being named MaxPrep's Volleyball Small School Player of the Year.
1704.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Emma Funk For Being Named Maxprep's Volleyball Small School Player Of The Year.

1705.title: Mississippi House of Representatives; require composite of members' photos to reflect changes in membership occurring during term of office.
1705.description: A Resolution Directing The House Management Committee To Provide For The Updating Of The Official Composite Of Photographs Of The Members Of The House Of Representatives When Changes In The Membership Occur During A Four-year Term Of Office.

1706.title: Tri-County Workforce Alliance; commend upon being named 2017 Nonprofit of the Year Award recipient.
1706.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Tri-county Workforce Alliance Upon Being Named Recipient Of The 2017 Nonprofit Of The Year Award By The Community Foundation Of Northwest Mississippi.

1707.title: House Rules; amend to require a racial impact statement for all legislation to be attached to each bill.
1707.description: A Resolution To Create New House Rule No. 104c To Provide A Procedure For Issuance Of Racial And Ethnic Impact Statements That Examine How Proposed Legislation Will Affect Certain Populations.

1708.title: House chamber; prohibit display of state flag with Confederate Battle Flag in its design in the chamber.
1708.description: A Resolution To Create A New House Rule To Prohibit The Official Flag Of The State Of Mississippi That Contains The Confederate Battle Flag As Part Of Its Design From Being Displayed In The House Chamber.

1709.title: Joe Trotter Dockins; commend excellent community service of.
1709.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Community Service Of Mr. Joe Trotter Dockins And Extending To Him Most Sincere Wishes For Continued Success In All Of His Future Endeavors.

1710.title: Emmett Till murder; issue apology for state's role in killers' acquittals that were based on a lie.
1710.description: A Resolution Apologizing For The Role Mississippi Played In The Murder Of Emmett Till And The Acquittal Of His Killers, Roy Bryant And J.w. Milam, Which Was Based Upon An Unsubstantiated Lie Told By Carolyn Bryant.

1711.title: House Rules; create new rule that provides a procedure for a racial and ethnic impact statement.
1711.description: A Resolution To Create New House Rule No. 104c To Provide A Procedure For Issuance Of Racial And Ethnic Impact Statements That Examine How Proposed Legislation Will Affect Certain Populations.

1712.title: East Central High School "Hornets" Football Team; commend upon successful season and winning the South State Championship.
1712.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The East Central High School "hornets" Football Team And Coach Seth Smith For Winning Their First South State Championship Title And Making Its First Appearance In The Mississippi High School Activities Association's Class 4a State Championship Game.

1713.title: Chancellor Terrill Moffett; commend and congratulate upon his retirement.
1713.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Chancellor And Retired Major General Terrill Moffett Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As Chancellor.

1714.title: Tony Brown; commend football success as running back for the East Central High School Hornets Football Team.
1714.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Honoring The Many Accomplishments Of Tony Brown And The Inspirational Role He Played In The Lives Of Each Of His Football Teammates And The Entire Jackson County, Mississippi, Community.

1715.title: Mrs. Beatrice White Roots; commend and congratulate on the occasion of her 100th birthday.
1715.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Longevity Of Mrs. Beatrice White Roots And Congratulating Her On Celebrating The Occasion Of Her 100th Birthday On January 28, 2018.

1716.title: Brigadier General Samuel P. Mitchell, Jr.; commend life and service upon his passing.
1716.description: A Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Air Force Brigadier General Samuel P. Mitchell, Jr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1717.title: Ms. Andrea' Hightower; commend on being crowned Miss Mississippi Collegiate 2018.
1717.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ms. Andrea' Hightower On Being Crowned Miss Mississippi Collegiate 2018, And For Her Many Impressive Accomplishments.

1718.title: Germantown High School Marching Band; commend and congratulate upon winning the Class 5A State Marching Championship.
1718.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Germantown High School Marching Band And Director Justin Harvison For Winning The 2017 Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 5a State Marching Championship.

1719.title: Peggy Jean Connor; commend life and legacy of service upon her passing.
1719.description: A Resolution Celebrating The Life And Mourning The Loss Of Civil Rights Icon Peggy Jean Connor, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends.

1720.title: Tyler Pearson; commend upon being named 2017 World Championship Steer Wrestler.
1720.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Tyler Pearson For Capturing The Title Of World Champion Steer Wrestler At The 2017 Wrangler National Finals Rodeo In Las Vegas, Nevada.

1721.title: Larry Grantham; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1721.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Career Of Ole Miss And Mississippi Sports Legend Larry Grantham And Extending Condolences To His Surviving Family.

1722.title: Mr. Percy Alehman "Snakeman" King; commend life upon his passing.
1722.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mr. Percy Alehman "snakeman" King, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1723.title: Second Lieutenant Colonel John White; commend military service upon retirement from Mississippi Air National Guard.
1723.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Valor And Selflessness Of Second Lieutenant Colonel John White Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Mississippi Air National Guard After 33 Years Of Exceptional Service.

1724.title: Climentine Richardson Williams; commend her life and legacy upon her passing.
1724.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Climentine "climmie" Richardson Williams.

1796.description: A Resolution Commending Elder Clifton Goodloe, Jr., For His Outstanding Dedication And Tremendous Service To His Church And To His Community.

1799.title: Glen Collins; commend contributions to community made by MSU SEC Football legend 2013.
1799.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mr. Glen Collins On His Many Accomplishments On And Off The Football Field And His Recognition As A Southeastern Conference Football Legend In 2013 For His Exceptional College Football Career At Mississippi State University From 1978 To 1981.

1800.title: Mr. Tyrone Keys; commend for athletic accomplishments and creating the "All Sports Community Service" organization.
1800.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mr. Tyrone Keys On His Many Accomplishments As A National Football League Legend And Former Member Of The Chicago Bears 1985 Super Bowl Xx Winning Team And Creating The "all Sports Community Service" Organization Which Is Dedicated To Helping Disadvantaged Youth.

1801.title: Lyme Disease Awareness Month; declare the month of May 2018 as.
1801.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring The Month Of May 2018 As "lyme Disease Awareness Month."

1802.title: Constitution; amend to move general state elections.
1802.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 34, 35, 116, 133, 134, 135, 168, 171, 173 And 174, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The State Officers Elected At The Election Held On The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November 2023 Shall Hold Office For Only Three Years In Order To Move State And County General Elections To The Same Time As Congressional Elections, Starting With The 2026 Election.

1803.title: Constitution; amend to reconstitute the Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning.
1803.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reconstitute The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

1804.title: Constitution; amend to require preferential elections with no party affiliation.
1804.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Creating A New Section To Abolish Partisan Primaries And Repealing Sections 140, 141, 143 And 247; To Provide The Time For Holding Preferential And General Elections; To Provide That When Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For An Office, Such Person's Name Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That The Name Of The Candidate Who Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast For Such Office In The Preferential Elections, And Name Only, Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That When No Candidate Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast In The Preferential Election For An Office, The Names Of The Two Candidates Who Receive The Highest Number Of Votes In The Preferential Election Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot As Candidates For Such Office; To Require The Legislature To Enact General Laws For Carrying Out The Provisions Of This Constitutional Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1805.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the Legislature shall meet in regular session only once every two years for 125 days.
1805.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2024, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; To Provide That The Biennial Sessions Of The Legislature Shall Last For 125 Calendar Days; And For Related Purposes.

1806.title: Joint Session; call to hear the State of the State address of the Governor Phil Bryant.
1806.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1807.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1807.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 140 And Repealing Sections 141 And 142 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1808.title: Constitution; amend to authorize the Legislature to grant certain authority for metropolitan governmental creation.
1808.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Require The Legislature To Enact General Laws, And To Authorize The Enactment Of Local And Private Laws, Which Authorize And Prescribe The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1809.title: Constitution; amend to lower the minimum age to serve in the Mississippi House of Representatives to 18 years of age.
1809.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 41, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Lower The Minimum Age To Serve As A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives From Twenty-one To Eighteen Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1810.title: Constitution; amend to lower the minimum age to serve in the Mississippi State Senate to 18 years of age.
1810.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 42, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Lower The Minimum Age To Serve As A Member Of The Mississippi State Senate From Twenty-five To Eighteen Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1811.title: Slavery; issue an apology for the State of Mississippi's role in and urge reconciliation.
1811.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, Expressing Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, And Urging Reconciliation.

1812.title: Declare August 2018 as "Take Your Child for a Medical Check-up" month.
1812.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring The Month Of August 2018 As "take Your Child For A Medical Check-up Month," And Encouraging Citizens Of The State To Acknowledge This Observance.

1813.title: Constitution; amend to reduce assessment ratio for motor vehicles.
1813.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 112, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reduce The Assessment Ratio For Motor Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

1814.title: Constitution; amend to require the members of the State school Board of Education to be elected.
1814.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 203, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2020, The Members Of The State Board Of Education Shall No Longer Be Appointed And The Board Shall Be Comprised Of One Member Elected From Each Congressional District Of The State And One Member Elected From The State At Large; To Provide That The Terms Of The Elected Board Members Are For Four Years; To Provide That A Board Member May Be Removed By A Three-fifths Vote Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives; And For Related Purposes.

1815.title: Brandon High School Volleyball Team; commend on winning the 2017 Class III State Championship.
1815.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Brandon High School Volleyball Team And Coach Kelsa D. Walker On Winning The 2017 Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class Iii Volleyball Championship, And For An Overall Outstanding Season.

1816.title: Constitution; amend to require the Legislature to review administrative rules that would significantly impact the state budget.
1816.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Require The Legislature To Review Each Administrative Rule Promulgated By A State Agency Which Would Effect The State Budget By Ten Percent Or More; To Provide That Any Such Rule Would Become Effective At The End Of The Next Legislative Session Unless The Legislature Disapproves Of The Rule By A Resolution Adopted By Both Houses; And For Related Purposes.

1817.title: "Tuskegee Airmen Commemoration Day"; designate fourth Thursday in March as.
1817.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The Fourth Thursday In March, As "tuskegee Airmen Commemoration Day" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Special Observance Of The Heroic Men Who Served As Tuskegee Airmen On That Date Each Year.

1818.title: Bogue Chitto Lady Bobcats Softball Team; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 1A Fast-pitch Softball State Championship.
1818.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Bogue Chitto Attendance Center "lady Bobcats" Fast-pitch Softball Team And Head Coach Scott Leggett Upon Winning Their Fourth Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 1a Fast-pitch Softball State Championship.

1819.title: Neshoba Central High School Lady Rockets; commend on winning the 2017 MHSAA Class III Slow-pitch Softball Championship.
1819.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Neshoba Central High School Lady Rockets And Head Coach Trae Embry On Winning The 2017 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class Iii Slow-pitch Softball Championship.

1820.title: Lieutenant Colonel Mike Hogan; commend upon his retirement.
1820.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Meritorious Service Of Lieutenant Colonel Dr. Michael B. Hogan, Rendered To The United States Of America, And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1821.title: Dysautonomia Awareness Month; acknowledge and observe during the month of October 2018.
1821.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Observing October 2018, As "dysautonomia Awareness Month" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance During The Month Of October 2018.

1822.title: Constitution; amend to abolish existing State Department of Education and transfer powers and duties to Division of Public Education in Office of the Governor.
1822.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 203 And Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Abolish The Existing State Department Of Education And Transfer The Powers And Duties To The Office Of The Governor; To Provide That The Former State Department Of Education Shall Be Known As The Division Of Public Education In The Office Of The Governor; And For Related Purposes.

1823.title: Honorable Representative Tyrone Ellis; commend esteemed and laudable legislative career and public service of.
1823.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Esteemed And Laudable Legislative Career And Public Service Of The Most Honorable And Distinguished Gentleman From Oktibbeha, Former Representative Tyrone Ellis.

1824.title: Pearl High School Football Team; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 6A State Championship.
1824.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pearl High School Pirates Football Team And Head Coach John Perry For Winning The School's First Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Football Championship.

1825.title: Constitution; amend to provide automatic restoration of suffrage for persons convicted of nonviolent crimes.
1825.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Automatic Restoration Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of Nonviolent Crime, After A Period Of Five Years From The Completion Of Any Sentence, Probation And/or Payment Of Restitution; And For Related Purposes.

1826.title: Women's Equality Day in Mississippi; designate August 26, 2018, as.
1826.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating August 26, 2018, As Women's Equality Day In Mississippi And Recognizing The Important Milestone Of Women's Suffrage.

1827.title: Department of Revenue; urge to establish tax amnesty program for liabilities that accrued after January 1, 2005, and before December 31, 2015.
1827.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Department Of Revenue To Establish An Amnesty Program For Taxpayers Having An Unpaid Tax Liability Due After January 1, 2005, And Before December 21, 2015.

1828.title: Congress: urge to call a convention of the states under Article V of the United States Constitution to propose amendments limited to balancing the federal budget.
1828.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying To The United States Congress To Call A Convention Of The States Under The Provisions Of Article V Of The Constitution Of The United States For The Purpose Of Proposing Amendments Limited To Balancing The Federal Budget; And For Related Purposes.

1829.title: Statue of James Zachariah George; request the Joint Committee on the Library of Congress to approve the replacement of with a statue of B.B. King.
1829.description: A Concurrent Resolution Formally Requesting The Joint Committee On The Library Of Congress To Approve The Replacement Of The Statue Of James Zachariah George That Is Displayed In Statuary Hall In The Capitol Of The United States With A Statue Of Blues Legend B.b. King.

1830.title: Joint Rules; amend to limit introduction of general bills requiring majority vote to sessions in even-numbered years.
1830.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend The Joint Rules Of The Mississippi Senate And House Of Representatives By Creating New Joint Rule 18a To Limit The Introduction Of General Bills Requiring A Majority Vote For Passage To Regular Legislative Sessions Occurring In Even-numbered Years.

1831.title: Wheeler Volunteer Fire Department; commend upon occasion of its 50th anniversary.
1831.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Wheeler Volunteer Fire Department Upon The Momentous Occasion Of Its 50th Anniversary.

1832.title: Joint Rules; amend to create a procedure for issuance of ethnic disparity impact statements.
1832.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Create New Joint Rule No. 41 To Provide A Procedure For The Issuance Of A Racial And Ethnic Disparity Impact Statement For Every Bill, Concurrent Resolution And Amendment Which Proposes A Change In The Law That Creates A Public Offense.

1833.title: Vernon Perry; commend career and contributions of.
1833.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Career, Success And Contributions Of Mr. Vernon Perry As President Of The Mississippi Chapter Of The National Football League Players' Association.

1834.title: "Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) Awareness Day"; designate May 17, 2018, as day of awareness in Mississippi.
1834.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Designate May 17, 2018, As "diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (dipg) Awareness Day" In Mississippi.

1835.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit local governments from imposing upon any real property an ad valorem tax rate of more than 200 mills without the consent of the property owners.
1835.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Article 14, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section To Provide That, Except For Drainage Purposes, No Local Government Shall Impose Upon Any Real Property In The State An Ad Valorem Tax Rate Of More Than 200 Mills Without The Consent Of The Property Owners To Which The Tax Would Apply; And For Related Purposes.

1836.title: Honorable Judge Tommy Gardner; commend service of and congratulate upon the occasion of his retirement.
1836.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Esteemed Legal And Judicial Career And Public Service Of The Honorable Judge Tommy Gardner Rendered To The Citizens Of Mississippi As Senior Circuit Court Judge For The First Circuit Court District And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1837.title: Judge Jim Pounds; commend and recognize on outstanding professional accomplishments and tremendous community service.
1837.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Honorable Jim Pounds On His Remarkable Professional Accomplishments And Outstanding Community Service.

1838.title: Gaming; request Executive Directors of MGC and PEER to develop map for Mississippi Coast eligible geographic area.
1838.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission And The Executive Director Of The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review To Develop A Map Indicating The Geographic Area On The Mississippi Coast That Is Eligible For Licensed Gaming Under State Law.

1839.title: The Big Apple Inn; commend.
1839.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging The History And Commending The Success Of The Big Apple Inn On Farish Street.

1841.title: Senator Robert H. "Rob" Smith; commend life and service upon his passing.
1841.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Remembering The Dedicated Public Service Of Former State Representative And Former State Senator, Robert H. "rob" Smith And Extending Condolences To His Bereaved Family Upon His Passing.

1842.title: Dr. Rudyard Beal Robison; commend life and legacy of service upon his passing.
1842.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Many Accomplishments Of Dr. Rudyard Beal "rud" Robison, And Expressing Our Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1843.title: National Physician Anesthesiologists Week; acknowledge and recognize.
1843.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Recognizing The Service Of Physician Anesthesiologists Who Have Developed Techniques And Protocols That Have Greatly Improved The Safety Of Anesthesia And The Well-being Of Surgical Patients Each Day And To Acknowledge The Observance Of "national Physician Anesthesiologists Week" During The Week Of January 28, 2018, Through February 3, 2018.

1844.title: Lorene "Lori" C. Moore; commend life and express sympathy upon passing of.
1844.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of A Great Citizen And Public Servant Lorene "lori" C. Moore And Expressing Deep Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1845.title: Fannie Lou Hamer; request the Joint Committee on the Library of Congress to approve the replacement of the statue of James Zachariah George with a statue of.
1845.description: A Concurrent Resolution Formally Requesting The Joint Committee On The Library Of Congress To Approve The Replacement Of The Statue Of James Zachariah George That Is Displayed In Statuary Hall In The United States Capitol With A Statue Of Civil Rights Icon Fannie Lou Hamer.

1846.title: Mize High School Marching Band; commend on winning MHSAA Class 2A State Championship.
1846.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mize High School Marching Band And Band Director Patrick Vincent For Winning The 2017 Mississippi Bandmasters Association/mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 2a State Marching Band Championship.

1847.title: Reverend Rodney Duke; commend for service in United States Navy and as a minister of the Methodist faith.
1847.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Courage And Bravery Of Reverend Rodney Duke And Commending His Distinguished Service In The United States Navy, And His Service As A Minister Of The Methodist Faith.

1848.title: State Library; commend upon its 200th year anniversary.
1848.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The State Library Upon The Spectacular Occasion Of Its 200th Anniversary.

1849.title: 100 Black Men of Jackson, Inc.; commend on service to community in 2017.
1849.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Members Of 100 Black Men Of Jackson, Inc., On Their Outstanding Service To The Jackson, Mississippi, Community In 2017.

1850.title: Hopewell Baptist Church; commend on occasion of its 190th anniversary.
1850.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending Hopewell Baptist Church Upon The Momentous Occasion Of Its 190th Anniversary.

1851.title: International Women's Day; acknowledge and observe on March 8, 2018.
1851.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Observing March 8, 2018, As "international Women's Day" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance On March 8, 2018.

1852.title: Mt. Zion Baptist Church; commend upon the occasion of its 175th anniversary.
1852.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Diligence, Service And Wide Influence Of The Pastors And Members Of Mt. Zion Baptist Church On The Occasion Of The Church's Historic 175th Anniversary.

1853.title: U.S. Constitution; submit application to Congress to call a convention of the states under Article V to propose amendments limited to certain restraints on federal government.
1853.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying To The United States Congress To Call A Convention Of The States Under The Provisions Of Article V Of The United States Constitution.

1854.title: Republic of China (Taiwan) and Mississippi; encourage further economic ties and friendship between.
1854.description: A Concurrent Resolution Encouraging Further Economic Ties And Friendship Between The Republic Of China (taiwan) And The State Of Mississippi.

1855.title: Johnny "Bootsy" Morrow; commend on establishment of museum.
1855.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Outstanding Service Of Mr. Johnny "bootsy" Morrow And His Dedication To Preserving Mississippi's Unique And Diverse History In The Establishment Of His Museum, "the Room," In Jackson, Mississippi.

1856.title: West Point High School; commend on winning Class 5A State Football Championship.
1856.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The West Point High School Football Team And Head Coach Chris Chambless For Their Outstanding 2017 Season And For Winning Their Second Straight Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 5a State Football Championship.

1857.title: Simpson County Academy Cross Country Team; commend on winning the MAIS Division II State Championship.
1857.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Simpson County Academy Lady Cougars Cross Country Team For Their Outstanding Season And For Winning The 2017 Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools (mais) Division Ii State Championship.

1858.title: David and the Giants; commend on 50th anniversary.
1858.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Band David And The Giants For Their Positive Impact And Wide Influence On The Momentous Occasion Of The Band's 50th Anniversary.

1859.title: Judge John Andrew Hatcher, Jr.; commend upon his retirement as Chancery Court Judge for District One.
1859.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service That The Honorable Judge John Andrew Hatcher, Jr., Provided As The Chancery Court Judge Of The First Chancery Court District Of Mississippi, Place 1, Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1860.title: Sergeant Major Paul Collier; commend upon occasion of his retirement from the United States Army.
1860.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The 40 Years Of Military Service Of Sergeant Major Paul Collier Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From The United States Army.

1861.title: Simpson County Academy Football Team; commend on finishing as runner-up in the Class 4A Division II State Championship.
1861.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Simpson Academy Football Team For Their Outstanding Season And For Finishing As Runner-up In The Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools (mais) Class 4a Division Ii State Championship.
