1862.title: Walter Anderson Day; proclaim September 29, 2018, as.
1862.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proclaiming September 29, 2018, As "walter Anderson Day" In Honor Of The Late Brilliant And Influential Mississippi Artist And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance On September 29, 2018.

1863.title: Taylorsville High School Softball Team; commend upon winning 2017 MHSAA Class 2A Fast-pitch Softball State Championship.
1863.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2017 Taylorsville High School Fast-pitch Softball Team, Head Coach Mason Grissom And Assistant Coach Joseph White Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 2a Fast-pitch Softball State Championship.

1864.title: Donate Life Month; designate April 2018 as.
1864.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating April 2018 As "donate Life Month" In Mississippi.

1865.title: Speech and Debate Education Day; designate March 2, 2018, as in Mississippi.
1865.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating March 2, 2018, As "speech And Debate Education Day" In Mississippi.

1866.title: Fletcher Cox; commend and congratulate upon being a member of Super Bowl LII Champions Philadelphia Eagles.
1866.description: A Concurrent Resolution Saluting Mississippi's Native Son And National Football League's Defensive Tackle Extraordinaire, Fletcher Cox, Upon A Successful Season With The Philadelphia Eagles And Becoming A Super Bowl Lii Champion.

1867.title: Murrah Concert Singers; commend for being invited to participate at festival in Italy.
1867.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Murrah High School Murrah Concert Singers For Their Outstanding Choral Achievements And For Being Invited To Participate At The Worldstrides Onstage Festival Concert Tour In Italy.

1868.title: Dr. Ronnie McGehee; commend upon occasion of his retirement as superintendent from the Madison County School District.
1868.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Superintendent Dr. Ronnie Mcgehee Upon The Momentous Occasion Of His Retirement From The Madison County School District After 21 Years Of Dedicated Service.

1869.title: Bob Wedgeworth; commend upon the occasion of his retirement.
1869.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mr. Bob Wedgeworth For His Distinguished Career, Meritorious Leadership And Tremendous Service Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1870.title: Dr. Ronald E. Nettles II; commend upon the occasion of his retirement as President of Copiah-Lincoln Community College.
1870.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Exemplary And Dedicated Services Of Dr. Ronald E. Nettles Ii, And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As President Of Copiah-lincoln Community College.

1871.title: Frederick A. Tucei; commend and congratulate on the occasion of his 100th birthday.
1871.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Acknowledging The Life Of Mr. Frederick Aloysius Tucei And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of Celebrating His 100th Birthday.

1872.title: Robert Brazile; commend upon induction into NFL Hall of Fame.
1872.description: A Concurrent Resolution Joining Professional Football In Congratulating Former Jackson State University And National Football League Star Linebacker Robert Brazile Upon The Occasion Of His Induction Into The 2018 Class Of The Nfl Hall Of Fame.

1873.title: Noah Barberi; commend for being named both a Truman Scholar and a Rhodes Scholar.
1873.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mr. Noah Barbieri For His Exceptional Dedication To Academic Excellence And For Being Named Both A Truman Scholar And A Rhodes Scholar.

1874.title: Dr. Lee Royce; commend service upon his retirement as President of Mississippi College.
1874.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service Of President Lee Gardner Royce Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The President Of Mississippi College.

1875.title: Calvin "Cal" Hobbs; commend life and legacy as a member of the Tuskegee Airmen.
1875.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Life, Legacy And Heroic Accomplishments Of Calvin "cal" Hobbs, A Member Of The Legendary Tuskegee Airmen Of World War Ii.

1876.title: Pat Robertson; commend upon her retirement as Executive Director of PERS.
1876.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Pat Robertson Upon Her Retirement As Executive Director Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Of Mississippi.

1877.title: Commander Joseph Allen LaCour; commend life and service upon his passing.
1877.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Valiant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Navy Commander Joseph Allen Lacour, Jr., Upon His Passing.

1878.title: Remanufacturing (Reman) Day 2018; declare April 12 as.
1878.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring April 12, 2018, As Remanufacturing (reman) Day.

1879.title: Magnuson-Stevens Act; encourage revisions that will provide better use of and access to the nation's fisheries.
1879.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Encourage Revisions To The Magnuson-stevens Act That Will Provide Better Use Of And Access To The Nation's Fisheries.

1880.title: Gulfport High School Boys Soccer Team; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 6A State Championship.
1880.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2017-2018 Gulfport High School Boys Soccer Team, Head Coach Henrik Madsen And Assistant Coaches Patrick Wadsworth And Fredy Clavijo Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Boys Soccer State Championship.

1881.title: Germantown High School Girls Soccer Team; commend for winning the MHSAA Class 5A State Championship.
1881.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Germantown High School Lady Mavericks Soccer Team For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 5a Girls Soccer State Championship For The First Time In School History.

1882.title: Gaming; request Executive Directors of MGC, PEER and DMR and the Secretary of State to develop map for MS Coast eligible areas.
1882.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission, The Executive Director Of The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review, The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources, And The Secretary Of State To Develop A Map Indicating The Geographic Area On The Mississippi Coast That Is Eligible For Licensed Gaming Under State Law.

1883.title: MS Celebrating Women in Public Office Day; declare March 19, 2018 as.
1883.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring March 2018 As Women's History Month And March 19, 2018, As Mississippi Celebrating Women In Public Office Day.

1884.title: Chief Master Sergeant John K. Carson; commend distinguished career upon the occasion of his retirement.
1884.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Meritorious Service That Chief Master Sergeant John K. Carson Rendered To The United States Of America, And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1885.title: Denise LaSalle; mourn loss and commemorate life and stellar music career of upon her passing.
1885.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Stellar Music Career Of Mississippi Blues And Soul Legend Denise Lasalle And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1887.title: Reverend Melvin Boles; commemorate life, mourn loss and express sympathy upon his passing.
1887.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Reverend Melvin Boles, And Extending Deepest Sympathy To His Family, Friends And Parishioners Upon His Passing.

1888.title: Driver's licenses; state opposition to federal law requiring states to enact laws requiring the suspension of for persons who are convicted of certain drug offenses.
1888.description: A Concurrent Resolution Stating The Legislature's Opposition To The Enactment Or Enforcement Of A Law That Meets The Requirement Of 23 Uscs Section 159, Which Requires That The Driver's Licenses Of Persons Convicted Of Drug Offenses Be Revoked Or Suspended For A Period Of Six Months, Regardless Of Whether The Offense Was Related To The Operation Of A Motor Vehicle.

1889.title: Lawrence County High School Lady Cougars Basketball Team; congratulate upon first state championship.
1889.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Lawrence County High School Lady Cougars Basketball Team And Head Coach Vicki Rutland For Winning Lawrence County High School's First Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 4a Girls State Basketball Championship.

1891.title: Fair Housing Act; recognize the 50th anniversary of its enactment.
1891.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commemorating The 50th Anniversary Of The Enactment Of The Fair Housing Act.

1892.title: Locust Grove Missionary Baptist Church; commend upon occasion of its 150th anniversary.
1892.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Diligence, Service And Wide Influence Of The Pastors And Members Of Locust Grove Missionary Baptist Church On The Occasion Of The Church's Historic 150th Year Anniversary.

1894.title: Davis Magnet IB Elementary School; commend for being rated as the number one performing elementary school in the state.
1894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Davis Magnet Ib Elementary School For Being Rated As The Number One Performing Elementary School In The State Of Mississippi.

1895.title: Doris McCool Osborne; commemorate life and mourn loss.
1895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The Life And Mourning The Loss Of Mrs. Doris Mccool Osborne And Expressing Deep Sympathy To Her Family Upon Her Passing.

1896.title: Doctor's Day in Mississippi; designate March 30, 2018, as.
1896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating March 30, 2018, As Doctor's Day In Mississippi And Recognizing The Service Of The Doctors Of The Day Who Serve The Mississippi Legislature During The 2018 Regular Session.

1898.title: Dr. Glenda Baskin Glover; commend upon being elected the 30th International President of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc.
1898.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Glenda Baskin Glover Upon Being Elected As The 30th International President Of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc.

1899.title: Poppy Month; designate May 2018 as in Mississippi.
1899.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating May 2018 As Poppy Month In Mississippi.

1900.title: Senator Thad Cochran; commend upon his retirement after 46 years representing Mississippi in Washington D.C.
1900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Lasting Legacy Of Retiring United States Senator William Thad Cochran.

1901.title: Choctaw Central Lady Warriors Basketball Team; congratulate on 7th championship and back-to-back championship wins.
1901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2018 Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Choctaw Central Lady Warriors Basketball Team On Winning Their Seventh Class 3a State Championship And Being Back-to-back Champions.

1902.title: Access to Justice Month; declare June 2018 as month of observance in Mississippi.
1902.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Exceptional Works Of The Mississippi Access To Justice Commission On Its 12th Year Anniversary And Declaring The Month Of June 2018 As Access To Justice Month In The State Of Mississippi.

1903.title: Joint Resolution; authorizing competitive bidding for office space in the New Capitol.
1903.description: A Joint Resolution Of The House Management Committee Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives And The Rules Committee Of The Mississippi State Senate Requiring The Committees, Meeting As A Joint Committee, Authorizing Competitive Bidding For Certain Space On The Fourth Floor Of The New Capitol Building, And Authorizing Reallocation Of The Space If No Acceptable Payment Is Received.

1904.title: Alteration or renaming of historical monuments, memorials and streets; prohibit and provide sanctions.
1904.description: An Act To Amend Section 55-15-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Provisions Of The Statutory Prohibition Against The Alteration Of Historical Monuments And Memorials Located On Public Property; To Prohibit The Renaming Or Rededication Of Certain Statutes, Monuments, Schools, Streets, Parks Or Similar Structures Named In Honor Of Certain Military Units, Figures Or Events; To Provide Criminal Sanctions For Violation Of This Statute; To Provide That This Section Shall Be Known As The "mississippi Heritage Protection Act Of 2018"; And For Related Purposes.

1905.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to assist Adams County in replacing the Old Kingston School building.
1905.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Adams County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Construction To Replace The Old Kingston School Building In Adams County; And For Related Purposes.

1906.title: Natchez-Adams Special Municipal Separate School District; elect members of school board.
1906.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Board Of Trustees Of The Natchez-adams Special Municipal Separate School District To Be Elected; To Provide That The New Natchez-adams County School Board Shall Be Elected From Districts That Are The Same As The Board Of Supervisors Districts; To Provide That The Election For The School Board Shall Be A Nonpartisan Election; To Prescribe The Procedures To Be Used If A Vacancy Occurs On The School Board; To Provide That The Candidate With The Highest Number Of Votes Shall Be Declared Elected; To Amend Sections 23-15-193, 37-7-705, 37-7-707, 37-7-709, 37-7-711, 37-7-713, 37-7-715 And 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1907.title: Local school board members; prescribe salary scale based upon school district student enrollment.
1907.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Salary For Local School Board Members Based On School District Student Enrollment; And For Related Purposes.

1908.title: Marissa's Law; enact.
1908.description: An Act To Create Marissa's Law; To Amend Section 97-3-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Mandatory Minimum Sentence For Kidnapping Of A Child Under The Age Of 16, And To Require That The Minimum Mandatory Sentence May Not Be Suspended Or Deferred; To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Mandatory Minimum Sentence For Rape Of A Child Under The Age Of 16, And To Require That The Minimum Mandatory Sentence May Not Be Suspended Or Deferred; To Amend Section 97-3-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Mandatory Minimum Sentence For Sexual Battery Of A Child Under The Age Of 16, And To Require That The Minimum Mandatory Sentence May Not Be Suspended Or Deferred; To Create New Section 99-19-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Period Of Supervision For A Sex Offender If Any Part Of The Offender's Sentence Is Deferred Or Suspended; And For Related Purposes.

1909.title: Legislative member election contests; person who brings and loses contest must pay attorney's fees and costs.
1909.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-955, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The House Of Representatives And The Senate To Award Attorney's Fees And Costs Against An Unsuccessful Petitioner In A Legislative Election Contest; And For Related Purposes.

1910.title: Appropriation FY2019; pilot programs for legal representation for indigent parents in child abuse cases.
1910.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Office Of The State Public Defender Of Mississippi, For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funding For Pilot Programs To Provide Legal Representation To Indigent Parents In Abuse And Neglect And Termination Of Parents Rights Cases For Fy2019; And For Related Purposes.

1911.title: Bonds; authorize for Phase II of construction of a new headquarters building for the Department of Public Safety.
1911.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Phase Ii Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Headquarters Building For The Department Of Public Safety; And For Related Purposes.

1912.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of bonds for capital improvements at the State Fire Academy.
1912.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The Mississippi State Fire Academy; And For Related Purposes.

1913.title: Government self-insurance programs; authorize Commissioner of Insurance to conduct examinations of.
1913.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-46-20, 19-7-7 And 37-7-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Conduct An Examination Of Certain Self-insurance Programs Providing Coverage To Governmental Entities; And For Related Purposes.

1914.title: SREB contract program at out-of-state college of optometry; students not required to practice in Mississippi.
1914.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-135-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Participating In The Southern Regional Education Board (sreb) Contract Program At Any College Of Optometry Outside Of The State Shall Not Be Required To Return To The State Of Mississippi To Practice After Graduation; And For Related Purposes.

1915.title: Headlights; require use of when windshield wipers necessary.
1915.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Use Of Headlights Whenever Driving Conditions Necessitate The Use Of Windshield Wipers; And For Related Purposes.

1916.title: Adequate education program appropriation and local school district budgets to identify program funding categories; require.
1916.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Adequate Education Program Appropriation Bill To Identify Program Funding Categories; To Amend Section 37-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School District Budgets To Contain A Detailed Statement Of The Estimated Amounts To Be Expended By Program Budget Categories And The Amount Of Such Categories To Be Paid From Adequate Education Program Funds And From Local Revenue And Other Sources; To Amend Section 37-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School District Expenditures To Be Limited To The Specific Budget Categories And To Provide Personal Liability Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

1917.title: Bonds; authorize for the Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center.
1917.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Building, Equipping And Furnishing Facilities At The Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center In Tremont, Mississippi, And To Provide Funds For The Purchase Of Additional Land For The Center; And For Related Purposes.

1919.title: Appropriation MDE FY2018; reduce funding for State Department of Education and transfer to classroom supplies.
1919.description: An Act To Amend Section 1 Of Chapter 102, Laws Of 2017, (house Bill No. 1502) To Reduce The General Fund Appropriation To The State Department Of Education And Transfer Those Funds To The Teacher Instructional Materials Fund For Fiscal Year 2018.

1920.title: Appropriation FY2019; Civil Rights historical markers in Clinton, Mississippi.
1920.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History, For The Purpose Providing Appropriate Civil Rights Historical Markers In The City Of Clinton For Fy2019.

1921.title: High performance school districts; authorize local school boards to operate under same rules as charter schools.
1921.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards Of School Districts With An Accreditation Rating Of "a," "b" Or "c" To Exempt Itself From Any Compulsory Standard Of Accreditation By The State Department Of Education Which Is Not Required By Statute With Certain Exceptions, And To Operate Under The Same Guidelines As Charter Schools Are Allowed To Operate; And For Related Purposes.

1922.title: Sales taxation; exempt purchases for fund-raising the Ducks Unlimited, Inc., chapters.
1922.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Purchases Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services By Ducks Unlimited, Inc., Chapters, If Such Property Or Services Are Purchased For Resale As A Part Of The Fund-raising Activities Of The Chapter; And For Related Purposes.

1923.title: Insurance agents; exempt age 75 or older from continuing education requirements.
1923.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-17-251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Requirements Of Continuing Education Insurance Agents Who Are 75 Years Of Age Or Older And Have Held An Agent's License For At Least Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1924.title: Motor vehicle privilege tax; increase the period of time within which a newly acquired motor vehicle must be registered.
1924.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From Seven Working Days To 25 Working Days The Period Of Time Within Which A Newly Acquired Motor Vehicle Must Be Registered; To Amend Sections 27-19-40, 27-19-141 And 63-21-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1925.title: Statutory rape; relieve children who are close in age from criminal responsibility.
1925.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Statutory Rape To Relieve Children Who Are Close In Age From Criminal Responsibility; To Amend Section 97-3-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Sexual Battery To Relieve Children Who Are Close In Age From Criminal Responsibility; And For Related Purposes.

1926.title: Statutory rape; must be knowing and willful.
1926.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Knowledge And Willfulness In Order To Convict For Statutory Rape; And For Related Purposes.

1927.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of for drainage improvements to Foster Creek in and near the Town of Crosby.
1927.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Drainage Improvements To Foster Creek In And Near The Town Of Crosby, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1928.title: "Meet My Mississippi"; designate as official state poem.
1928.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Be Codified As Section 3-3-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate "meet My Mississippi" As The Official State Poem; And For Related Purposes.

1929.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist in the repair and renovation of the historic Rodney Presbyterian Church.
1929.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Rodney Foundation, Inc., In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of The Historic Rodney Presbyterian Church In The Rodney Center Historic District; And For Related Purposes.

1930.title: Blowout prevention; require training course for rig workers.
1930.description: An Act To Amend Section 53-1-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Blowout-prevention Training Courses For Rig Workers; And For Related Purposes.

1931.title: Public waterways; landowner not liable for illegal use of ATVs in public waters.
1931.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-1-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Persons Using All-terrain Vehicles In Public Waterways Without Permission Of Landowner Are Not Entitled To Recover Damages Against Such Landowner For Injuries; And For Related Purposes.

1932.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds to repair & renovate the Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center.
1932.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center In Natchez, Mississippi, Which Is Designated A Mississippi Landmark By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; And For Related Purposes.

1933.title: Income and franchise tax; allow refundable credit for costs of purchasing/installing solar energy system or energy efficiency services.
1933.description: An Act To Authorize An Income And/or Franchise Tax Credit Equal To A Certain Amount Of The Cost Of Purchasing And Installing Solar Energy Systems And Energy Efficiency Services; To Provide The Manner In Which The Credit May Be Claimed; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income And/or Franchise Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

1934.title: Wildlife; allow mentally handicapped persons to hunt during special youth season and exempt from license requirements.
1934.description: An Act To Allow Mentally Handicapped Persons To Hunt During Any Special Youth Season Established By The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks; To Exempt Those Persons From Obtaining A License; And For Related Purposes.

1935.title: Civil offense; clarify jurisdiction of municipal courts over.
1935.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Jurisdiction Of Municipal Courts Over Civil Violations; To Amend Sections 21-13-19 And Section 1-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1936.title: Statute of limitations; except sexual battery without regard to victim's age.
1936.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Two-year Statute Of Limitations On Crimes Will Not Run Against The Crime Of Sexual Battery; And For Related Purposes.

1937.title: Surplus county road department equipment; authorize transfer to other county departments.
1937.description: An Act To Create New Section 65-17-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Transfer Of Surplus County Road Department Equipment To Any Other Department Of County Government If Such Transfer Would Promote The Best Interest Of The County Government And Such Transfer Was Approved By A Unanimous Vote Of The Board Of Supervisors Of The County; And For Related Purposes.

1938.title: Bonds; authorize Taylorsville to utilize certain excess bond proceeds for road projects.
1938.description: An Act To Amend Section 6, Chapter 472, Laws Of 2015, To Authorize Certain Excess Proceeds Of Certain Bonds Issued For The Purpose Of Assisting The City Of Taylorsville, Mississippi, In Paying The Cost Of Certain Projects, To Be Utilized By The City For Road Projects In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1939.title: Possession of precursor chemicals; allow conviction to be expunged.
1939.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Conviction For Possession Of Precursor Chemicals May Be Expunged; And For Related Purposes.

1941.title: Medicaid Home and Community-Based Services for transitioning military; allow services for dependants with special needs.
1941.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Transitioning Active Duty Military Service Members To Use Their State Of Legal Residence To Qualify Their Dependents With Special Needs For Medicaid Home And Community-based Services (hcbs) In The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1942.title: Veterans; establish a permissive preference in private employment for certain veterans.
1942.description: An Act To Establish A Permissive Preference In Private Employment For Certain Veterans; To Provide That The Preferences Established In This Act Are Not Considered Violations Of Any State Or Local Equal Employment Opportunity Law; And For Related Purposes.

1943.title: Institutions of higher learning/community colleges; require the award of educational credits for military training or service.
1943.description: An Act To Require The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And The Mississippi Community College Board To Adopt Policies Requiring The Award Of Educational Credits For Courses That Are Part Of A Student's Military Training Or Service; And For Related Purposes.

1944.title: Resident real estate broker license; revise qualifications for.
1944.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-35-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications For A Resident License As A Real Estate Broker; And For Related Purposes.

1945.title: State Board of Education; transfer powers and responsibilities to the Governor.
1945.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-1-1 Through 37-1-13 And 37-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Power And Responsibilities Of The State Board Of Education To The Office Of The Governor Effective January 1, 2019; And For Related Purposes.

1946.title: County veteran service officers; remove prohibition from holding any other elective or appointive position.
1946.description: An Act To Amend Section 35-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Language Prohibiting County Veteran Service Officers From Holding Any Other Elective Or Appointive Position; And For Related Purposes.

1947.title: Special judges; expand authority of Chief Justice to appoint.
1947.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-1-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Authority Of The Chief Justice To Appoint Special Judges To Serve In County Courts To Address Overcrowded County Court Dockets And To Clarify The Discretion Of The Chief Justice To Determine The Type Of Caseload To Be Handled By A Special Judge; And For Related Purposes.

1948.title: Mississippi Commission on College Accreditation; enhance regulatory authority.
1948.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-101-241, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide And Clarify The Authority Of The Mississippi Commission On College Accreditation To Regulate The Advertising, Solicitation Or Representation By Educational Institutions Or Their Agents In Order To Protect Students And Prevent Consumer Deception Relating To Fraudulent Or Substandard Degrees And To Establish Tuition And Fee Refund Policies; And For Related Purposes.

1949.title: Speed limit; set limit on state highway system at 65 miles per hour and increase interstate limit to 75 miles per hour.
1949.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-501, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set The Speed Limit On The Designated State Highway System At 65 Miles Per Hour; To Increase The Maximum Speed Limit For The Interstate Highway System And Controlled Access Highways With Four Or More Lanes To 75 Miles Per Hour; And For Related Purposes.

1950.title: Institutional research; authorized consent for minors to participate in research shall be in accordance with federal law.
1950.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-41-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Authorized Consent For Minors To Participate In Institutional Human Subject Research Shall Be Conducted In Accordance With Federal Law; And For Related Purposes.

1952.title: Department of Child Protection Services; PEER conduct annual evaluation.
1952.description: An Act To Require The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review (peer) To Conduct An Annual Expenditure Review Of Funds Expended By The Department Of Child Protection Services And The Department Of Human Services For The Delivery Of Child Protection Services For The Period July 1, 2016, To June 30, 2018; And For Related Purposes.

1953.title: IHL; must allocate funding for nonresident students to student financial aid programs.
1953.description: An Act To Provide That The Funding Allocation Model Employed By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Must Weight Nonresident Completed Credit Hours Based On The Percentage Of Nonresident Enrollment At Each Institution; To Establish Appropriate Weighting For Nonresident Credit Hour Completion; To Provide That The Difference In Funds Between The Board's 2013 Performance Allocation Funding Allocation Model And The Model With Appropriate Weighting Shall Be Set Aside To Fund Grant Awards Under The Higher Education Legislative Plan Grant Program; To Amend Sections 37-101-15 And 37-106-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1954.title: State funds; authorize excess to be invested in bonds issued, assumed or guaranteed by the Country of Israel.
1954.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-105-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Bonds Issued, Assumed Or Guaranteed By The Country Of Israel In The Investment Options For Excess State Funds; And For Related Purposes.

1955.title: Hunting and fishing licenses; not required if resident is an honorably discharged veteran.
1955.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Residents Of This State Who Are Active Duty Members Of The Armed Forces Of The United States To Hunt And Fish In This State Without A License Regardless Of Where They Are Serving On Active Duty; To Authorize Honorably Discharged Veterans Of The Armed Forces Of The United States Who Are Residents Of This State To Hunt And Fish In This State Without A License; And For Related Purposes.

1956.title: Common Core National Education Standards; State Board of Education shall replace with ELA Standards in 2018-2019 school year.
1956.description: An Act To Provide That Beginning With The 2018-2019 School Year The State Board Of Education Shall Replace The Common Core State Standards With The Ela Standards In Place In Several States; To Provide That The State Of Mississippi Shall Retain Sole Control Over The Development, Establishment And Revision Of Curriculum Standards; And For Related Purposes.

1957.title: Office of Public Safety Planning of the Mississippi Department of Public Safety; transfer to DFA.
1957.description: An Act To Transfer The Office Of Public Safety Planning Of The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration; To Amend Sections 45-1-2 And 27-104-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1959.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds for in the amount of $10,000,000.00.
1959.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1960.title: Vaccine safety; SDH require vaccine information statements to be supplied to individual receiving the vaccination.
1960.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Health Officer To Require Entities Providing Vaccines To Include Patient Vaccine Information Statements Approved By Federal Centers For Disease Control And Prevention To Be Supplied To The Individual Receiving The Vaccination; And For Related Purposes.

1961.title: Abortion; prohibit an abortion of an unborn human individual with a detectable heartbeat.
1961.description: An Act To Codify New Section 41-41-34.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit An Abortion Of An Unborn Human Individual With A Detectable Fetal Heartbeat Except When A Medical Emergency Necessitates; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Regulations For The Appropriate Methods Of Performing An Examination For The Presence Of A Fetal Heartbeat; To Amend Section 73-25-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Physician Performing An Abortion On A Pregnant Woman Before Determining If The Unborn Human Individual Has A Detectable Fetal Heartbeat Is Subject To License Revocation Or Disciplinary Action; And For Related Purposes.

1962.title: Vaccination required for school attendance; authorize exemption upon objection of parent on parental or philosophical grounds.
1962.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Child Will Be Exempt From The Requirement To Have Any Specific Vaccination In Order To Attend A School If The Child's Parent Or Guardian Submits To The School A Letter Or Affidavit That Documents Which Required Vaccinations Have Been Given, And Which Vaccinations Have Not Been Given On The Basis That They Are Contrary To His Or Her Philosophical Or Religious Beliefs; To Prescribe The Content To Be Included In The Letter Or Affidavit Submitted To The School District Or School Of Enrollment; And For Related Purposes.

1963.title: Agriculture; prohibit rules related to poultry products inspections which are more stringent than federal rules.
1963.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-33-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Poultry Producers Are Exempt From Certain State Regulations If The Poultry Producers Qualify For Exemption Under The Federal Poultry Products Inspection Act; To Amend Section 75-33-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce Shall Not Adopt Regulations Related To Exemptions Under The Poultry Products Inspection Act Which Are More Stringent Than Federal Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

1965.title: Probation and parole officers; limit number of cases that may be handled.
1965.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit To 100 The Number Of Cases That A Probation And Parole Officer May Handle At One Time; And For Related Purposes.

1966.title: School superintendent licensure; prescribe alternative qualifications under nontraditional route and by reciprocity.
1966.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Alternative Qualifications For Local School Superintendent Licensure Under The Nontraditional Route And By Reciprocity; And For Related Purposes.

1967.title: Munchausen by proxy; constitutes child and elder abuse.
1967.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Munchausen By Proxy Committed Against A Child Constitutes Child Abuse; To Amend Section 43-47-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Munchausen By Proxy Committed Against A Vulnerable Person Constitutes Abuse Of A Vulnerable Person; And For Related Purposes.

1968.title: Sixteenth Section School Land; authorize sale of land for commercial development under certain conditions.
1968.description: An Act To Amend Sections 29-3-27 And 29-3-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards To Sell Sixteenth Section School Land For Commercial Development Under The Same Conditions That They Are Authorized To Sell Such Land For Industrial Development Including The Condition That Land Of Comparable Value Be Purchased By The School District; And For Related Purposes.

1969.title: Highway traffic; violation to maliciously impede.
1969.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Misdemeanor Level Of Maliciously Impeding Traffic On A Public Road; And For Related Purposes.

1970.title: Guardian ad litem fees; failure to pay enforced as any other civil debt.
1970.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-5-89 And 43-21-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Failure To Pay Guardian Ad Litem Fees Is Not Contempt Of Court But Shall Be Enforced As For Any Other Civil Debt; To Amend Sections 93-11-65, 93-15-107, 93-17-8 And 97-5-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1971.title: Concealed-carry license; 18-year-old with instructor certification qualifies for enhanced.
1971.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Eligibility For An Instructor-certified Concealed-carry License; To Amend Section 97-37-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Holders Of An Instructor-certified Concealed-carry License To Carry A Concealed Weapon On Educational Property; To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Person Who Is At Least 18 Years Of Age To Obtain An Instructor-certified Concealed-carry License; And For Related Purposes.

1972.title: Youth court records; parents have right to redacted copies.
1972.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Parents May Review The Youth Court Records Of The Parent's Child; And For Related Purposes.

1973.title: False report of child abuse or neglect; provide criminal penalties and civil liability.
1973.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-35-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The False Report Of Child Abuse Or Neglect To The Department Of Human Services Shall Be Punishable As A Misdemeanor; To Provide That A Person Who Knowingly And Willfully Makes A False Report Of Child Abuse Or Neglect May Be Civilly Liable For Damages Suffered Including Reasonable Attorney Fees And Costs; And For Related Purposes.

1974.title: Refugee resettlement contractors; responsible for crimes committed by refugees they sponsor.
1974.description: An Act To Provide That Refugees Placed In This State By The Federal Government Must Register With The Department Of Human Services; To Provide Civil Liability For Voluntary Resettlement Organizations Arising From The Actions Of A Refugee Placed In This State To Whom The Organization Provided Sponsorship Or Resettlement Services; And For Related Purposes.

1975.title: Campaign finance reports; to be available on county and municipal websites.
1975.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Campaign Finance Reports From Candidates For Local Government Offices Shall Be Made Available On County And Municipal Websites; And For Related Purposes.

1976.title: Federal MOU/MOE or contract agreements; require publication by state agencies.
1976.description: An Act To Codify Section 25-43-4.101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Publication And Notice Requirements For State Agencies Prior To Entering Into Any Federal Memorandum Of Understanding (mou), Maintenance Of Effort (moe) Or Federal Contract Agreements; And For Related Purposes.

1977.title: Adult day care facilities; define for licensure reimbursement purposes.
1977.description: An Act To Define The Term "adult Day Care Facility" For Purposes Of Licensure By The State Department Of Health; To Require A License To Establish And Operate An Adult Day Care Facility And To Provide Procedures For Application And Fees; To Authorize Judicial Review Of Licensure Denial; To Prescribe Criminal Penalties And Injunctive Relief For Unlicensed Operation Of A Facility; To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Rules, Regulations And Standards Regarding The Operation Of Adult Day Care Facilities; To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Implement The Rap-back Criminal History Records System For Monitoring Employees At Licensed Adult Day Care Facilities And To Delete Certain Repealers Relating To Facility Standards; And For Related Purposes.

1978.title: Mississippi Department of Child Protection Services; change statutory references.

1980.title: State Superintendent of Education; provide limitation on salary.
1980.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Statutory Limitation On The Salary Of The State Superintendent Of Public Education; And For Related Purposes.

1981.title: Sanitation vehicle; prohibit passing when stopped for loading.
1981.description: An Act To Prohibit Passing A Sanitation Vehicle That Is Stopped For Loading, And To Make Exception For Certain Traffic On A Divided Highway; To Amend Sections 63-3-809 And 63-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1982.title: Local school boards; prescribe educational qualifications.
1982.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-306, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Qualifications For Members Of Local School Boards; And For Related Purposes.

1983.title: Ad valorem tax on inventory tax; phase in exemption for certain small businesses.
1983.description: An Act To Phase In An Ad Valorem Tax Exemption On All Commodities, Products, Goods, Wares And Merchandise Held For Resale By Any Small Business With Annual Net Revenue Of Less Than $2,000,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

1985.title: School district tax increase request; require itemization of central office expenses.
1985.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The School Boards Of School Districts Requesting An Increase In Ad Valorem Tax Effort In Dollars For The Support Of The School District To Include In Its Notice Of Advertisement Of Such Request To Include An Itemized Report Of Expenses Of The Central Office That Identifies Each Office Position By Title Or Description, The Office Function And The Current Salary Received; To Require Such School Board To Also Publish The Notice Of Advertisement Containing The Itemized Report On The Website Of The School District And To Make The Notice Available To The State Department Of Education For Publication On The Department's Website; And For Related Purposes.

1986.title: Civics portion of Naturalization Test; require passing score for high school graduates and GED applicants.
1986.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require High School Graduates Or Ged Applicants To Pass At Least 60% Of The Civics Portion Of The Naturalization Test Used By The Immigration Services; And For Related Purposes.

1987.title: Health Care CON review; party requesting or appealing a hearing on application is responsible for costs and attorney fees.
1987.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-197, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Party Requesting A Hearing On An Application For A Health Care Certificate Of Need Who Does Not Prevail At The Hearing Shall Pay Costs And Attorney Fees, And To Apply The Same Requirement To Any Party Who Appeals An Order Of The Hearing Officer To The Proper Court And Loses On Appeal; And For Related Purposes.

1988.title: State flag; require governmental entities, public colleges and universities and school districts to display or be subject to penalty.
1988.description: An Act To Amend Sections 3-3-15 And 37-13-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Governmental Entities That Receive State Funds And Public Colleges And Universities To Display The Official State Flag On Monday Through Friday Of Each Week On Or At Each Building In Which An Office Of The Governmental Entity Is Located And On Each Campus Of Each Public College Or University Or School District; To Require That If A Governmental Entity Or A Public College Or University Or School District Is Not Displaying The Official State Flag As Required By This Section, The Governor Shall Notify The Governmental Entity Or The Public College Or University Or School District Of The Noncompliance, To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violating The Requirements Of This Section; And For Related Purposes.

1989.title: Immigration workforce violations; employers using temporary workers held accountable.
1989.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Hold Accountable Any Employers Using Temporary Workers In Order To Skirt Immigration Laws; And For Related Purposes.

1990.title: Military-trained individuals or spouses occupational licensing law; remove exemption to make applicable to the practice of law.
1990.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-50-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Attorney Occupation Exemption From The Law Which Provides For The Issuance Of A License, Certificate Or Registration By An Occupational Licensing Board To A Military-trained Individual Or Spouse In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1991.title: State Employees Health Insurance Plan; allow local school board members to purchase coverage.
1991.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-3, 25-15-15 And 25-15-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Active Local School Board Members To Participate In The Health Insurance Program Of The State And School Employees Life And Health Insurance Plan; To Provide That The State Shall Not Share In The Cost Of Health Insurance For The School Board Members; To Provide That The Participating School Board Member Shall Pay One Hundred Percent Of The Cost Of Health Insurance Coverage Under The Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1992.title: Elections; Legislature has exclusive jurisdiction over primary contests when regular session following the election convenes.
1992.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-955, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Regardless Of Court Proceedings Otherwise Authorized By Law, Once A Regular Session Of The Legislature That Follows A Regular General Election For Members Of The Legislature Convenes, Each House Of The Mississippi State Legislature Shall Have Exclusive Jurisdiction Over Primary Election Contests That Involve A Seat In Its House; And For Related Purposes.

1993.title: Gun-free zones; businesses liable for injuries.
1993.description: An Act To Create Liability On The Part Of A Property Owner Who Forbids Carrying Of A Concealed Weapon; To Amend Section 15-1-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Two-year Statute Of Limitations On The Cause Of Action For Injuries Incurred In A Gun-free Zone; To Amend Section 45-9-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1994.title: Emergency Medical Technicians; authorize to transport police dogs injured in the line of duty.
1994.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-59-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Emergency Medical Technician Or Other Emergency Personnel To Transport A Police Dog Injured In The Line Of Duty To A Veterinary Clinic Or Hospital Emergency Department; And For Related Purposes.

1995.title: School district cap on budget expenditures for administrative costs; revise.
1995.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Administrative Limit On Budget Expenditures In Each School District For Certain Administration Costs; And For Related Purposes.

1996.title: Education enhancement funds for classroom supplies; authorize for federally funded teachers.
1996.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-61-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Expenditure Of Education Enhancement Funds For Classroom Supplies To Federally Funded Teachers; And For Related Purposes.

1997.title: Health insurance coverage for mental illness; add coverage parity reporting requirements.
1997.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-9-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Terminology For Health Insurance Policy Coverage For Mental Illness; To Amend Section 83-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Health Insurance Issuer Reporting Requirements About Mental Illness Coverage Parity; And For Related Purposes.

1999.title: Mandatory K-12 computer science curriculum and computer coding; State Department of Education shall implement.
1999.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Develop And Implement A Mandatory K-12 Computer Science Curriculum Which Includes Instruction In Computer Coding; To Prescribe Minimum Components Of The Curriculum; To Provide For Teacher Training; And For Related Purposes.

2001.title: Disabilities; authorize designation of certain on driver's licenses or I.D. cards.
2001.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-35 And 45-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Designation Of Certain Disabilities On Driver's Licenses And Identification Cards Under Certain Circumstances; To Require Training For Law Enforcement Officers In Recognizing Certain Mental Or Medical Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2002.title: Professional bail agent license; exempt law enforcement officers from certain licensing requirements.
2002.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-39-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Active, Retired Or Former Law Enforcement Officers From Certain Licensing Requirements For A Professional Bail Agent License; And For Related Purposes.

2003.title: Third Circuit Court District; revise residency requirement.
2003.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Subdistrict Residency Requirements In The Third Circuit Court District; And For Related Purposes.

2004.title: Certified nurse practitioners; no physician supervision required if over 3,600 hours of clinical practice.
2004.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-25-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certified Nurse Practitioners With Over 3,600 Hours Of Clinical Practice Shall Not Be Required To Have A Written Collaborative Agreement With A Physician Or Be Required To Submit Patient Charts To A Physician For Review; And For Related Purposes.

2005.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for expenses incurred by a taxpayer for care of individuals who are 65 or older.
2005.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit To Taxpayers For Certain Expenses Incurred In Providing Care For Spouse, Parent, Stepparent Of The Taxpayer Or Other Relative Of The Taxpayer Within The First Degree Who Is 65 Years Of Age Or Older And Who Has Been Certified By A Licensed Physician As Being An Individual With Long-term Care Needs For A Period Which Is At Least 180 Days; And For Related Purposes.

2006.title: Antlered deer; all of bag limit for hunters 75 or older may be any antlered deer.
2006.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Hunters 75 Years Of Age Or Older All Of The Bag Limit On Antlered Deer Set By The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks May Be Any Antlered Deer; And For Related Purposes.

2007.title: State employees; allow medical leave without use of personal leave when dependent is dismissed from school sick.
2007.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow State Employees To Use Major Medical Leave Without Prior Use Of Personal Leave To Cover The Care For A Dependent When The Dependent Is Dismissed From A School Or Daycare Due To Illness; And For Related Purposes.

2008.title: Public contracts; give preference to resident bidders.
2008.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-13-111, 31-7-15 And 31-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Letting Of Public Contracts, Preference Shall Be Given To Resident Bidders Whenever All Things Are Equal With Regard To Quality And Service But Differ Only With Regard To Price, If The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Resident Bidders Is Not More Than Two Percent Greater Than The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Nonresident Bidders; To Provide That A Nonresident Bidder Domiciled In A State Having Laws Granting Preference To Resident Bidders Shall Be Awarded Mississippi Contracts Only On The Same Basis As The Nonresident Bidder's State Awards Contracts To Mississippi Residents Bidding Under Similar Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2009.title: Official Mississippi State Songs; designate Official Traditional Country Song and Official Traditional Blues Song.
2009.description: An Act To Designate "miss The Mississippi And You" By Jimmie Rodgers As The Official Traditional Country Song Of Mississippi And To Designate "cross Road Blues" By Robert Johnson As The Official Traditional Blues Song Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2010.title: Retirement; persons convicted of certain felonies shall forfeit benefits from PERS, SLRP and MHSPRS.
2010.description: An Act To Create New Sections 25-11-147, 25-11-321 And 25-13-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Receipt Of Retirement Benefits From The Public Employees' Retirement System, The Supplemental Legislative Retirement System And The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Retirement System Is Conditioned On The Member's Honest And Faithful Performance Of His Or Her Public Duties For The State; To Provide That A Member's Conviction Of Or Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere To A Felony That Is Related To Or In Connection With The Member's Employment In The State Service Is Considered To Be A Breach Of The Public Trust And A Breach Of The Member's Contract With The State; To Provide That If A Member Of The System Or Plan Is Convicted Of Or Enters A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere In Any Court To A Felony That Is Related To Or In Connection With The Member's Employment In The State Service And Is Committed On Or After July 1, 2018, The Court Shall Conduct A Hearing In A Separate Civil Proceeding To Determine If All Of The Conditions Have Been Met; To Provide That If All Of The Conditions Have Been Met, The Court Shall Issue An Order That The Member Be Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan And Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan; To Provide That A Member Who Is Convicted Of Such A Crime Shall Not Be Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan Or Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Until All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired; To Provide That After Receiving The Termination And Forfeiture Order From The Court, The System Shall Request The Attorney General For A Determination Of Whether All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired; To Provide That After The Attorney General Notifies The System That All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired, The System Shall Terminate The Member From Membership In The System Or Plan And The Member Shall Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan; To Provide That A Member Who Is Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan Shall Have His Or Her Contributions Refunded Without Any Interest; To Provide That If A Member Of The System Or Plan Is Also A Member Of Another Retirement System Administered By The Board Of Trustees Of The System, And The Crime For Which The Member Was Convicted Or Entered A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere Is Related To Or In Connection With Employment Of The Member That Is Covered By Only One Of The Retirement Systems, The Member Will Be Terminated Only From The Retirement System In Which His Or Her Employment Was Covered At The Time That He Or She Committed The Crime, And Will Forfeit Retirement Benefits Only From That Retirement System; To Provide That The System May Conclusively Rely On A Termination And Forfeiture Order From The Court And The Notice From The Attorney General That The Requirements Of This Act Have Been Met In Terminating A Member From Membership In The System Or Plan; To Provide That The System Is Not Liable For Any Mistake In The Payment Of Retirement Benefits To A Member In Good Faith Reliance On A Termination And Forfeiture Order From The Court And The Notice From The Attorney General; To Provide That Any Ambiguity Or Uncertainty About Whether A Member Should Be Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan Or Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Shall Be Resolved In Favor Of The Member; To Amend Sections 25-11-105, 25-11-111, 25-11-117, 25-11-120, 25-11-129, 25-11-305, 25-11-309, 25-11-311, 25-11-319, 25-13-3, 25-13-11, 25-13-21, 25-13-28 And 25-13-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2011.title: Alcoholic beverages; authorize Meridian to establish leisure and recreation districts.
2011.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "municipality" To Include The City Of Meridian Under The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of Certain Municipalities And Counties To Establish Leisure And Recreation Districts Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; And For Related Purposes.

2013.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of for storm drainage improvements in the Town of Crosby.
2013.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Storm Drainage Improvements In The Town Of Crosby, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2014.title: Open-box items; retailers required to prominently display exchange policies.
2014.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-24-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Definition Of "open-box" Item; To Amend Section 75-24-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 73-24-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Retailers To Prominently Display Exchange Policies As To Open-box Items; And For Related Purposes.

2015.title: Expunction; revise for receiving stolen property and burglary.
2015.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Expunction For Certain Offenses Of Burglary And Receiving Stolen Property Regardless Of Age; To Raise The Age For Expunction For Nonviolent Felonies From 21 To 22 And To Revise The Definition Of Violent Felony; And For Related Purposes.

2016.title: Consumer protection; restrict use of certain chemicals in food and food packaging.
2016.description: An Act To Regulate The Use Of Certain Chemicals In Food Products And Food Packaging; To Restrict The Use Of Bisphenol A (bpa) In Food Packaging; To Require Labeling Of Products With Bisphenol A; To Provide Appropriate Information To Consumers About Potentially Harmful Toxicants In Foods; To Provide A Civil Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2017.title: Flame-retardant chemicals; prohibit children's products or upholstered residential furniture containing certain amounts of.
2017.description: An Act To Prohibit Manufacturers Or Wholesalers From Manufacturing, Selling, Offering For Sale, Distributing For Sale Or Distributing For Use In This State A Children's Product Or Upholstered Residential Furniture Containing Certain Amounts Of Flame-retardant Chemicals; To Prohibit Certain Replacement Flame-retardant Chemicals; To Require A Report From The State Health Officer, In Consultation With The State Fire Marshal; And For Related Purposes.

2018.title: Literacy-Based Promotion Act; require intensive reading instruction beginning with Kindergarten and First-Grade students.
2018.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-177-1 And 37-177-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Standards To Be Documented For Intensive Reading Instruction And Intervention For Kindergarten And First-grade Students Under The Literacy-based Promotion Act Beginning With The 2018-2019 School Year; And For Related Purposes.

2019.title: Wildlife; require the Department of Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks to identify existing and needed wildlife corridors.
2019.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, In Conjunction With The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, To Identify Existing And Needed Wildlife Corridors; To File A Report And Recommendations; And For Related Purposes.

2020.title: Offender temporary personal leave; MDOC commissioner may grant with certain conditions.
2020.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections, Or His Designees, To Determine Whether An Offender Will Be Accompanied By A Security Escort During Honorary Leave; And For Related Purposes.

2021.title: Felony conviction; revise expunction of.
2021.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Expunction Of Certain Felony Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

2022.title: Drug courts; amend criteria for participation in.
2022.description: An Act To Provide That A Conviction For Burglary Of A Dwelling Is Not A Crime Of Violence For Purposes Of Determining An Offender's Eligibility For A Drug Court Program; To Amend Sections 9-23-5 And 9-23-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2023.title: Parole hearings; not required for offenders convicted on or after July 1, 2014, who meet certain other requirements.
2023.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Only Those Parole-eligible Offenders Convicted On Or After July 1, 2014, Who Meet Certain Requirements May Be Released On Parole Without A Hearing; And For Related Purposes.

2024.title: Private correctional facilities; must guarantee recidivism rate that is less than MDOC's recidivism rate.
2024.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-1211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Private Prison Contractors Must Demonstrate The Ability To Provide Incarceration Services That Result In An Offender Recidivism Rate That Is Lower Than The Mississippi Department Of Corrections' Offender Recidivism Rate; To Amend Section 47-5-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Collect And Report Certain Information On Offender Recidivism Rates; And For Related Purposes.

2025.title: Appropriation FY2019; MDOT for three-lane Highway 16 in Kemper County.
2025.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Purpose Of Converting Portions Of Highway 16 In Kemper County From Two-lane To Three-lane For Fy2019; And For Related Purposes.

2026.title: Alternative school placement; provide clear standards and notice to parents or legal guardians.
2026.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Clear Standards Under Which A Local School District May Place A Student In An Alternative School And Require Written Notice To Parents Or Legal Guardians; And For Related Purposes.

2027.title: Financial literacy curriculum for public schools; State Board of Education shall implement.
2027.description: An Act To Require The State Board Of Education To Implement A Financial Literacy Curriculum For Public Schools On Or Before The 2018-2019 Academic School Year; To Provide That The Course In Financial Literacy Shall Account For A One-half Carnegie Unit; To Require Successful Passage Of The Course As A Graduation Requirement; To Establish The "financial Literacy Trust Fund" As A Special Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide For The Funds Administration; To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2028.title: Open primary elections; authorize for state, county and municipal offices.
2028.description: An Act To Abolish Partisan Primaries; To Provide The Time For Holding General And Preferential Elections; To Provide That When Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For An Office, Such Person's Name Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That A Preferential Election Shall Be Held Three Weeks Before The General Election And The Candidate Who Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast For Such Office Shall Have His Name And His Name Only Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That When No Candidate Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast In The Preferential Election For An Office, That The Two Candidates Who Receive The Highest Number Of Votes In The Preferential Election Shall Have Their Names Placed On The General Election Ballot As Candidates For Such Office; To Provide The Procedure To Follow In Case Of Ties; To Provide The Manner For Qualifying As A Candidate For Public Office; To Provide For The Printing Of Necessary Ballots; To Amend Sections 21-7-7, 21-8-7, 21-15-1, 23-15-21, 23-15-31, 23-15-129, 23-15-153, 23-15-173, 23-15-197, 23-15-313, 23-15-367, 23-15-375, 23-15-403, 23-15-411, 23-15-463, 23-15-465, 23-15-507, 23-15-511, 23-15-559, 23-15-561, 23-15-573, 23-15-593, 23-15-595, 23-15-601, 23-15-605, 23-15-673, 23-15-713, 23-15-755, 23-15-771, 23-15-801, 23-15-807, 23-15-811, 23-15-833, 23-15-859, 23-15-873, 23-15-881, 23-15-885, 23-15-891, 23-15-899, 23-15-911, 23-15-973, 23-15-1065, 23-15-1085 And 23-15-1087, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 23-15-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Dates Of Municipal Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of State, District And County Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-263, 23-15-265, 23-15-267, 23-15-291 Through 23-15-311, 23-15-317, 23-15-319, 23-15-331, 23-15-333 And 23-15-335, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Duties Of The State Executive Committee And County Executive Committees In Primary Elections, Provide For The Qualification Of Candidates For Party Primary Elections, And Provide For The Conduct Of Party Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-359, 23-15-361 And 23-15-363, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Contents Of General Election Ballots; To Repeal Sections 23-15-597 And 23-15-599, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Canvass Of Returns And Announcement Of Vote By The County Executive Committees In Primary Elections And Require The State Executive Committee To Transmit To The Secretary Of State A Tabulated Statement Of The Party Vote For Certain Offices; To Repeal Sections 23-15-921 Through 23-15-941, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Procedures For Contests Of Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1031, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of Primary Elections For Congressmen And United States Senators; To Repeal Section 23-15-1063, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Unregistered Political Parties From Conducting Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1083, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That Certain Congressional Primaries Be Held On The Same Day As The Presidential Preference Primary; And For Related Purposes.

2029.title: Secure detention; raise minimum age.
2029.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Raise The Minimum Age At Which A Child May Be Committed To The State Training School; And For Related Purposes.

2030.title: Keyaurdra's Law; require unique identifying mark on bullet casings.
2030.description: An Act To Be Known As Keyaurdra's Law; To Create New Section 97-37-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That All Centerfire Pistol And Rifle Cartridges Sold In Mississippi Bear A Unique Identifying Mark; To Require Sellers Of Ammunition To Keep Records As To The Purchaser Of Such Ammunition By Serial Number Or Other Unique Identifying Mark; And For Related Purposes.

2031.title: Habitual offenders; revise method of determining whether a felony triggers sentencing as.
2031.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person May Be Sentenced As A Habitual Offender Only If He Has Been Sentenced To And Served Separate Terms Of One Year Or More In A State Or Federal Correctional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2032.title: Technical violations; clarify meaning of for graduate sanctions and revocation sentencing.
2032.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Reference That Designates An Arrest For A New Criminal Offense As A Technical Violation; To Amend Sections 47-7-27 And 47-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Number Of Prior Revocations Rather Than The Number Of Alleged Technical Violations Shall Be Considered For Purposes Of Revocation Sentencing; And For Related Purposes.

2033.title: School Resource Officers; require uniform statewide training program.
2033.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To School Resource Officer Qualifications To Require That All School Resource Officers Complete Uniform Statewide Training Prior To Being Permitted To Serve In A School; To Amend Section 37-3-82, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Expenditure Of Mississippi Community Oriented Policing Services In Schools (mcops) Grant Funds For The Required Training; And For Related Purposes.

2034.title: Crimes of violence; remove references to parole and early release in provision designating offenses as.
2034.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Designates The Crimes Of Violence, To Remove The References To Parole And Early Release; And For Related Purposes.

2035.title: Youthful Offender Unit; offenders housed in to remain under court's jurisdiction.
2035.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Offenders Placed On Earned Probation In The Youthful Offender Unit (you) Shall Remain Under The Court's Jurisdiction; To Require The Court's Approval Before Those Offenders May Be Transferred From The You; To Amend Section 47-5-1401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2036.title: Offender case plans; MDOC to develop for parole-eligible offenders convicted on or after July 1, 2014.
2036.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Department Of Corrections Shall Develop A Case Plan For Parole-eligible Inmates Convicted On Or After July 1, 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2037.title: Parole; clarify list of offenses that make offenders convicted between 1995-2014 ineligible for.
2037.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The List Of Offenses That Render Offenders Convicted Between 1995 And 2014 Ineligible For Parole; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: Assistant teachers/reading instructors; require in each K-3 class.
2038.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Employ Assistant Teachers/reading Instructors In Each Kindergarten, First-grade, Second-grade And Third-grade Class And To Provide That The State Shall Allot Sufficient Funding For These Assistant Teachers/reading Instructors; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers that employ certain supervised offenders.
2039.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ A Person Who Is An Offender Who Is Being Supervised By The Community Corrections Division Of The Department Of Corrections Or Who Has Been Discharged From The Custody Of The Department Of Corrections; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to widen portions of Highway 16 in Kemper County.
2040.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Widening Of Portions Of Mississippi Highway 16 In Kemper County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2041.title: Code of Judicial Conduct; immunity for members of a special campaign committee.
2041.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-19-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Immunity For Members Of A Special Campaign Committee Created Under The Authority Of The Code Of Judicial Conduct; And For Related Purposes.

2042.title: Nonpublic schools accredited by certain agencies; authorize students to transfer course credit and grades.
2042.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-17-7 And 37-15-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Grades And Coursework Completed By Elementary And Secondary Students Attending Nonpublic Schools Accredited By Certain Recognized Accrediting Agencies Shall Be Accepted For Credit At Any Mississippi Public School, Mississippi Community Or Junior College Or Mississippi Public University; And For Related Purposes.

2043.title: Oakley Training School; revise eligibility for commitments to.
2043.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility To Be Committed To The State Training School; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: State lottery; establish and use revenue from to supplement MAEP and for educational capital improvements.
2044.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create The Mississippi Adequate Education Supplement Fund Into Which 25% Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited; To Provide That The Money In The Fund Shall Be Appropriated Annually By The Legislature To Supplement The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Create The Education Infrastructure Supplement Fund Into Which 75% Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited; To Provide That 15% Of The Money In Such Fund Shall Be Appropriated Annually By The Legislature To The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Be Allocated By Such Board For Capital Improvements At The Various Community And Junior Colleges In This State In The Amount Recommended By The Infrastructure Commission For Education; To Provide That 20% Of The Money In Such Fund Shall Be Appropriated Annually By The Legislature To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Be Allocated By Such Board For Capital Improvements At The Various Public Universities In This State In The Amount Recommended By The Infrastructure Commission For Education; To Provide That 65% Of The Money In Such Fund Shall Be Appropriated Annually By The Legislature To The State Department Of Education To Be Allocated To Public Schools Located In Public School Districts In Which The Value Of One Mill Is Less Than $200,000.00 And To Provide That The State Department Of Education Shall Allocate Such Funds To Eligible Public School Districts In The Amount Recommended By The Infrastructure Commission For Education; To Provide That Funds Received By A Public School District Shall Be Used Solely For Capital Improvements To Public School Instructional Buildings And/or Construction Of Public School Instructional Buildings; To Create The Infrastructure Commission For Education; To Provide The Membership And Powers And Duties Of Such Commission; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act;
