To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

2045.title: Educational expenses at qualified private schools; individual income tax credits for.
2045.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A State Income Tax Deduction For Educational Expenses By Parents Who Send Their Children Or Dependents To A Qualified Private School Or A Homeschool Program; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: Employment Protection Act; revise and clarify.
2047.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Retention Of E-verify Confirmations For At Least Three Years, Revise And Clarify Enforcement And Penalties Under The Mississippi Employment Protection Act, Revise Definitions, And Provide For Expediting Trial Of Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Intercept gaming winnings of parents with a child support arrearage; provide procedures for.
2048.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare As Public Policy That Children Are Adversely Affected When A Parent Who Has An Outstanding Child Support Arrearage Diverts Child Support To Gaming; To Codify Section 75-76-58, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Procedures For The Mississippi Gaming Commission, The Department Of Human Services And Licensees Under Chapter 76 Of Title 75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Carry Out The Intercept And Seizure Of Game Winnings Of Parents With A Child Support Arrearage; And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: Common Core educational standards; parents can opt out.
2049.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct Public School Districts To Allow Parents And Legal Guardians Of Enrolled Students To Opt Out Of Common Core Aligned Curricula, Certain Student Data And The Release Of Information Concerning Their Children's Personal Beliefs; To Prescribe A Form For The Student Privacy Protection Opt-out Request By The Parent Or Legal Guardian; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Issue Regulations Consistent With The Student Data Confidentiality Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: "Pay for Success Contracts Act"; authorize DFA and public school districts to only pay providers when results are successful.
2050.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration And Public School Districts To Implement A "pay For Success Contracting" Process Which Leverages Public And Private Funding And Supports Providers With A Record Of Improved Services, Increased Student Achievement And Cost-effectiveness; To Provide Definitions; To Provide For The Establishment Of The "pay For Success Contracts" Program; To Provide Procedures And Criteria For Entering Into Such Contracts With Providers; To Establish The Pay For Success Contracts Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: "Mississippi Unborn Infants Dignity Act"; enact.
2051.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Unborn Infants Dignity Act"; To Provide That Miscarried, Stillborn Or Aborted Infants Are Treated With Dignity With Proper Burials, That Broken Bodies Of Aborted Infants Are Not Sold For Scientific Experimentation; To Require Fetal Death Reporting And The Issuance Of Fetal Death Certificates For Unborn Infants Lost Early In Pregnancy; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Sections 73-11-58, 73-15-29 And 73-25-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Professional Discipline Of Funeral Directors, Physicians, Registered Nurses And Licensed Practical Nurses To This Act; To Bring Forward Sections 41-39-1, 41-39-3, 41-39-5 And 41-39-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment To Conform The Disposition Of Human Remains To This Act; To Amend Sections 41-57-31 And 41-61-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Duties Of The Registrar Of Vital Statistics To Provide For Issuance Of Certificates Of Fetal Death; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: Refugee resettlement; impose civil liability on sponsor organizations under certain circumstances.
2052.description: An Act To Provide That Refugees Placed In This State By The Federal Government Must Register With The Department Of Human Services; To Provide Civil Liability For Voluntary Resettlement Organizations Arising From The Actions Of A Refugee Placed In This State To Whom The Organization Provided Sponsorship Or Resettlement Services; And For Related Purposes.

2053.title: Health care insurance; no person, employer or health care provider shall be required to participate in any health care plan.
2053.description: An Act To Provide That No Person, Employer Or Health Care Provider Shall Be Required To Participate In Any Health Care Services Payment System; To Permit A Person Or Employer To Pay Directly For Lawful Health Care Services And To Permit A Health Care Provider To Accept Direct Payment From A Person Or Employer For Lawful Health Care Services; To Provide That The Purchase Or Sale Of Health Insurance Shall Not Be Prohibited By Law Or Rule; And For Related Purposes.

2054.title: Highways; require MDOT to erect signs along certain highways to inform motorists that texting while driving is illegal.
2054.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Erect Signs Along U.s. Interstates And Mississippi State Highways To Inform Motorists That Texting While Driving Is Illegal; And For Related Purposes.

2055.title: Presidential Executive Orders; prohibit the State of Mississippi from enforcing unless enacted by U.S. Congress.
2055.description: An Act To Prohibit Any State Agency Or Political Subdivision Of The State From Using Any Personnel Or Financial Resources To Enforce Or Administer Any Executive Order Issued By The President Of The United States That Has Not Been Affirmed By A Vote Of Congress And Signed Into Law; And For Related Purposes.

2056.title: Legislature; reduce size beginning with 2019 statewide general election.
2056.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2019 Statewide General Election The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Consist Of 70 Members; To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2019 Statewide General Election The Mississippi Senate Shall Consist Of 30 Members; And For Related Purposes.

2057.title: Student test results; testing companies shall notify schools not later than the 21st day after the test is given.
2057.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Entity Administering Statewide Student Tests Shall Notify School Districts And Schools Of The Results Of The Assessment Instruments Not Later Than The 21st Day After The Date The Test Is Given; And For Related Purposes.

2058.title: Illegal immigration; Attorney General to seek federal reimbursement of costs incurred by state.
2058.description: An Act To Authorize The Attorney General To Seek Reimbursement From The Federal Government For All Costs Associated With Illegal Immigration Incurred By The State; And For Related Purposes.

2059.title: Sales tax; remove requirement that certain taxpayers pay June liability for the tax on or before June 25.
2059.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Requires A Taxpayer Who Is Required To Collect Sales Taxes And Who Has An Average Monthly Sales Tax Liability Of At Least $50,000.00 To Pay A Portion Of His Sales Tax Liability For The Month Of June On Or Before June 25; And For Related Purposes.

2060.title: Trusty status; offenders ineligible to work at Governor's Mansion if incarcerated for a violent crime.
2060.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Offender In Trusty Status Who Was Convicted Of A Crime Of Violence Shall Be Ineligible To Participate In Any Program At The Governor's Mansion; And For Related Purposes.

2061.title: School board members; elected in all districts.
2061.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected From Special Trustee Election Districts By The Qualified Electors Of Such District Beginning With The Municipal Elections In The Year 2021; To Provide That Such Election Shall Be Held Every Four Years In The Same Manner As Elections Are Held For Other Municipal Officers; To Provide That The Local School Board Shall Apportion The New Trustee Election Districts; To Amend Section 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected In The Same Manner As Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-7-209, 37-7-211, And 37-7-215 Through 37-7-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Added Territory; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705 Through 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2062.title: Use of public or grant funds for abortion or family planning services; strictly prohibit.
2062.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-41-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Prohibit The Use Of Public Funds, Whether By Direct Appropriation By The Legislature, By Grant Funding, By Student Tuition Or Fees, Or By The Use Of Public Facilities, For An Abortion Or For Training To Perform An Abortion Or For Family Planning Services; And For Related Purposes.

2063.title: Charter schools for special needs students; may be approved without approval of local school board.
2063.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-28-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Charter School Authorizer Board May Approve Public Charter Schools For Special Needs Students Without Approval Of The Local School Board; And For Related Purposes.

2064.title: Statewide Longitudinal Data System (SLDS); parents may opt out.
2064.description: An Act To Prohibit The State Board Of Education, The State Department Of Education Or Any Local School District From Expending Any Funds For The Implementation Of Any Statewide Longitudinal Data System (slds) To Track Students Beyond K-12 Or From Releasing Any Personally Identifiable Student Or Educational Information To An Outside Entity Without The Written Authorization Of The Student's Parent Or Legal Guardian; And For Related Purposes.

2065.title: Gaming commission; certain investors consider in the aggregate to satisfy scrutiny thresholds.
2065.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Level Of Scrutiny By The Mississippi Gaming Commission For Certain Unverified Investors In A Casino; And For Related Purposes.

2066.title: Alcoholic beverages; reduce privilege tax for package retailer's permits for locations in cities with a population of 5,000 or less.
2066.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Privilege License Tax For Package Retailer's Permit Issued For Package Stores Located In Municipalities With A Population Of 5,000 Or Less According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

2067.title: Railroad right-of-way; unlawful to enter and remain upon without the permission of the owner or operator of the railroad.
2067.description: An Act To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful For A Person To Enter And Remain Upon The Right-of-way Of A Railroad Without The Permission Of The Owner Or Operator Of The Railroad Or Without Authority Otherwise Granted By Law; And For Related Purposes.

2068.title: Salary supplements for Master Teachers who teach in the Mississippi Delta; add certain counties.
2068.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Tallahatchie And Holmes Counties In The Provision Authorizing Salary Supplements To Master Teachers Who Teach In The Mississippi Delta; And For Related Purposes.

2070.title: Arrest; require probable cause hearing for legislators.
2070.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Probable Cause Hearing Before An Arrest Warrant May Be Issued For A Legislator; To Provide Certain Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2071.title: Unused leave accumulated by teacher who transfers to another school district; may be credited for retirement purposes.
2071.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Event A Public School Teacher Transfers From One Public School District In Mississippi To Another, Any Unused Portion Of The Total Sick Or Personal Leave Allowance Credited To Such Teacher Shall Be Credited In The Computation Of Unused Leave For Retirement Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2072.title: Genetically engineered salmon; prohibit sale or cultivation of.
2072.description: An Act To Prohibit The Sale, Farming, Cultivation, Incubation Or Inducement To Spawn Of Atlantic Salmon Or Genetically Engineered Fish That May Come Into Contact With Or Spread Contagious Diseases To Native Fish In This State; To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Enforce The Requirements Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2073.title: Consolidation of Lumberton School District with Lamar County School District; ratify agreement between districts.
2073.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-104.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Ratify The Agreement Between The School Boards Of Lumberton Public School District And Lamar County School District To Dissolve The Lumberton Public School District And Administrative Office And Consolidate The Schools And Territory Of The Lumberton Public School District Into The Lamar County School District, To Provide For The Composition Of A New School Board For The Consolidated District, To Provide For The Transfer Of Property, Tax Assessments, Assumption Of Debt, Attendance Boundaries, Curriculum And Programs, Execution Of Employment Contracts For Certified And Noncertified Staff, Preparation Of Budget And The Establishment Of A Transition Team For The Consolidated District; To Amend Sections 37-5-7 And 37-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2074.title: Carbon monoxide detectors in all public and nonpublic schools; require.
2074.description: An Act To Require Carbon Monoxide Detectors In All Public And Nonpublic Schools In Mississippi; To Authorize And Direct The State Fire Marshal To Provide Requirements For Testing And Inspecting Carbon Monoxide Detection And Warning Equipment Installed In Public Or Nonpublic School Buildings; And For Related Purposes.

2075.title: Dog and cat abuse; conform reporting to FBI guidelines.
2075.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A First-offense Felony Of Aggravated Abuse Of A Dog Or Cat; To Enact Definitions; To Limit The Number Of Counts That Can Be Charged Arising From A Single Incident; To Require That Reporting Of All Offenses Against Dogs Or Cats Will Conform To Fbi Reporting Guidelines; And For Related Purposes.

2076.title: Alcoholic beverages; revise the definition of "qualified resort area" under the Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law.
2076.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "qualified Resort Area" Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; And For Related Purposes.

2077.title: Hunting on streets and railroads; clarify prohibition on.
2077.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Prohibition Against Hunting On Any Street, Public Road, Public Highway, Levee, Or Railroad; And For Related Purposes.

2078.title: Federal Affordable Care Act; prohibit implementation of ACA and prohibit expansion of Medicaid Program.
2078.description: An Act To Prohibit State Enforcement Or Participation With The Federal "patient Protection And Affordable Care Act"; To Amend Section 43-13-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The State Of Mississippi From Facilitating In Any Way The Expansion Of The Medicaid Program Under The Federal "patient Protection And Affordable Care Act"; And For Related Purposes.

2079.title: BP Settlement Funds; transfer into Gulf Coast New Restoration Reserve Fund.
2079.description: An Act To Create The Gulf Coast Restoration Reserve Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Funding Projects Primarily Benefiting The Mississippi Gulf Coast From Funds Paid To The State For Economic Damages In Connection With The 2010 Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill; To Provide For The Transfer Of Such Funds From The Budget Contingency Fund; To Amend Section 27-103-302, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2080.title: Emergency management; local emergency may be declared by public official authorized by the governing body of a county.
2080.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Local Emergency May Be Proclaimed By The Public Official Authorized By The Governing Body Of A County; And For Related Purposes.

2081.title: Elections; impose residency requirement to run for certain offices.
2081.description: An Act To Provide That Any Candidate For A State District Office Shall Be A Resident Of The State District That He Or She Seeks To Represent For Five Years Immediately Preceding The Election Day; To Provide That Any Candidate For A Statewide Office Shall Be A Resident Of The State For Five Years Immediately Preceding The Election Day; To Amend Sections 65-1-3, 25-31-1 And 69-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2082.title: Workers' compensation; increase maximum total recovery and remove cap on permanent total disability compensation.
2082.description: An Act To Amend Sections 71-3-13, 71-3-17, 71-3-21 And 71-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Total Compensation That An Employee May Recover Under The Workers' Compensation Law, And To Provide That Compensation For Permanent Total Disability Shall Be Paid To The Employee Until His Death; And For Related Purposes.

2083.title: Counties, municipalities and school districts; require to publish their annual budget online.
2083.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-11-7, 19-11-19, 21-35-5, 21-35-25, 37-61-9 And 37-61-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each County, Municipality And School District To Post Its Annual Budget, And Any Revision Or Amendment Thereto, On Its Official Website; And For Related Purposes.

2084.title: Tax Payer Pay Raise Act; remove phase out of income & franchise tax & remove deduction of federal employment tax.
2084.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provisions That Phase Out, Beginning January 1, 2018, Income Taxation On The First $5,000.00 Of Taxable Income; To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove A Provision That Authorizes A Portion Of The Federal Self-employment Taxes Assessed Against Self-employed Individuals To Be Allowed As An Adjustment To Gross Income Under The State Income Tax Law; To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Phase Out, Beginning January 1, 2018, The Corporation Franchise Tax; To Repeal Section 5, Chapter 499, Laws Of 2016, Which Repeals The Corporation Franchise Law From And After January 1, 2028; And For Related Purposes.

2085.title: Medicaid; expand eligibility to include individuals entitled to benefits under federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
2085.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Medicaid Eligibility To Include Those Individuals Who Are Entitled To Benefits Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca) Beginning July 1, 2018; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Essential Health Benefits For Individuals Eligible For Medicaid Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca); And For Related Purposes.

2086.title: Fourth Circuit Court District; clarify precinct composition of subdistricts.
2086.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Update Precincts And Precinct Names In The Fourth Circuit Court District To Conform To The 2010 Census Data; To Bring Forward Section 9-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Clarity; To Provide That Revised Precincts Are From The 2010 Census, But That Subdistrict Boundaries Conform To The 1990 Precincts As Required By Law; To Require The Standing Joint Legislative Committee On Reapportionment To Assist The Counties In Identifying The Boundaries Of Subdistricts; And For Related Purposes.

2087.title: Appropriation FY19; West Bolivar School District for repairs and renovations at three high schools.
2087.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of The West Bolivar Consolidated School District For The Purpose Of Assisting The District In Paying Costs Associated With Making Certain Repairs And Renovations At Three High Schools Of The District For The Fiscal Year 2019.

2088.title: Kennels; require permit and impose animal health standards.
2088.description: An Act To Create A License Requirement To Operate As A Pet Dealer Or To Operate A Kennel, Stable Or Animal Shelter; To Require The Commissioner Of Agriculture To Investigate Applicants And Issue Annual Licenses Where Required; To Require The Commissioner To Set Permit Fees; To Allow Fees To Differ Between Types Of Permit Holders; To Provide For A 100% Penalty For Late Application For A Permit Or Renewal Of A Permit; To Provide That Operating Without A License Is A Misdemeanor; To Provide For Enforcement; To Amend Section 69-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2089.title: Wireless E911 service charges; revise the disbursement of.
2089.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-5-333 And 19-5-343, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Administration And Disbursement Of Postpaid And Prepaid Wireless E911 Service Charges; To Bring Forward Section 19-5-335, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2090.title: Teacher licensure; authorize reciprocity license for approved foreign-certified teaching credentials.
2090.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Issue A Standard License For Teaching On A Reciprocal Basis To Individuals Who Hold Foreign-certified Teaching Credentials Upon Presentation Of Documentation And Appropriate Evaluation Of All Credentials And Collegiate-level Coursework For Which Credit Was Earned By The State Department Of Education And A Nationally Recognized Department-approved International Credential Evaluation Organization; To Authorize The Department To Recognize Such Out-of-state Coursework For License Renewal Or Certificate Upgrade Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2091.title: Bonds; authorize g.o. bonds to assist the Town of Crosby in making improvements to its surface water drainage system.
2091.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Crosby, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Reconstruction And Improvement Of The Town's Surface Water Drainage System; And For Related Purposes.

2092.title: Counties; real or personal property shall be sold to satisfy special assessment for garbage fees.
2092.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Real Or Personal Property Shall Be Sold To Satisfy A Special Assessment For Garbage Fees In The Same Manner As Provided For The Collection Of Ad Valorem Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

2093.title: Bonds; authorize general obligation bonds to four lane MS Hwy 24 from Liberty to I-55.
2093.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Additional Funds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Construction Or Reconstruction Of Mississippi Highway 24 To Four Lanes Between Liberty And Interstate 55; And For Related Purposes.

2094.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds to assist in establishing a McComb and Pike County Musical Heritage/Creative Arts Museum.
2094.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Mccomb Main Street Association In Mccomb, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Incurred For The Establishment Of A Mccomb And Pike County Musical Heritage/creative Arts Museum In Mccomb; And For Related Purposes.

2096.title: Nissan Scholarship Program; authorize Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance Board to administer.
2096.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance Board To Administer The Nissan Scholarship Program; And For Related Purposes.

2097.title: Debts; authorize community and junior colleges to collect through setoff against a debtor's income tax return.
2097.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Public Community And Junior Colleges In The Definition Of The Term "claimant Agency" In The Law That Allows Certain Entities To Collect Certain Debts Through Setoff Against A Debtor's Income Tax Refund And To Expand The Types Of Debts That May Be Collected Through Such Procedure; And For Related Purposes.

2098.title: Health insurance; require coverage for hearing aids and services for hearing impaired children.
2098.description: An Act To Require That Certain Insurance Policies And Contracts Shall Provide Coverage For Hearing Aids And Services For Deaf And Hearing Impaired Children; And For Related Purposes.

2099.title: MS Electronic Protection Licensing Act; revise exemptions from licensure.
2099.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-69-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions From Licensure Under The Mississippi Electronic Protection Licensing Act; And For Related Purposes.

2101.title: Elections; revise procedure for examining certain records and for filing certain election contests.
2101.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-911, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Procedure For The Examination Of Ballot Boxes And Other Election Records; To Amend Sections 23-15-921 And 23-15-923, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Candidate Must File A Petition To Contest An Election Within A Certain Number Of Days After Certification Of The Election Results By The County Or State Executive Committee; To Amend Section 23-15-591, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Marked Pollbook Be Included In The Ballot Box; And For Related Purposes.

2102.title: Charitable solicitation; revise reporting period.
2102.description: An Act To Amend Sections 79-11-507, 79-11-513, 79-11-515 And 79-11-517, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Reporting Period Applying To The Filing Of Financial Statements By Charitable Organizations That Solicit Donations; And For Related Purposes.

2103.title: Death penalty; eliminate for persons with certain intellectual disabilities.
2103.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Eliminate The Death Penalty For Individuals Who Are Intellectually Disabled; And For Related Purposes.

2104.title: Law enforcement training expenses; revise time for reimbursement of formerly employing entity.
2104.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time During Which A Governmental Entity Must Reimburse The Formerly Employing Governmental Entity For The Costs Incurred By That Entity For The Officer's Law Enforcement Training; And For Related Purposes.

2105.title: Sales taxation; exempt sales to certain community action agencies exempt from federal income taxation.
2105.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To Certain Community Action Organizations That Are Exempt From Federal Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

2106.title: Assistant teachers; increase salaries for.
2106.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Salaries For Assistant Teachers; And For Related Purposes.

2107.title: Sales tax; exempt sales to Head Start programs.
2107.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Service To Head Start Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2108.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to assist Delta Blues Museum's installation of permanent exhibits.
2108.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Acquisition, Storage And Relocation Of Artifacts And The Design, Fabrication And Installation Of Permanent Exhibits, Including The Development Of All Associated Films And Interactive Components, For The Delta Blues Museum In Clarksdale, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2109.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of to assist Marks, MS in the construction of a building to house a community center and its city hall.
2109.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Marks, Mississippi, In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Building To House A Community Center And The Marks City Hall; And For Related Purposes.

2110.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of to assist in the construction of a passenger train depot in Marks, MS.
2110.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Quitman County, Mississippi, In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of The Passenger Train Depot In Marks, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2111.title: Autopsies; Medical Examiner may enter into contracts with medical schools to perform.
2111.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Medical Examiner May Enter Into Contracts With Accredited Medical Schools To Perform Certain Autopsies Under Certain Conditions; To Amend Sections 41-61-55, 41-61-59, 41-61-61 And 41-61-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2112.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; authorize for supporters of various organizations.
2112.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Blue Mountain College In Tippah County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Order Of The Eastern Star In Hinds County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Members Of The Maurice F. Lucas, Sr., Grand Chapter Of The Eastern Star, Prince Hall Affiliated; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The American Federation Of Teachers/mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Vitiligo Beautified Foundation, Inc.; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Ballet Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Mississippi Metropolitan Ballet; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Firefly Outreach; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Former Sam M. Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Kosciusko School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Conservation Of Marine The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Mississippians Who Are Recipients Of The Department Of Defense Medal For The Defense Of Freedom; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Such License Tag From The Requirement That A Certain Number Of Such Tags Must Be Purchased Prior To Issuance; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Authorize The Owner Of An Antique Motorcycle, Upon Payment Of A Special License Tax Fee, To Display A Historical License Plate On Any Such Motorcycle; To Amend Section 27-19-56.352, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Coastal Conservation Association Mississippi; To Amend Section 27-19-56.322, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Oil And Gas Industry; To Amend Section 27-19-56.378, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Deceased Veteran Who Was Rated As Having One Hundred Percent Permanent Service-connected Disability Shall Be Entitled To Be Issued A Disabled Veteran License Plate Or Tag For As Long As The Spouse Session, Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Various Organizations And Have Never Met The Requirements To Be Issued; And For Related Purposes.

2113.title: Juvenile offenders; provide alternative sentencing options.
2113.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Alternative Sentencing Options For Juvenile Offenders In Certain Murder Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

2114.title: Cargo theft; create crime and provide penalties.
2114.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Crime Of Cargo Theft; To Provide For Certain Definitions; To Provide Penalties; To Provide For The Crime Of Unlawful Possession Or Use Of A Fifth Wheel; To Amend Section 97-25-25, In Conformity With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2116.title: Motor carriers; conform code sections to reflect prior transfer of duties of the PSC to the Transportation Commission.
2116.description: An Act To Amend Sections 77-7-7, 77-7-21, 77-7-23, 77-7-41, 77-7-55, 77-7-115, 77-7-119, 77-7-125, 77-7-127, 77-7-333, 77-7-335, 77-7-337 And 77-7-339, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Motor Carrier Laws, To Reflect The Prior Transfer Of The Duties Of The Public Service Commission To The Mississippi Transportation Commission; To Amend Sections 77-9-5, 77-9-119, 77-9-489 And 77-9-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To Such Prior Transfer Of Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2117.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; authorize issuance to supporters of the Order of the Eastern Star.
2117.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Order Of The Eastern Star In Hinds County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2118.title: Dept. of Fin. & Admin.; include condition of roofs at universities, community/junior colleges in capital needs report.
2118.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-11-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Include In Its Annual Study Of Capital Needs The Condition And Rating Of All Roofs At Each University, Community College And Junior College; To Provide That Each Roof Must Be Inspected Every Three Years; To Provide That Any Request For New Construction Shall Also Identify Sources Of Nonstate Funds To Support Such Project As Well As Proposed Sources Of Funds For Future Operating, Repair And Renovation Costs; And For Related Purposes.

2120.title: Kindergarten-age children; require compulsory school attendance for all.
2120.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-13-91 And 37-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Of The Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law Are Fully Applicable To Kindergarten-age Children; To Require Such Kindergarten-age Children To Attend Licensed Public, Parochial, Nonpublic Or Homeschool Kindergarten Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2121.title: Community and junior colleges; may enter into loans for up to 25 years with board of trustees' approval.
2121.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-29-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Board Of Trustees Of A Community Or Junior College To Enter Into Loans For Periods Not To Exceed 25 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2122.title: Arrest warrant; opportunity for probable cause hearing before issuance.
2122.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Probable Cause Hearing Upon A Criminal Affidavit Before Issuance Of Any Arrest Warrant At The Discretion Of The Court; And For Related Purposes.

2124.title: Homestead exemption; require annual application for and full reimbursement to local governments for tax loss.
2124.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Homestead Exemption To Be Applied For Annually; To Require The Date Of Birth Of The Owner And, If The Owner Is Married, The Date Or Birth Of His Or Her Spouse To Be Included In The Application For Homestead Exemption; To Amend Section 27-33-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Amount Of Reimbursement Of Homestead Exemption Revenue Losses For Counties And School Districts Shall Be The Full Amount Of Homestead Exemption Allowed For Each Applicant; To Amend Section 27-33-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2125.title: Drug court; clarify eligibility for.
2125.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-23-5 And 9-23-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Eligibility To Participate In Drug Court To Legislative Intent; And For Related Purposes.

2126.title: Municipally owned waterworks; prohibit from charging higher rates to certain customers in another municipality.
2126.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-27-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Certain Municipalities From Charging Greater Rates For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Outside Of And Within One Mile Of The Corporate Limits Of The Municipality Than For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Within The Municipality; To Amend Section 77-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Previous Section; And For Related Purposes.

2127.title: Tourism project incentive program; cultural retail attraction certificates expire on 7/1/18 unless complete by that date.
2127.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-26-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certificates Issued Under The Tourism Project Sales Tax Incentive Program Authorizing Participation In The Program By Entities That Are Developing Tourism Projects That Are Cultural Retail Attractions Shall Expire On July 1, 2018, Unless The Project Is Completed By Such Date; And For Related Purposes.

2128.title: Alcohol and Drug Treatment Pilot Program in Bolivar County; extend repeal date.
2128.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-940, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repeal Date Of The Alcohol And Drug Treatment Pilot Program In Bolivar County; And For Related Purposes.

2129.title: Small Business and Grocer Investment Act; revise the definition of "underserved community."
2129.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-10-705 And 57-10-707, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are A Part Of The Small Business And Grocer Investment Act, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "underserved Community;" To Remove A Provision That Prohibits The Use Of State Funds As A Source Of Funding For A Food Retailer Under The Program; To Revise The Eligibility Requirements For Applicants And Projects Under The Program; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Utilize A Certain Amount Of The Funds Available To The Program For Cost Of Administering The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2130.title: School districts; pilot program requiring pupils to read a minimum of four books per school year.
2130.description: An Act To Establish A Pilot Program Authorizing Local School Boards In The State To Require All Pupils In Grades 1 Through 12 To Read A Minimum Of Four Books Per School Year And Make Reports Thereon; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Issue Guidelines Under Which School Districts May Apply For Participation In This Pilot Program; And For Related Purposes.

2131.title: Children at risk; establish the Motivating Parents and Children (MPAC) pilot program for school districts.
2131.description: An Act To Establish A Motivating Parents And Children (mpac) Pilot Program Within The State Department Of Education For The Purpose Of Making Grants To School Districts That Provide Parental Involvement Services To Families Of Compulsory-school-age Children Residing In Such School District; To Set Forth The Purposes Of The Mpac Pilot Program; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Implement The Mpac Pilot Program; To Prescribe The Basic Components Of Services To Be Offered By School Districts Under The Mpac Pilot Program; To Provide An Application And Selection Procedure For School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 37-11-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Parents To Attend Conferences And Other Functions Of School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 63-1-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Children Under 18 Residing In School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program Who Withdraw From School May Have Their Driver's License Suspended; To Amend Section 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Such Minors From License Reinstatement Fees; To Amend Section 63-1-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2132.title: Outermost left lane of a multilane roadway; prohibit continuous travel by a motor vehicle.
2132.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-601, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Continuous Travel By A Motor Vehicle In The Outermost Left Lane Of A Multilane Roadway Whenever It Impedes Traffic Flow; And For Related Purposes.

2134.title: Appropriation FY2019; Alcorn State University for support of horticulture programs.
2134.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Support Of Horticulture Research And Extension Programs At Alcorn State University For Fiscal Year 2019.

2135.title: Domestic abuse; allow protection of pets in a protection order.
2135.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-21-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions In The Protection From Domestic Abuse Act; To Amend Section 93-21-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Court, In Issuing A Protection Order, To Include The Protection Of Pets In The Order; And For Related Purposes.

2136.title: Income tax; authorize credit for expenditures for participation of a child in a private elementary or high school program.
2136.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit In The Amount Of The Unreimbursed Educational Expenditures Made By A Taxpayer In Connection With Enrollment, Attendance, Or Participation Of The Taxpayer's Dependent Child In A Private Elementary Or High School Education Program Or Homeschooling In Mississippi; To Provide That The Amount Of Such Credit Shall Not Exceed An Amount Equal To The State Share Of The Adequate Education Program Payments For Each Student In Average Daily Attendance At The School District In Which The Dependent Child Resides; And For Related Purposes.

2137.title: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) and (SNAP) Programs; impose certain restrictions on expenditures.
2137.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Tanf Recipients From Purchasing Certain Items With Their Benefits And To Limit Tanf Atm Withdrawals; And For Related Purposes.

2138.title: Cosmetics; require disclosure of ingredients on manufacturer's website.
2138.description: An Act To Require A Manufacturer Of A Cosmetic Manufactured, Distributed Or Offered For Retail Sale In This State To Disclose On The Manufacturer's Internet Website The Full List Of Ingredients In The Cosmetic; To Provide That A Violation Of This Act Shall Be Deemed An Unfair Or Deceptive Trade Practice Under The Mississippi Consumer Protection Act; And For Related Purposes.

2139.title: Wildlife Trafficking Prevention Act; enact.
2139.description: An Act To Enact The "wildlife Trafficking Prevention Act"; To Prohibit The Purchase, Sell Or Exchange Of Certain Wildlife Species; To Provide A Civil Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2140.title: Tenth Circuit Court District; create subdistrict and additional judge.
2140.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-7-31 And 9-7-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Subdistricts Within The Tenth Circuit Court District And To Revise The Number Of Circuit Court Judges In That District; To Provide For Precinct Boundaries; To Provide For Candidacy For Election For Judgeships Before The Inception Of The Judgeship; And For Related Purposes.

2141.title: Tax evasion; limit prosecution's authority to plea bargain.
2141.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Discretion Of The Prosecutor In Any Prosecution For Tax Evasion; And For Related Purposes.

2142.title: Imitation firearms; prohibit sale of.
2142.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-10-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Imitation Firearm; To Amend Section 45-10-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Sale Or Display For Sale Of Imitation Firearms; To Amend Section 45-10-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2143.title: Highways; person may cross a public road or highway on an all-terrain vehicle.
2143.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-31-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Any Person On An All-terrain Vehicle To Cross Public Roads And Highways In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2144.title: Second chance; authorize expunction of certain nonviolent property crimes.
2144.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Expunction Of Certain Nonviolent Property Crimes; To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Imposition Of Expunction Fees By The Circuit Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2146.title: Public Defenders Education Fund; establish education and training cost.
2146.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-26-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Funds To The State Public Defender For Education Of Public Defenders; To Amend Section 37-26-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Education Fund Fee Charged In All Civil Cases; To Amend Section 37-26-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Distribution Of The Fee To The Appropriate Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2148.title: Youth court; revise transfer to circuit court.
2148.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-157, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Transfer From Youth Court To Circuit Court; And For Related Purposes.

2149.title: Landlord-tenant law; revise.
2149.description: An Act To Amend Section 89-8-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Certain Sanctions On Landlords Who Violate Specific Duties Under The Residential Landlord-tenant Act; And For Related Purposes.

2150.title: Statewide monetary assessments; discretionary.
2150.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Imposition Of The Statewide Monetary Assessments; And For Related Purposes.

2151.title: Violent habitual offender; require bifurcated trial.
2151.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Bifurcated Trial In Order To Sentence An Offender As An Habitual Violent Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2152.title: Juvenile sentencing; provide criteria for determining parole eligibility and require hearing before imposing life without parole.
2152.description: An Act To Authorize A Procedure Consistent With Decisions Of The United States Supreme Court And The Mississippi Supreme Court For The Parole Of Certain Offenders Who Were Under The Age Of Eighteen When They Committed The Crimes For Which They Are Sentenced; To Provide For The Procedure To Be Followed Before Certain Juvenile Offenders May Be Sentenced To Life Imprisonment Without The Possibility Of Parole; To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2153.title: Crimes of violence; revise list of offenses designated as such.
2153.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Offenses That Are Designated As Crimes Of Violence; And For Related Purposes.

2154.title: Trusty and earned-time programs; change eligibility to participate in.
2154.description: An Act To Expand Offenders' Access To Administrative Reductions In Time Through The Trusty-time Program And The Earned-time Allowance Program; To Provide That Offenders Convicted Of Crimes That Prohibit Reductions In Sentence Shall Be Ineligible For Such Programs; To Amend Sections 47-5-138.1, 47-5-139 And 47-7-3.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2155.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt property used for housing and providing services to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault.
2155.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Taxation All Property, Real Or Personal, Used Exclusively For The Housing Of And Provision Of Services To Victims Of Domestic Violence Or Sexual Assault, Which Is Owned, Operated And Managed By A Not-for-profit Corporation, Qualified Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

2156.title: Bonds; issue for the construction of career tech buildings at the Greenville Higher Education Center.
2156.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of Two Career Technical Buildings At The Greenville Higher Education Center; And For Related Purposes.

2157.title: Mississippi Minimum Wage Act; establish.
2157.description: An Act To Enact A Minimum Wage Law For The State Of Mississippi, With Annual Incremental Increases Over A Three-year Period; To Define Employers And Employees Subject To The Minimum Wage Law; To Empower The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Enforce And Administer The Provisions Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Provide Criminal Penalties And A Civil Cause Of Action Against Employers For Violations Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Amend Section 17-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Municipal And County Governing Authorities, In Their Discretion, To Mandate A Wage That Is More Than The State Minimum Wage; To Amend Section 25-3-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2159.title: Violent habitual offender; revise.
2159.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sentencing Of An Offender As A Habitual Violent Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2160.title: Habitual offender; revise sentencing.
2160.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Habitual Offender Sentencing; And For Related Purposes.

2162.title: Lotteries; repeal advertising prohibitions.
2162.description: An Act To Repeal Section 97-33-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits The Advertising Of Lotteries; To Repeal Section 97-33-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Publication Or Circulation Of Newspapers Advertising A Lottery; To Repeal Section 97-33-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits The Sale Of Newspapers Containing A Lottery Advertisement; And For Related Purposes.

2163.title: Controlled substance offenses; revise enhanced penalties.
2163.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Sale Of Controlled Substances Within A Certain Distance From Schools; To Repeal Section 41-29-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Enhanced Penalties For Second And Subsequent Drug Offenses; And For Related Purposes.

2164.title: Marijuana; allow medical use by seriously ill patients, including service-connected PTSD.
2164.description: An Act To Authorize The Medical Use Of Marijuana By Seriously Ill Patients Under A Physician's Supervision; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide An Exemption From Criminal And Civil Penalties For The Medical Use Of Marijuana; To Provide Limitations On The Medical Use Of Marijuana; To Provide A Legal Defense For Patients And Primary Caregivers; To Amend Sections 41-29-113 And 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Marijuana From Schedule I To Schedule Ii Under The Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Medical Use Of Marijuana From Criminal Penalties Under The Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2165.title: Habitual offender; revise sentencing as.
2165.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sentencing Of An Offender Dependent On The Age Of The Offender At The Time Of The Commission Of The Prior Offenses; And For Related Purposes.

2166.title: Expunction; allow after 20 years' good behavior.
2166.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Court Of Conviction To Expunge The Record Of Any Felony Other Than A Violent Offense Or A Sex Crime After 20 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2167.title: Simple drug possession; reclassify offense.
2167.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reclassify Low-level Simple Drug Possession; And For Related Purposes.

2168.title: Expunction of conviction; revise.
2168.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Felonies For Which A Court May Grant Expunction Of Record; And For Related Purposes.

2169.title: Expunction of felony; revise.
2169.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Expunction Of A Felony Record Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2170.title: Marijuana; legalize.
2170.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Marijuana From The List Of Schedule I Controlled Substances; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Penalty For Possession Of Controlled Substances Other Than Marijuana; To Amend Section 41-29-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Definitions For The Uniform Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Sections 41-29-136, 41-29-147, 41-29-149.1, 41-29-150 And 33-13-520, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2171.title: State employee salaries; direct State Personnel Board to implement across-the-board increase.
2171.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Personnel Board To Amend The Variable Compensation Plan As Necessary To Award A Salary Increase To Each State Employee Whose Salary Is Funded By The State General Fund In The Amount Of A 5% Across-the-board Increase Per Year Beginning July 1, 2018; And For Related Purposes.

2172.title: Habitual offender; prior felonies more than 10 years prior not counted in calculation.
2172.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Calculation To Determine Whether An Offender Should Be Sentenced As A Habitual Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2174.title: Expunction; allow for all nonviolent felonies.
2174.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Court Of Conviction To Expunge The Record Of Any Felony Other Than A Violent Offense; And For Related Purposes.

2175.title: Habitual offender sentencing; revise.
2175.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Habitual Offender Sentencing; And For Related Purposes.

2177.title: Crimes of violence; remove references to parole and early release from provision of law designating offenses as such.
2177.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Provision Of Law Designating Certain Offenses As Crimes Of Violence Does Not Deem An Offender Eligible Or Ineligible For Parole Or Early Release; And For Related Purposes.

2178.title: Counties; authorize to make emergency expenditures for purpose of settling lawful claims for personal injury or property damage.
2178.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-11-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties To Make Emergency Expenditures For The Purpose Of Settling Lawful Claims For Personal Injury Or Property Damage Where The County Is Liable Therefor Under Law; And For Related Purposes.

2179.title: Health insurers; require to release certain claims data upon request of group policyholder.
2179.description: An Act To Provide That Every Health And Accident Insurance Issuer, Including A Health Maintenance Organization, Shall, Upon Request, Release To Each Group Policyholder Or Agent Of A Policy Holder Certain Claims Data; To Provide Immunity From Civil Liability To A Health And Accident Insurer That Provides Such Data; To Require Certification By A Plan Sponsor Before Receiving Protected Health Information; And For Related Purposes.

2180.title: Salvage certificate of title; vehicles with may not receive a clear title but may receive a branded title.
2180.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-21-15 And 63-21-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provisions That Authorize A Vehicle With A Salvage Certificate Of Title To Receive A Clear Title If Certain Requirements Are Met And Provide That Such A Vehicle May Only Receive A Branded Title; And For Related Purposes.

2181.title: Alcoholic beverages; allow direct shipment of wines to package retailers and on-premises retailers.
2181.description: An Act To Authorize Certain Persons Domiciled Outside This State To Lawfully Ship Directly To Package Retailers And On-premises Retailers; To Provide That Such Manufactured Wine Must Be Purchased Through The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue; To Require Package Retailers To Pay The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division For The Manufactured Wine And Pay All Taxes, Fees And Markups Imposed On The Manufactured Wine Prior To Any Such Shipment; To Require A Person 21 Years Of Age Or Older To Sign For Manufactured Wine Shipped To A Package Retailer Under This Act; To Require Shipments Of Manufactured Wine Into This State Under This Act To Be Made By A Duly Licensed Carrier; To Make It Clear That All Taxes, Fees And Surcharges That Are Imposed Upon The Sale Of Wine Shipped By The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue Apply To Wine Shipped Under This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Sections 27-71-15 And 67-1-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2182.title: Access to children's records; require release to member of Legislature per release form.
2182.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Release Of Certain Children's Records To A Committee Or Member Of The Legislature Upon Prior Written Consent Of The Parent, Guardian Or Custodian Of The Child; To Set Forth Minimum Requirements For The Written Release; And For Related Purposes.

2183.title: Local public officials; increase salaries of.
2183.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Limit On Compensation Of Chancery Clerks And Circuit Clerks; To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Commissioners Of Election To Be Paid Per Diem In The Amount Of $100.00 For The Performance Of Their Duties On Nonelection Days; To Amend Section 23-15-225, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Compensation Of County Registrars Of Election; To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Salaries Of County Tax Assessors And Collectors; To Bring Forward Section 25-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Cap On The Salaries Of Tax Assessors, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 25-3-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Salaries Of County Supervisors; To Amend Section 25-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Filing Fees Charged By Chancery Clerks For The Recording Of Documents; To Amend Section 25-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee Paid To The Circuit Clerk For Each Day's Attendance Upon The Circuit Court Term; To Amend Section 25-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Charged By Sheriffs; To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Charged By Marshals And Constables; To Amend Section 41-61-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Salary Of The County Medical Examiners, Deputy Medical Examiners And Deputy Medical Examiner Investigators; To Amend Reenacted Section 41-61-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fees Paid By The County To A Medical Examiner Or His Deputy For Filing Certain Investigation Reports, And To Extend The Date Of Repeal Thereon; To Bring Forward Section 25-60-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Filing Fee For Certain Documents, For Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2184.title: State highway system; require certain section of MS Highway 9 in Pontotoc County to remain in the system.
2184.description: An Act To Provide That Mississippi Highway 9 In Pontotoc County Shall Remain In The State Highway System; To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Maintain That Section Of Mississippi Highway 9; And For Related Purposes.

2185.title: Women in High-Wage, High-Demand, Nontraditional Jobs Grant Program; authorize in Mississippi Department of Employment Security.
2185.description: An Act To Establish A Women In High-wage, High-demand, Nontraditional Jobs Grant Program Under The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security; To Provide Definitions; To Provide For The Use Of Grant Funds And Grant Applications; To Authorize The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security To Implement This Act And Monitor The Use Of Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2186.title: Community Policing and Transparency Act; create body-worn camera policy standards.
2186.description: An Act To Provide Procedures For Use Of Body-worn Cameras By Law Enforcement Officers; To Describe How Video From The Cameras Must Be Retained By Law Enforcement Agencies; To Authorize Who May Obtain A Copy Of A Recording; To Provide Remedies For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2187.title: Juvenile offenders; provide alternative sentencing and parole options if convicted of certain offenses.
2187.description: An Act To Provide Alternative Sentencing And Parole Options For Juvenile Offenders In Certain Murder Convictions; To Amend Sections 97-3-21, 97-3-2 And 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2188.title: Suspension of licensed school district employee for five days or less; no requirement for due process hearing by school district.
2188.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That There Shall Be No Requirement For A Due Process Hearing In The Event A Licensed School District Employee Is Suspended For Five Days Or Less; And For Related Purposes.

2189.title: Forensic Mental Health Act of 2018; create.
2189.description: An Act To Create The Forensic Mental Health Act Of 2018; To Ensure Constitutional Protections For People With Mental Health Concerns Who Are Involved With The Criminal Justice System; To Require The Department Of Mental Health To Develop Standards For Certification Of Providers Authorized To Perform Mental Examinations For Criminal Defendants And To Provide Training To The Providers; To Amend Section 99-13-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Mental Examination Of Persons Charged With A Felony; To Amend Section 41-21-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Jurisdiction Over A Person With Unresolved Violent Felony Charges Whose Mental Competency Is In Question; To Amend Section 41-21-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2190.title: Mississippi Uniform Power of Attorney Act; create.
2190.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Uniform Power Of Attorney Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Applicability Of This Act; To Provide For The Execution, Validity And Meaning Of A Power Of Attorney; To Provide For The Nomination Of Conservators Or Guardians; To Provide When A Power Of Attorney Is Effective; To Provide For The Termination Of A Power Of Attorney Or An Agent's Authority; To Provide The Duties And Responsibilities Of Agents; To Provide For The Exoneration Of An Agent; To Provide For Judicial Relief; To Provide For The Resignation Of Agents And Notice Thereof; To Provide For Acceptance And Reliance Upon An Acknowledged Power Of Attorney; To Provide Liability For Refusal To Accept An Acknowledged Power Of Attorney; To Provide Authority That Requires Specific Grant; To Provide For The Incorporation And Construction Of Authority; To Provide For The Authority Of An Agent And The Uses Therefor; To Provide Forms For A Power Of Attorney; To Provide For An Agent's Certification; To Amend Section 75-3-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Sections 87-3-101, 87-3-103, 87-3-105, 87-3-107, 87-3-109, 87-3-111 And 87-3-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constitute The Uniform Durable Power Of Attorney Act; And For Related Purposes.

2191.title: Lottery; create and use proceeds to fund Vision 21 projects and for maintenance of state maintained highways.
2191.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create The "vision 21 Construction Supplement Fund" And To Provide That 75% Of The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited Into Such Fund To Be Used Exclusively For The Completion Of Projects In The Vision 21 Program; To Create The State Highway Maintenance Fund Into Which 25% Of The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited Into Such Fund To Be Used Exclusively For The Maintenance Of State Maintained Highways; To Provide That Upon Completion Of All The Projects In The Vision 21 Program, 50% Of The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited In The State General Fund And 50% Of The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited Into The State Highway Maintenance Fund; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

2192.title: Governmental entities; prohibit public funding of advertisements, lobbying activities and certain convention or other meetings.
2192.description: An Act To Create Section 5-8-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms And To Prohibit State Agencies And Political Subdivisions From Lobbying The Legislature Or Expending Public Funds To Pay Contract Lobbyists; To Amend Section 5-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Prohibit State Agencies And Political Subdivisions From Using Radio And Television Advertising To Promote Agency Programs, Except In Certain Instances; To Prohibit Governmental Entity Sponsorship, In Whole Or In Part, Of Certain Private Conventions And Meetings; To Amend Sections 17-3-1 And 17-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2193.title: Yazoo-Mississippi Delta Levee Board; revise maximum amount of per diem paid to members of the board.
2193.description: An Act To Amend Section 2, Chapter 170, Laws Of 1922, As Amended, To Revise The Maximum Amount Of Per Diem Which May Be Paid To Commissioners Of The Yazoo-mississippi Delta Levee Board; And For Related Purposes.

2194.title: Commercial mobile radio service providers; shall automatically compensate customers for loss of service.
2194.description: An Act To Require A Commercial Mobile Radio Service Provider Doing Business In This State To Automatically Compensate Its Customer For Any Loss Of Service With Certain Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2195.title: Capitol Complex Improvement District projects; authorize DFA to issue short-term debt to implement and administer projects.
2195.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-215, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Issue Short-term Debt To Implement And Administer The Projects In The Capitol Complex Improvement District Secured By The Portion Of The Proceeds Of The Special Sales Tax Allocated To The Capitol Complex Improvement District Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2196.title: Local government capital improvements revolving loan program; include municipal natural gas facilities.
2196.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "capital Improvements" As Used In The Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Program To Include Repair, Renovation And Improvement Of Municipal Natural Gas Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2197.title: Homestead exemption; a joint owner who fulfills the age requirement qualifies for the exemption in full under certain circumstances.
2197.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Owner Of Jointly Owned Property Who Fulfills The Age Requirement For Over 65 Homestead Exemption And Is Utilizing The Property As A Homestead Shall Be Eligible For The Over 65 Exemption In Full If No Other Joint Owner Is Residing At The Property; And For Related Purposes.

2198.title: Public Service Commission; extend repealers/clarify enforcement authority and jurisdiction.
2198.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 77-1-1, 77-1-3, 77-1-5, 77-1-6, 77-1-11, 77-1-15, 77-1-17, 77-1-19, 77-1-21, 77-1-25, 77-1-27, 77-1-29, 77-1-31, 77-1-33, 77-1-35, 77-1-37, 77-1-39, 77-1-41, 77-1-43, 77-1-47 And 77-1-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Public Service Commission And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties; To Amend Reenacted Section 77-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Method Of Enforcement Of Certain Laws, Rules, Regulations, Orders, Decisions And Determinations Of The Commission; To Amend Section 77-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Those Sections; To Amend Section 77-1-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On This Section Which Authorizes The Commission And The Public Utilities Staff To Hire Attorneys And Consultants For Certain Proceedings; To Amend Section 77-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Exclusive Jurisdiction Of The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2199.title: Group health insurance plan coverage for prescription drugs; authorize medication synchronization for beneficiaries.
2199.description: An Act To Provide That All Individual And Group Health Insurance Contracts Providing Prescription Drug Coverage In The State Shall Apply A Prorated Daily Cost-sharing Rate For A Partial Supply To Allow Beneficiaries To Synchronize Their Medications On The Same Day Each Month; To Provide That This Medication Synchronization Authority Shall Be Fully Applicable To The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan And The Mississippi Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2200.title: Secondhand mattress; must be clearly labeled as such.
2200.description: An Act To Create New Section 75-24-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Secondhand Mattresses To Be Clearly Labeled When Sold To A Consumer; To Define Terms; To Create Exceptions; To Enact Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2201.title: Absentee voting; may be conducted by voting machine if clerk and board of supervisors approve.
2201.description: An Act To Authorize Boards Of Supervisors And Circuit Clerks Or County Registrars To Approve The Use Of Direct Recording Electronic Voting Units And Optical Mark Reading Equipment For Absentee Voting; And For Related Purposes.

2202.title: Absentee voting by mail; change notarization requirements for ballots submitted by certain college students.
2202.description: An Act To Remove The Requirement That A Full-time Student Of Any College, University Or Community/junior College Who Is Qualified To Vote Absentee By Mail Have His Or Her Ballot Envelope Notarized; To Provide That The Student Must Have His Or Her Ballot Envelope Witnessed And Signed By An Employee Of The Office Of The Registrar Of The University Or College Wherein The Student Is Enrolled; To Amend Sections 23-15-631 And 23-15-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2203.title: Services for Medicaid-eligible children with an IEP provided in school-based setting; Division of Medicaid shall reimburse.
2203.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That It Is The Responsibility Of The Division Of Medicaid To Reimburse Services To Medicaid-eligible Children With An Individualized Education Plan (iep) Provided In A School-based Setting And To Extend The Repealer; And For Related Purposes.

2204.title: Gaming; authorize and regulate video gaming.
2204.description: An Act To Authorize Video Gaming In This State; To Provide That The Mississippi Gaming Commission Shall Have Regulatory Authority Over The Conduct Of Video Gaming Or Related Activities As Described In This Act; To Provide That The Commission Shall Ensure The Integrity Of The Acquisition And Operation Of Video Gaming Terminals, Redemption Terminals And Associated Equipment And Shall Have Sole Regulatory Authority Over Every Aspect Of The Conduct Of Video Gaming; To Grant The Commission Certain Powers And Duties; To Authorize The Commission To Take Certain Disciplinary Actions And To Provide For Appeals From Decisions Of The Commission; To Require The Licensing Of Video Gaming Operators And The Persons Employed By Video Gaming Operators; To Require The Licensing Of Manufactures And Suppliers Of Video Gaming Equipment; To Provide The Requirements For Licensure Under This Act; To Require Testing And Certifying Of Video Gaming Machines By The Commission; To Limit The Number Of Video Gaming Machines That May Be Placed On The Premises Of A Licensee; To Limit The Amount Of Wagers That May Be Made; To Provide Certain Civil And Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Establish The Fees For The Various Licenses Authorized Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2206.title: Organized retail theft; revise.
2206.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Organized Retail Theft And Organized Retail Theft Enterprise; To Amend Section 97-43-3.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2207.title: Nursing homes and assisted living facilities; required to have working generators.
2207.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Health To Adopt Rules Requiring The State Department Of Health To Determine Compliance With Standards For Electricity And Emergency Power Sources During Routine Inspections Of Licensed Nursing And Assisted Living Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2209.title: Habitual offender; revise sentencing under.
2209.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sentencing Of An Offender As A Habitual Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2210.title: Dept. of Agriculture; require to place a notice of amount of federal & state fuel tax per gallon on gasoline & diesel fuel pumps.
2210.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Revenue To Place On Each Pump That Dispenses Gasoline Or Diesel Fuel For Retail Sale, A Notice That States Separately The Amount Of Federal Tax And The Amount Of State Tax Levied On Each Gallon Of Gasoline Or Diesel Fuel; And For Related Purposes.

2211.title: Child endangerment; clarify elements of the offense of.
2211.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Elements Of The Offense Of Child Endangerment By The Sale, Transfer, Manufacture Or Possession Of Either A Controlled Substance Or A Prohibited Precursor Chemical; And For Related Purposes.

2212.title: High School graduation standards; require completion of at least one course online for students graduating in 2020 and after.
2212.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Completion Of At Least One Course That Is Presented Online For Students Graduating From High School In 2020 And Thereafter; And For Related Purposes.

2213.title: Charitable solicitation; revise exemption of humane societies.
2213.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-11-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemption From Registration For Solicitation As A Charitable Entity For Humane Societies; And For Related Purposes.

2215.title: Sales tax on admissions; exempt certain events sponsored by municipalities.
2215.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Any Admissions Charged At Certain Events, Activities Or Entertainments Held On Property Controlled By A Municipality, Or An Agency Thereof, Which Are Created And Sponsored By The Municipality Or An Agency Thereof; To Authorize Municipalities To Elect To Require The Tax To Continue To Be Imposed; And For Related Purposes.

2216.title: Pseudoephedrine; require written log of pharmacy sales; revise prescription quantity.
2216.description: An Act To Require That Pharmacies Keep A Written Log Of All Ephedrine And Pseudoephedrine Sales; To Prescribe A Standard For The Written Log; To Provide Penalties For Violations; To Enact Exceptions; To Require The Board Of Pharmacy To Devise And Approve Training Programs For Pharmacy Employees; To Amend Section 41-29-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Ephedrine And Pseudoephedrine From Schedule Iii Of The Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 41-29-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time Limits And Transferability Of A Prescription For Pseudoephedrine; And For Related Purposes.

2217.title: Concealed carry permit holders; names of those revoked not confidential.
