2682.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services (mdits) To Charge State Agencies Pass-through Costs For Telecommunications, Data Center Services And/or Other Information Technology Services To The Agencies Using Those Services On An As-needed Basis; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Charge State Agencies For Mississippi Management And Reporting Systems (mmrs) Statewide Application Charges And Utility Charges If Federal Grants, Special Funds Or Pass-through Funds Are Involved; To Amend Section 27-104-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Restrictions On The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services Being Funded From The State General Fund; To Amend Sections 25-53-5, 25-53-29 And 25-53-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2683.title: Bonds; revise purposes of bonds authorized to be issued for the John C. Robinson Aviation Museum.
2683.description: An Act To Amend Section 8, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, To Revise The Purposes For Which Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The John C. Robinson Mississippi Aviation Museum Fund May Be Utilized; And For Related Purposes.

2684.title: Concealed carry permit; revise term and fee.
2684.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Effective Term Of And Fees Charged For A Concealed-carry Permit; And For Related Purposes.

2685.title: Muniment of title; revise parties entitled to notice.
2685.description: An Act To Amend Section 91-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Parties Entitled To Notice When A Will Is Admitted To Probate As A Muniment Of Title Only Without Necessity Of Administration Of The Estate Or Appointment Of An Executor Or Administrator; To Amend Section 91-7-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A One-year Statute Of Limitations Applicable To Estates; To Bring Forward Section 15-1-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2686.title: Misdemeanants; may not possess a weapon under certain circumstances.
2686.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Possession Of A Weapon By Certain Misdemeanants; And For Related Purposes.

2687.title: Consigned motor fuels; create crime of larceny of.
2687.description: An Act To Provide That It Is Unlawful To Take, Use, Sell Or Dispose Of Consigned Motor Fuels Without The Consent Of The Consignor; To Provide A Definition For Consigned Motor Fuels; To Require A Written Agreement Between Consignors And Consignees Of Motor Fuels That States Title To The Consigned Motor Fuels Is Vested In The Consignor; To Provide Penalties For The Theft Of Consigned Motor Fuels; And For Related Purposes.

2688.title: Youth court; revise confidentiality of forensic interview.
2688.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Confidential Status Of Forensic Interviews In Youth Court; And For Related Purposes.

2689.title: Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance; establish priority of funding for certain programs.
2689.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Priority Funding For The Higher Education Legislative Grant Program; And For Related Purposes.

2690.title: State land; remove application waiting period on forfeited tax land; clarify procedure for refunds on cancelled patents.
2690.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Certain Applications For The Purchase Of State-forfeited Tax Land Must Remain On File For 30 Days Before They May Be Acted Upon And Finally Approved Or Disapproved; To Amend Sections 29-1-85 And 29-1-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Procedure For Refunds To Purchasers Of Amounts Paid To The State For Patents On Land That Have Been Cancelled; And For Related Purposes.

2691.title: School district consolidation; require in Perry County.
2691.description: An Act To Repeal Section 1 Of Chapter 437, Laws Of 2017, Which Established A Commission On Perry-richton Consolidated School District Structure To Make Recommendations To The 2018 Regular Session Of The Legislature Regarding The Method For Consolidating The County Into One School District With One Local School Board; To Provide That In The Perry County And Richton School Districts There Shall Be An Administrative Consolidation Into One School District To Be Designated As The Perry County School District Effective July 1, 2019; To Provide For The Composition Of The Board Of Education Of The New Perry County School District; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Administratively Consolidate Any School District Which Does Not Voluntarily Follow The Consolidation Order; To Abolish The Former School Districts Following The Administrative Consolidation And Provide For The Transfer Of School District Assets And Liabilities; To Provide For Execution Of Teacher And School District Employee Contracts And The Preparation Of A School District Budget In The New School District; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Promulgate Regulations To Implement Such Administrative Consolidation; To Provide A Two-year Waiver From Accountability And State Assessment Requirements For The New Student Population; To Amend Sections 37-7-103 And 37-5-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2692.title: Child abuse and neglect; provide for release of file in response to subpoena.
2692.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow For The Production Of Records By The Department Of Human Services In Response To Subpoena When A Legal Action Is Pending; To Allow A Thirty-day Delay To Provide For Opportunity To Move To Quash; And For Related Purposes.

2693.title: Jackson County Utility Authority; reconstitute board of directors and revise provisions relating to the board.
2693.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-17-733, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reconstitute The Board Of Directors For The Jackson County Utility Authority; To Reduce Length Of The Appointed Term From Six Years To Four Years; To Delete The Prohibition Against Elected Officials Serving On The Board; To Provide For A Quorum Of The Board; And For Related Purposes.

2695.title: Youth court; revise jurisdiction of for certain cases involving juveniles in possession of firearms.
2695.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Jurisdiction Of Youth Courts With Respect To Certain Cases Involving Possession Of A Firearm By A Juvenile; And For Related Purposes.

2696.title: State Land Mammal; designate American Black Bear as.
2696.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The American Black Bear As One Of The State Land Mammals; And For Related Purposes.

2697.title: Railroad grade crossings; prohibit obstruction of vehicular traffic for more than 20 consecutive minutes at grade crossings.
2697.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-9-235, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Any Train, Railroad Car Or Equipment, Or Engine From Obstructing Vehicular Traffic At A Railroad Grade Crossing Upon A Public Street, Road Or Highway For A Period In Excess Of 20 Consecutive Minutes; To Provide Exceptions To Such Prohibition; To Provide Fines For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2698.title: Public utilities; charitable or civic contributions shall not be allowed as costs or expenses for rate-making purposes.
2698.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charitable Or Civic Contributions Made By Public Utilities Shall Not Be Allowed In Any Amount As Costs Or Expenses For Rate-making Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2699.title: Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program; earmark minimum number of awards for teachers of advanced placement courses.
2699.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2018-2019 School Year At Least Two Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program Awards Shall Be Made In Each Mississippi Congressional District For Teacher Education Students Who Agree To Teach Advanced Placement Courses; And For Related Purposes.

2700.title: Public lands; reestablish Office of State Land Commissioner and transfer authority of Secretary of State relative to supervision of.
2700.description: An Act To Codify Section 7-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reestablish The Office Of State Land Commissioner And Provide For His Election At The Same Time And Manner As Other State Officials Are Elected; To Empower And Authorize The State Land Commissioner To Have General Supervision Over Public Lands, Sixteenth Section Or Lieu Lands, Chickasaw School Lands And Lands Forfeited To The State For Nonpayment Of Taxes To The Same Extent As Such Lands Are Supervised By The Secretary Of State; To Amend Sections 7-11-2, 7-11-3, 7-11-4, 7-11-6, 7-11-8, 7-11-11, 7-11-13, 7-11-15, 7-11-17, 7-11-19, 7-11-25 And 29-3-1.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2701.title: Appeal bond; set the maximum amount for appeals from decisions of local governments as to taxes.
2701.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-51-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Amount Of The Appeal Bond Required For An Appeal From A Decision By A Board Of Supervisors Or Municipal Authorities As To The Assessment Of Taxes Shall Be Not Less Than $100.00 Nor More Than $10,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

2702.title: Advanced practice registered nurses; revise licensure requirements.
2702.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-3, 73-15-5, 73-15-20 And 73-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Licensure Requirements, Definitions, Practice Requirements And Disciplinary Provisions Applicable To Advanced Practice Registered Nurses; And For Related Purposes.

2703.title: Alcoholic Beverage; authorize tourism permits that allow the sale & sampling of throughout a tourism development.
2703.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of Tourism Permits To Tourism Developments; To Provide That A Tourism Permit Authorizes The Holder To Sell Alcoholic Beverages By The Drink, To Offer Of Complementary Samples Of Alcoholic Beverage And Sell At Retail Alcoholic Beverage In Original Sealed And Unopened Packages Containing Not Less Than 50 Milliliters By Liquid Measure; To Provide That Sales Of Alcoholic Beverages And The Offering Of Complementary Samples May Occur At Any Location On The Premises Of The Tourism Development So Long As Common Ownership Of The Premises Exists; To Provide That A The Term "tourism Development" Means A Premises Containing Not Less Than 300 Hotel Rooms Or Suites, Retail Shops, Theater, Lounge Or Other Entertainment Venues And Not Less Than Two Restaurants; To Provide That A Tourism Development May Include, But Not Be Limited To, Amenities Such As A Spa, Golf Course, Casino, Beauty Salon, Coffee Shop, Marina, Pool, Snack Bar And Beach Area; To Amend Section 67-1-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Penalties For Noncompliance With The Requirements Of A Tourism Permit; To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Fee For A Tourism Permit; And For Related Purposes.

2704.title: Gaming Control Act; clarify the term "applicant," require applicants to pay certain additional costs; increase license fee.
2704.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Term "applicant"; To Amend Section 75-76-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Gaming Commission Shall Adopt Regulations Requiring Applicants To Pay All Fees And Costs Of Investigating An Applicant's Request For Any Required Prelicensing Or Post-licensing Regulatory Approvals, Including, But Not Limited To, Gaming Site Approval And Approval To Proceed With Development; To Amend Section 75-76-183, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Application Fee For A License To Conduct Gaming Aboard A Vessel Or Cruise Vessel; And For Related Purposes.

2705.title: Courts; prohibit application of foreign law.
2705.description: An Act To Protect Rights And Privileges Granted Under The United States Constitution And The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890; To Address The Application Of Foreign Laws In Judicial Proceedings In This State; To Provide Legislative Findings; To Define Certain Terms; To Prohibit The Use And Enforcement Of Foreign Laws Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Applicability In Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2706.title: Sexting; create delinquent act of.
2706.description: An Act To Create The Act Of "sexting" As A Delinquent Act Within The Original Jurisdiction Of The Youth Court; To Create Certain Exceptions; To Create Defenses; And For Related Purposes.

2707.title: Good samaritan immunity from liability law; extend to architects and engineers who volunteer during disasters.
2707.description: An Act To Provide Civil Immunity From Liability Resulting From Personal Injury, Wrongful Death Property Damage Or Other Loss Caused By A Professional Engineer's Or Architect's Acts, Errors Or Omissions In The Performance Of Voluntary Professional Services Provided Under Emergency Situations Caused By Catastrophic Events; To Provide That Such Immunity Does Not Apply If The Injury Results From Gross Negligence Or Willful Misconduct; And For Related Purposes.

2709.title: Drug court; unsuccessful participants must serve time in original jurisdiction.
2709.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-23-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Unsuccessful Drug Court Participants Must Serve Their Time From The Original Offense Incarcerated In The Original Jurisdiction In Which The Prosecution Was Commenced; And For Related Purposes.

2710.title: English Language Learners (ELL) programs; earmark Education Enhancement Fund.
2710.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-177-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Proportionate Share Of The Residual Funds In The Education Enhancement Fund Prescribed For Use For Other Educational Needs Shall Be Appropriated For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funding For Educational Support And Teacher Resources To School Districts With 8% Or More Of Its Student Enrollment Comprised Of English Language Learners; To Amend Section 37-61-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2711.title: SNAP fraud cases; revise statutes to comply with federal regulations.
2711.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-7-42 And 97-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Provisions To Bring The Department Of Human Services Into Compliance With Federal Regulations Regarding Snap Fraud And Provide For Collecting Restitution In Such Cases; And For Related Purposes.

2712.title: Child support obligations; allow administrative suspension if noncustodial parent is incarcerated for more than 180 days, etc.
2712.description: An Act To Codify Section 43-19-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Administrative Suspension Of Child Support For Noncustodial Parents Who Are Incarcerated For More Than 180 Days; To Amend Section 43-19-48, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Financial Institutions To Authorize The Department Of Human Services To Send Notices Regarding Child Support In A Manner Other Than Certified Mail; To Amend Sections 93-11-65, 93-11-103 And 93-11-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Overdue Child Support Is Payable To The Custodial Parent After Emancipation Of A Child Unless A Court Determines Otherwise, Clarify Lump-sum Withholdings And Clarify When An Employer May Receive A Fee For Withholding Child Support; And For Related Purposes.

2713.title: Criminal record background checks; allow Department of Human Services to conduct on all employees, contractors and volunteers.
2713.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-1-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Department Of Human Services To Conduct Fingerprinting And Background Investigations On Every Employee, Contractor, Subcontractor And Volunteer; And For Related Purposes.

2714.title: Auditor of the correctional system; repeal position.
2714.description: An Act To Repeal Section 47-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates And Empowers The Position Of Auditor Of The Correctional System; And For Related Purposes.

2716.title: Natural resources; recommend an assessment of the value of Mississippi's natural resources.
2716.description: An Act To Recommend The Assessment Of The Economic Value Of The Natural Resources Of The State; And For Related Purposes.

2718.title: Transportation; require MDOT to develop a complete streets program.
2718.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Complete Streets Legislation; And For Related Purposes.

2720.title: Prescription Monitoring Program; require dispensers and prescribers to check database.
2720.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Dispensers And Prescribers To Check The Prescription Monitoring Program Database Before Dispensing Or Prescribing Certain Drugs; To Delete The Sunset Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2721.title: Health insurance policies; require coverage for colorectal cancer examinations.
2721.description: An Act To Require That Certain Insurance Policies And Contracts Shall Provide Coverage For All Colorectal Cancer Examinations And Laboratory Tests Specified In Current American Cancer Society (acs) Guidelines For Colorectal Cancer Screening; To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan Shall Include Coverage For All Colorectal Cancer Examinations And Laboratory Tests Specified In Current Guidelines; And For Related Purposes.

2722.title: Payday lending; prohibit activities of and declare public nuisance.
2722.description: An Act To Declare Legislative Intent To Prohibit Activities Commonly Referred To As Payday Lending, Deferred Presentment Services, Advance Cash Services And Other Similar Activities; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Engage In The Business Of Making Certain Small Loans; To Provide Criminal Penalties Therefor; To Provide For Collection Of Civil Penalties In Actions By The State Or By Private Parties On Behalf Of The State; To Declare The Site Or Location Of A Place Of Business Where Payday Lending Takes Place In The State Of Mississippi As A Public Nuisance; To Repeal Sections 75-67-401 Through 75-67-449, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Title Pledge Act; To Repeal Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

2723.title: Mississippi Adequate Education Program; increase funding for at-risk pupils.
2723.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Allotment Of Mississippi Adequate Education Program Funding For At-risk Students; And For Related Purposes.

2724.title: Marijuana; allow medical use by seriously ill patients under doctor's supervision.
2724.description: An Act To Authorize The Medical Use Of Marijuana By Seriously Ill Patients Under A Physician's Supervision; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide An Exemption From Criminal And Civil Penalties For The Medical Use Of Marijuana; To Provide Limitations On The Medical Use Of Marijuana; To Provide A Legal Defense For Patients And Primary Caregivers; To Amend Sections 41-29-113 And 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Marijuana From Schedule I To Schedule Ii Under The Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Medical Use Of Marijuana From Criminal Penalties Under The Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2725.title: Drug offenders; clarify parole eligibility.
2725.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Parole Eligibility For Certain Drug Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

2726.title: State Agency Accountability and Transparency website; include 5 oldest Public Records Act requests for each agency.
2726.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Department Of Finance And Administration To Include On The State Agency Accountability And Transparency Website A Description Of The Five Oldest Public Records Act Or Freedom Of Information Act (foia) Requests; And For Related Purposes.

2728.title: Driver's education; require for drivers under age 17.
2728.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Drivers Under The Age Of 17 To Have Completed A Driver's Education Course In Order To Hold An Intermediate License; And For Related Purposes.

2729.title: Computer and electronic waste; require management plan for recycling and disposal.
2729.description: An Act To Provide A Program For The Recycling And Disposal Of Computer And Electronic Solid Waste; To Require Each State Agency To Implement Such Program; To Provide For The Sale Or Donation Of Such Equipment; To Create A Computer And Electronic Recycling Fund; To Provide For The Disbursement Of Fund Proceeds; And For Related Purposes.

2730.title: Appointments to state agency boards and commissions; shall give due regard to race, gender and geographic distribution.
2730.description: An Act To Provide That The Governor, Lieutenant Governor And Any Other Appointing Authority Shall Give Due Regard To Race And Gender In Making Appointments To State Agency Boards And Commissions, And Shall Give Due Regard To The Geographical Distribution Of Appointments Across The State Of Mississippi And The Real Possibility Of Mississippi's Congressional Districts Being Reduced From Four To Three; To Provide That Members Of State Agency Boards And Commissions Shall Give Due Regard To Race And Gender In Sending Designees To Meetings; To Specify The State Agency Boards And Commissions To Which This Act Applies; And For Related Purposes.

2731.title: "Protecting Freedom of Conscience from Government Discrimination Act"; repeal.
2731.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 11-62-1, 11-62-3, 11-62-5, 11-62-7, 11-62-9, 11-62-11, 11-62-13, 11-62-15, 11-62-17 And 11-62-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The "protecting Freedom Of Conscience From Government Discrimination Act" And Which Define Certain Protected Beliefs And Governmental Discriminatory Action; And For Related Purposes.

2732.title: Protection against discrimination; expand for housing and state employment.
2732.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-33-723, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand Protections Against Discrimination In Housing; To Amend Section 25-9-149, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand Protections Against Discriminatory Practices In State Employment; And For Related Purposes.

2733.title: Oil and Gas Board funding; restore special fund for expenses.
2733.description: An Act To Amend Sections 53-1-7, 53-1-73, 53-1-77, 53-3-13 And 53-11-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provisions Of Law Requiring Certain Expenses Of The Mississippi State Oil And Gas Board To Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund; To Amend Section 27-104-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That The State Oil And Gas Board Be Funded By Appropriations From The General Fund; To Further Amend Section 53-1-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Retain The Authority Of The Board To Obtain Funds From The Capital Expense Fund For The Emergency Plugging Of Orphaned Wells; To Transfer From The State General Fund A Certain Amount Of Funds To The Special Funds Of The State Oil And Gas Board; And For Related Purposes.

2734.title: Mississippi Entertainment Investment Act; create.
2734.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Entertainment Industry Investment Act; To Provide An Incentive For Sound Recording Production Companies That Produce Sound Recording Projects In This State; To Provide That A Sound Recording Production Company Shall Be Eligible For A Rebate Of A Percentage Of Certain Expenditures Made In Connection With A State-certified Sound Recording Production Project; To Provide An Incentive For Companies That Produce Musical And Theatrical Projects In This State; To Provide That A Company Shall Be Eligible For A Rebate Of A Percentage Of Expenditures Made In Connection With A State-certified Musical Or Theatrical Production Project; To Provide That The Rebate Programs Created In This Act Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Define Certain Terms For The Purposes Of The Rebate Programs Created In This Act; To Amend Section 57-89-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Approve Applications For A Rebate Under The Mississippi Motion Picture Incentive Act; And For Related Purposes.

2735.title: Pat Harrison Waterway District; allow counties of former Pearl River Basin Development District to join.
2735.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-15-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Counties Of The Former Pearl River Basin Development District To Join The Pat Harrison Waterway District; To Establish A Procedure For Calling For Petition Elections On The Question Of Joining The District; To Amend Section 51-15-118, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Withdrawals From The Pat Harrison Waterway District Be Effective At The Close Of The Fiscal Year In Which The Withdrawing County Meets All Of Its Obligations Under Law; And For Related Purposes.

2736.title: MS Bureau of Narcotics; authorize to dispose of nonforfeited property when unclaimed.
2736.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-179, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Bureau Of Narcotics To Dispose Of Unclaimed Nonforfeited Property In The Same Manner As Surplus Property; And For Related Purposes.

2739.title: Mississippi Medicaid program; revise services, provider reimbursement rates and extend repealer.
2739.description: An Act Relating To The Mississippi Medicaid Program; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Comprehensive List Of The Types Of Care And Services Covered By Medicaid; To Provide That Rural Hospitals That Have Fifty Or Fewer Licensed Beds Shall Be Given The Option To Be Reimbursed Under Medicaid For Outpatient Hospital Services Based On 101% Of The Medicare Rate For Those Services Instead Of Using The Ambulatory Payment Classification (apc) Methodology; To Reduce The Annual Number Of Home Leave Days For Patients In Nursing Facilities And Intermediate Care Facilities; To Delete The Annual Limit On Physician Visits; To Authorize The Division To Reimburse Obstetricians And Gynecologists For Certain Primary Care Services As Defined By The Division At 100% Of The Rate Established Under Medicare; To Delete The Annual Limits On Home Health Services Visits; To Delete The Restriction On The Reimbursement Rate For Emergency Medical Transportation Services; To Delete The Monthly Prescription Limit For Medicaid Beneficiaries; To Direct The Division To Allow Physician?administered Drugs To Be Billed And Reimbursed As Either A Medical Claim Or Pharmacy Point-of-sale To Allow Greater Access To Care; To Authorize The Division To Encourage The Use Of Certain Preterm Birth Services (17p); To Provide That The Coverage Of Dental And Orthodontic Services Will Be Determined By The Division; To Provide That Certain Services Provided By A Psychiatrist May Be Reimbursed At Up To 100% Of The Medicare Rate; To Revise Certain Provisions Of The Medicare Upper Payment Limits (upl) Program And The Mississippi Hospital Access Program (mhap); To Provide That Federally Qualified Health Centers Providing Ambulatory Services Shall Be Reimbursed By The Medicaid Prospective Payment System As Approved By The Centers For Medicare And Medicaid Services; To Authorize Instead Of Require That Targeted Case Management Services For High-cost Beneficiaries Be Developed For All Services Covered By This Section; To Authorize Medicaid Reimbursement For Treatment For Opioid Dependency And Other Highly Addictive Substance Use Disorders; To Direct The Division To Allow Beneficiaries Between The Ages Of Ten And Eighteen Years To Receive Vaccines Through A Pharmacy Venue; To Include Outpatient Hospital Services In The List Of Services That Are Exempt From The Five Percent Reduction In The Provider Reimbursement Rate; To Direct The Medical Care Advisory Committee To Develop Recommendations To The Legislature Relating To The Authority Of The Division To Reduce The Rate Of Provider Reimbursement By Five Percent; To Delete The Prohibition On The Division From Making Certain Changes To The Services Authorized Under This Section Without An Amendment To This Section By The Legislature; To Revise The Actions That The Division May Take To Reduce Costs If Current Or Projected Expenditures Of The Division Are Reasonably Anticipated By The Division To Exceed The Amount Of Funds Appropriated To The Division For Any Fiscal Year; To Prohibit The Division From Implementing The Expansion Of Medicaid Managed Care Contracts Without Enabling Legislation; To Establish A Commission On Expanding Medicaid Managed Care To Develop Recommendations To The Governor And The Legislature; To Provide That The Division And The Contractors Participating In The Managed Care Program, A Coordinated Care Program Or A Provider-sponsored Health Plan Shall Be Subject To Annual Program Audits Performed By The Office Of The State Auditor, The Peer Committee And/or An Independent Third Party; To Prohibit Managed Care Organizations From Requiring Their Providers To Be Credentialed By The Organization In Order To Receive Reimbursement; To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By Senate Bill No. 2912, 2018 Regular Session, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Section That Provides For Certain Provider Assessments Under The Mississippi Medicaid Program; To Revise Certain Provisions Relating To The Calculation Of The Assessments; And For Related Purposes.

2740.title: Administration of the Mississippi Medicaid program; revise services, rates and managed-care conditions and extend repealer.
2740.description: An Act Relating To The Administration Of The Mississippi Medicaid Program; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Certain Rural Hospitals To Be Reimbursed For Outpatient Services On An Alternative Reimbursement Methodology, To Delete The Annual Limitation On The Medicaid Reimbursement For Physician Visits, To Authorize Certain Physicians To Be Reimbursed At A Rate Not Less Than 100% Of The Medicare Rate And Medicaid Managed Care Plans To Reimburse For The Same Services In The Same Manner, To Provide That Services Provided By A Psychiatrist To Be Reimbursed At 100% Of The Medicare Rate, To Authorize Medicaid Reimbursement For Treatment For Substance Abuse Disorders Including Tobacco Cessation And Alcohol And Chemical Dependency And Opioid Addiction Under Certain Conditions, To Authorize Physician-administered Drugs To Be Reimbursed As A Medical Claim Or Pharmacy Point-of-sale Claim, To Authorize Beneficiaries Between The Ages Of 10 And 18 To Be Reimbursed For Vaccines Through A Pharmacy Venue, To Authorize The Division To Reimburse For The Drug 17p Or 17 Ohp As Medically Ordered By A Treating Physician, To Prohibit The Division From Reducing The Rate Of Reimbursement For Outpatient Hospital Services, To Allow Managed Care Organizations To Negotiate Provider Rates Which Are Less Than The Medicaid Rate, To Require The Division And Managed Care Organizations To Participate In Annual Independent Program Audits To Measure Specific Performance And Financial Criteria, To Authorize And Direct The Division To Establish A Pilot Program To Evaluate A Provider-sponsored Health Plan, To Require All Medicaid Managed Care Organizations To Implement A Standardized Credentialing Process, To Require All Medicaid Managed Care Organizations To Implement A Uniform Process For Prior Authorization For Medical Necessity, And To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Section Authorizing Medicaid Reimbursement For Care And Services; To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Section Which Provides For Certain Provider Assessments Under The Mississippi Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2741.title: Public Service Commission; increase membership of and establish authority over Public Utilities Staff.
2741.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Membership Of The Public Service Commission Beginning On January 1, 2020; To Amend Section 77-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Number Of Members Necessary For A Quorum Of The Commission; To Amend Section 77-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Utilities Staff Shall Be Under The Supervision Of The Public Service Commission; To Amend Section 77-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Utilities Staff Shall Conduct Investigations And Perform Certain Other Functions As Directed By The Commission; To Amend Section 77-2-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Executive Director Of The Staff Shall Be Appointed By The Commission And Shall Serve At The Will And Pleasure Of The Commission; To Amend Section 77-2-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Tin Order For Certain Duties To Be Carried Out By The Executive Director, The Commission Must Provide Its Advice And Consent; And For Related Purposes.

2742.title: Opioid and other controlled substances epidemic; provide enhanced penalties.
2742.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Enhanced Penalties For Transfer Or Possession With Intent To Transfer Heroin Or Fentanyl; To Create New Section 97-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Overdose Death Attributable To The Unlawful Distribution Of Certain Controlled Substances Will Constitute Manslaughter; And For Related Purposes.

2745.title: MS Medicaid Program; establish provider-sponsored health plan pilot program.
2745.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Provider-sponsored Health Plan Pilot Program Within The Division Of Medicaid; And For Related Purposes.

2746.title: Medicaid; reimbursement for inpatient services for inmates under certain circumstances and conditions.
2746.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Medicaid Reimbursement For Inpatient Services For Inmates Under Certain Circumstances And Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2748.title: Lottery; authorize and provide that net proceeds go to highways.
2748.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Provide That The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited Into The State Highway Fund; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

2749.title: "Mississippi Transportation Investment Act of 2018"; authorize certain taxes for highways pursuant to referendum.
2749.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Transportation Investment Act Of 2018"; To Provide That Each Of The Three Mississippi Transportation Districts Shall Be A Special Transportation Improvement District For The Purpose Of Authorizing Certain Taxes To Be Imposed On A Local Option Basis To Be Used To Fund Highway Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Within The Districts; To Provide For The Creation Of The Districts; To Provide For A Northern District Transportation Planning Council, A Central District Transportation Planning Council And A Southern District Transportation Planning Council To Develop Priorities For State Highway Repair, Renovation And Maintenance In Each Of The Three Districts To Be Published By The Mississippi Transportation Commission; To Provide For A Referendum By The Electors Residing Within Each Special Transportation District; To Authorize And Provide For A Special District Transportation Motor Fuel Excise Tax, Motor Fuels Tax Registration Fee For Electric-drive, Hybrid-drive And Hydrogen-drive Motor Vehicles And A New Tire Fee To Be Imposed In Any Special Transportation District Which Approves The Referendum; To Provide For The Deposit Of The Proceeds Of Such Taxes Into The Transportation District Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund To Be Used Exclusively For Approved Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Projects Within The District; Applicable Only In Transportation Districts Which Have Approved The Imposition Pursuant To Referendum, To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax And To Amend Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax Imposed On Diesel Fuel; To Require The Revenue Collected From Such Tax To Be Deposited Into The Transportation District Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; Applicable Only In Transportation Districts Which Have Approved The Imposition Pursuant To Referendum, To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Distribution Of Gasoline And Undyed Diesel Fuel Tax Revenue To Provide That 10% Of The Increase In Gasoline And Undyed Diesel Fuel Tax Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into The "county Road Assistance Program Fund" And To Provide That A Certain Sum Shall Be Deposited Into The "mississippi Highway-railroad Grade Crossing Safety Account"; Applicable Only In Transportation Districts Which Have Approved The Imposition Pursuant To Referendum, To Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Assess A Motor Fuels Tax Registration Fee For Electric-drive Motor Vehicles, Hybrid-drive Motor Vehicles And Hydrogen-drive Motor Vehicles, To Provide The Fee Amounts, To Clarify The Circumstances And Manner In Which The Fees Shall Be Paid, To Make The Fees A Prerequisite To Licensing And Registration, To Apportion The Fee Revenue, And To Define Terms; To Amend Section 27-19-99, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Distribution Of The Proceeds Of The Fees To The Transportation District Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Provide For The Imposition Of New Tire Fees For Such Purposes; To Establish The Transportation District Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund In The State Treasury; To Create The County Road Assistance Program To Be Administered By The State Aid Engineer; To Provide Certain Powers And Duties To The State Aid Engineer In Administering The County Road Assistance Program; To Amend Section 57-43-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Mississippi Highway-railroad Grade Crossing Safety Account Program To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2750.title: Lottery; create and use proceeds to supplement the MS Adequate Education program & fund highway construction and maintenance.
2750.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Provide That The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2752.title: Lottery; authorize and provide that net proceeds go to highways and MAEP.
2752.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Provide That 50% Of The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited Into The State Highway Fund And The Remainder Shall Be Used To Provide Additional Funding For The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

2753.title: Dogfighting; revise offense.
2753.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Dogfighting And To Clarify The Definition Of Dogfighting Paraphernalia; And For Related Purposes.

2755.title: Vision-screening for first-time students; Mississippi Vision Foundation issue standards.
2755.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Recommend A Comprehensive Eye Examination For All Students Prior To Entering Or Enrolling For The First Time In A Public, Private Or Parochial School; To Provide Standards For Required Eye Examinations For This Act; To Direct The State Department Of Education With Input From The Mississippi Vision Foundation To Develop And Issue Regulations Establishing The Process Of Program; And For Related Purposes.

2756.title: Phantom damages; restrict admissibility of evidence of.
2756.description: An Act To Define The Admissibility Of Medical Or Health Care Expenses During Trial; To Bring Forward Section 41-9-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Evidence Of Reasonableness Of Medical Expenses; And For Related Purposes.

2757.title: MS Fair Commission; authorize DFA to purchase certain properties for the use and benefit of.
2757.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Purchase Certain Real Property Located Within The Vicinity Of The Capitol Complex In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, For The Use And Benefit Of The Mississippi Fair Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2758.title: State, county and municipal budget estimates shall not be exceeded; exempt unfunded liability for employee retirement.
2758.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-11-17, 21-35-17 And 27-104-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Unfunded Liability For Employee Retirement Funds From The Requirement That County, Municipal And State Budget Estimates Shall Not Be Exceeded; And For Related Purposes.

2760.title: Employment Protection Act; enact.
2760.description: An Act To Provide That The Regulation Of The Employment Relationship Between A Nonpublic Employer And Its Employees Is A Matter Of State Concern And Outside The Express Or Implied Authority Of Local Governmental Bodies To Regulate, Absent Express Delegation Of That Authority To The Local Governmental Body; To Bring Forward Section 17-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That No County, Board Of Supervisors Of A County, Municipality Or Governing Authority Of A Municipality May Establish A Mandatory, Minimum Living Wage Rate And Minimum Number Of Vacation Or Sick Days, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2761.title: Oil and gas severance tax; extend repealer on reduced tax on production from horizontally drilled wells.
2761.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-25-503 And 27-25-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Until July 1, 2023, The Repeal Date On The Reduced Severance Tax On Oil And Natural Gas Produced From Horizontally Drilled Wells Or Horizontally Drilled Recompletion Wells From Which Production Commences From And After July 1, 2018; And For Related Purposes.

2763.title: Bail; clarify increase or reduction of.
2763.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Jurisdiction Of Either The Circuit Court Or A Lower Court Before Which A Detainee Made A Preliminary Appearance To Reduce Or Increase Bail; And For Related Purposes.

2764.title: Indefinite detention of citizens in the United States; prohibit MS National Guard from assisting federal agent.
2764.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Agency Of This State, Any Political Subdivision Of This State, Any Employee Of Any Agency Of This State Or Any Political Subdivision Of This State, Or Any Member Of The Mississippi National Guard From Assisting An Agency Of The Armed Forces Of The United States In The Investigation, Prosecution Or "indefinite" Detainment Of Any Citizen Of The United States Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2765.title: Public funds; prohibit investment in countries sponsoring terrorism.
2765.description: An Act To Require That No Public Funds Shall Be Invested In Any Financial Investment That Has Relationships With Terrorist-sponsoring Nations; And For Related Purposes.

2767.title: State aid roads; increase amount of motor fuel taxes allocated to include municipal roads in allocation formula.
2767.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Proceeds Of The Gasoline, Diesel Fuel Or Kerosene Taxes That Is Allocated To The State Aid Road Fund; To Provide That State Aid Road Funds Shall Be Allocated To Each County Based On The Proportion That The Total Number Of Rural And Urban Road Miles In A County Bears To The Total Number Of Rural And Urban Road Miles In All Counties Of The State; To Amend Section 65-9-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Aid Funds Shall Be Allocated By Boards Of Supervisors To Projects In Municipalities Within The County Based On The Proportion That The Total Number Of Road Miles In The Municipalities In The County Bears To The Total Number Of Road Miles In The County; To Amend Sections 65-9-3 And 65-9-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2768.title: Grand larceny; theft of prescription drugs or firearms.
2768.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Theft Of Controlled Substances, Legend Drugs Or Firearms Will Constitute Grand Larceny Without Regard To The Value Of The Things Stolen; To Amend Section 97-17-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Corrections To The Offense Of Larceny Of A Motor Vehicle; To Amend Section 97-17-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2769.title: Conviction; clarify subsequent for certain crimes and post-convictions relief.
2769.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Meaning Of Second Or Subsequent Offense For Certain Drug Convictions; To Amend Sections 99-39-5 And 99-39-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Dismissal Or Denial Of Post-conviction Relief Shall Not Be A Bar To A Second Or Successive Application Or Motion For Relief When There Has Been An Adoption Or Enactment Of State Law That Would Have Actually Adversely Affected The Outcome Of The Conviction Or Sentence; And For Related Purposes.

2772.title: Practice of medicine and dentistry; authorize reinstatement after rehabilitation.
2772.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Medical Licensure To Reinstate A Licensee To The Practice Of Medicine Following A Suspension, And To Authorize The State Board Of Dental Examiners To Reinstate A Licensee To The Practice Of Dentistry Following A Suspension; And For Related Purposes.

2773.title: Bonds; authorize the Dept. of Audit to be reimbursed certain costs from the proceeds of bond issues. .
2773.description: An Act To Provide That The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By Any Act Of The Legislature Passed After July 1, 2018, May Be Used To Reimburse Reasonable Actual And Necessary Costs Incurred By The Department Of Audit In Providing Services Related To A Project For Which Funding Is Provided From The Use Of Proceeds Of Such Bonds; To Limit The Amount That May Be Reimbursed; And For Related Purposes.

2774.title: Appropriation FY19; renovate Robert G. Clark, Jr., Building.
2774.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Finance And Administration, For The Purpose Renovating And Updating The Robert G. Clark, Jr., Building For Fiscal Year 2019; And For Related Purposes.

2776.title: Medicaid reimbursement for certain home services; impose moratorium on new providers.
2776.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A Moratorium On New Medicaid Enrolled Providers Of Personal Care And Respite Care Services; And For Related Purposes.

2777.title: Cockfighting; offense to conduct, train or attend.
2777.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Cockfighting And The Punishment Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2778.title: Electronic voter registration; authorize.
2778.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Persons Eligible To Vote In This State To Submit Voter Registration Applications Through A Secure Internet Website Established By The Secretary Of State; To Provide That The Secretary Of State Shall Forward The Application And Any Additional Information Received To The Registrar Of The County In Which The Applicant Currently Resides; To Provide Procedures By Which The County Registrar Shall Process Such Applications; And For Related Purposes.

2779.title: Open Meetings Law; revise reasons for executive sessions to include certain discussions by public hospital boards.
2779.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Reasons A Public Body May Hold An Executive Session Under The Open Meetings Act To Include Discussions By The Boards Of Trustees Of Public Hospitals Regarding Certain Prospective Strategic Business Decisions Of Public Hospitals; And For Related Purposes.

2780.title: Early voting; authorize for the two-week period preceding an election.
2780.description: An Act To Authorize A Qualified Elector To Vote Not More Than 14 Days Nor Less Than Two Days Before The Date Of An Election; To Provide That Early Voting May Be Conducted In The Registrar's Office; To Require A Person Who Desires To Vote Early To Appear At The Registrar's Office And To Provide That After Signing The Receipt Book Such Person Shall Be Entitled To Vote At The Registrar's Office In The Same Manner As He Would At His Voting Precinct On The Day Of The Election; To Provide That The Election Laws That Govern Procedures For A Person Who Appears To Vote On The Day Of Election Shall Apply When A Person Appears To Vote During The Early Voting Period; To Provide That All Votes Cast During The Early Voting Period Shall Be Final; To Provide That The Votes Cast During Early Voting Shall Be Announced Simultaneously With The Vote Cast On Election Day; To Provide That Each Candidate Shall Have The Right To Be Present At The Registrar's Office And To Challenge The Qualifications Of Any Person Offering To Vote In The Same Manner As Provided By Law At The Polling Place On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Secretary Of State To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary To Effectuate Early Voting; To Amend Section 23-15-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 23-15-627, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Categories Of Voters Who May Cast An Absentee Ballot; To Amend Section 23-15-637, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Absentee Ballots Must Be Received By The Registrar By A Certain Time On The Day Before The Election; And For Related Purposes.

2781.title: Community hospitals acquire other hospitals and health care facilities outside service area; authorize.
2781.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-13-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Community Hospitals To Acquire Other Hospitals And Health Care Facilities Outside Of Its Service Area If In The Best Interests Of The Residents; And For Related Purposes.

2782.title: Parole; amend eligibility for offenders convicted of felonies with enhanced penalties.
2782.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Offender Convicted Of A Felony With An Enhanced Penalty Shall Not Be Eligible For Parole Unless Such Felony Conviction Is For An Offense Under The Uniform Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2783.title: Technical violation centers; allow MDOC to offer incentives to offenders who participate in programs of.
2783.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-38.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Corrections To Offer Participation Credits To Offenders Who Follow The Rules Of And Participate In The Programs Offered By Technical Violation Centers; To Bring Forward Sections 47-7-27 And 47-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Later Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2784.title: Community Corrections Division; provide staffing at American Probation and Parole Association standards.
2784.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Legislature May Appropriate Funds For The Staffing Of The Community Corrections Division Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections According To Standards Established By The American Probation And Parole Association; And For Related Purposes.

2785.title: Correctional facilities; allow MDOC more flexibility in contracting with private operators of.
2785.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-1211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Method Of Determining Cost Savings For Purposes Of Entering Contracts For Private Correctional Facilities Or Services; To Amend Section 47-5-1213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Term Of Contracts For The Operation Of A Correctional Facility By A Private Entity From Five To 20 Years; To Remove The Option To Renew Such Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

2786.title: Technical violation centers; authorize MDOC to extend the revocation period for up to 180 days.
2786.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-7-38, 47-7-27, 47-7-37 And 47-7-38.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Period Of Imprisonment To Be Served By Persons On Parole Or Probation In A Technical Violation Center Shall Be Based Upon The Number Of Prior Revocations Rather Than The Number Of Technical Violations; To Authorize The Department Of Corrections To Extend The Period Of Imprisonment For An Additional 180 Days Or Transfer The Probationer Or Parolee To General Custody Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2787.title: MDOC; must remove offenders sentenced to TVCs from county jail within 14 days or reimburse county's housing expenses.
2787.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-901, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Department Of Corrections Must Remove Offenders Sentenced To A Technical Violation Center, Restitution Center Or Recidivism Reduction Program Who Are Being Housed In County Jails Within 14 Days Of Receiving The Court Order; To Require The Department Of Corrections To Reimburse Counties A Per-day Housing Cost After The Fourteen-day Period Expires; And For Related Purposes.

2788.title: Birth certificate; adoptee may obtain certified copy of original after 40 years.
2788.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-17-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Adoptee May Obtain A Copy Of The Adoptee's Original Birth Certificate Once 40 Years Has Passed Since The Issuance Of A Revised Birth Certificate Following The Adoption; And For Related Purposes.

2789.title: Security freeze; allow representative or guardian to place on credit report of protected consumer.
2789.description: An Act To Provide That A Parent Or Legal Guardian Of A Minor Younger Than 18 Years Of Age, Or An Individual For Whom A Guardian Or Conservator Has Been Appointed, May Place A Security Freeze On The Consumer Report Of A Protected Consumer; To Provide That If No Consumer Report Exists, The Consumer Reporting Agency Shall Create A Record For The Protected Consumer And Place A Security Freeze On The Record; To Provide For The Removal Of The Security Freeze On The Protected Consumer's Record Or Report; To Authorize A Consumer Reporting Agency To Charge Certain Fees; To Authorize The Attorney General To Investigate Any Complaints Received Concerning Violations Of This Act; To Provide Administrative Penalties And Civil Remedies For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2790.title: Official State Flag; change design to that of the "Stennis Flag."
2790.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Design Of The Official Flag Of The State Of Mississippi To That Of The Flag Known As The "stennis Flag"; And For Related Purposes.

2792.title: Medical facilities; restrict concealed carry unless instructor-certified.
2792.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Restrict Concealed Carry At Medical Facilities Unless An Instructor-certified Permittee; And For Related Purposes.

2794.title: Electronic citation systems; transition all law enforcement agencies to a compatible system.
2794.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Wireless Radio Communications Program To Authorize Expenditure Of Those Funds To Enable A Local Agency's Participation In The E-cite Program For Electronic Submission Of Citations; To Mandate All Law Enforcement Agencies With Authority To Enforce The Provisions Of Section 63-11-30 To Transition To An Electronic Citation System Compatible With The Electronic Citation System Used By The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol; To Require The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety To Create And Maintain A Statewide, Unified Criminal History To Allow Law Enforcement Officers And Prosecutors To Quickly Obtain Up-to-date, Accurate Information As To Certain Prior Offenses; To Create The E-citation Transition And Operation Fund; To Transfer Funds That Are Deposited Into The Interlock Device Fund During Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019 Into The E-citation Transition And Operation Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2795.title: Controlled substances; revise Schedules I and II.
2795.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Furanyl Fentanyl And U-47700 As Schedule I Controlled Substances And To Exclude Cannabidiol From Control Under Schedule I Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Dronabinol Oral Solution And Thiafentanil As Schedule Ii Controlled Substances; And For Related Purposes.

2797.title: Jackson State University; authorize to sell certain tax-forfeited parcels.
2797.description: An Act To Authorize Jackson State University, In Consultation With The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Sell, Transfer And Convey Certain Tax-forfeited Real Property Acquired By The University; And For Related Purposes.

2798.title: University of Mississippi Medical Center; authorize to remove and reinter remains reposing in potter's field property.
2798.description: An Act To Authorize The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Rearrange, Disinter, Remove Or Reinter, Where Applicable, Human Remains Reposing In The Potter's Field On The Property Of The Medical Center To A Different Location On The Medical Center's Property; To Repeal Section 2, Chapter 846, Local And Private Laws Of 1973, As Amended By Chapter 854, Laws Of 1974, Which Authorizes The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Take Certain Actions Regarding Human Remains In The Potter's Field On Its Property; And For Related Purposes.

2799.title: Columbia Training School property; DFA may transfer portion of to the Marion County Board of Supervisors.
2799.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Transfer And Convey Certain Real Property Located At Columbia Training School In Marion County, Mississippi, To The Marion County Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

2800.title: Public purchases; exempt certain purchases by local governing authorities form reverse auction requirement.
2800.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Reverse Auction Requirement Shall Not Apply To Any Purchase By A Governing Authority Upon A Finding And Determination By The Governing Authority, By Resolution Duly And Lawfully Adopted And Spread Upon Its Minutes, That The Reverse Auction Process Is Not The Best Method For Purchasing That Particular Item; And For Related Purposes.

2801.title: Delta State University property; authorize DFA to transfer to Coahoma County Community College.
2801.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of Delta State University And The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Transfer Certain Real Property To The Board Of Trustees Of Coahoma County Community College; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of Coahoma County Community College Will Use The Property For The Operation And Management Of The Coahoma County Higher Education Center; And For Related Purposes.

2802.title: Dental hygienists; provide for general supervision of licensed dental hygienists by licensed dentists under certain conditions.
2802.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-9-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For General Supervision Of Licensed Dental Hygienists By Licensed Dentists Under Certain Conditions; To Provide Definitions; To Clarify That Dental Assistants Shall Continue To Practice Only Under The Direct Supervision Of A Licensed Dentist; And For Related Purposes.

2803.title: Nurse practitioners; required to advertise the name of the collaborating physician.
2803.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-121-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Categories Of Nurse Practitioners To Advertise The Name Of The Collaborating Physician; And For Related Purposes.

2804.title: "Emergency Medical Technician-Advanced"; cannot use title without certification.
2804.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-59-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Title "emergency Medical Technician-advanced" Is Subject To The Prohibition Against Use Of Certain Titles With Certification; And For Related Purposes.

2805.title: Voluntary health services without fee; add professions and provide for continuing education.
2805.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-25-38 And 73-25-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Certain Additional Licensed Health Care Professionals To The Statutory Immunity For Providing Charitable Medical Care Or Voluntary Health Care Services Without A Fee, To Provide For Continuing Education Credit For Health Care Professionals Proving Such Voluntary Care, And To Clarify The Status Of Nonresident Health Care Professionals Providing Such Voluntary Care; And For Related Purposes.

2807.title: Telemedicine services; revise regulatory requirements.
2807.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-25-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provision Which Authorizes Health Care Providers To Offer Telemedicine Services, To Provide Definitions And Conditions On Providers Offering Telemedicine Services And To Authorize The Mississippi Board Of Medical Licensure To Promulgate Rules Relating To Telemedicine With Certain Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2809.title: Elections; authorize preelection day voting and online voter registration.
2809.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Persons Eligible To Vote In This State To Submit Voter Registration Applications Through A Secure Internet Website Established By The Secretary Of State; To Provide That The Secretary Of State Shall Forward The Application And Any Additional Information Received To The Registrar Of The County In Which The Applicant Currently Resides; To Provide Procedures By Which The County Registrar Shall Process Such Applications; To Authorize A Qualified Elector To Vote Not More Than 21 Days Nor Less Than Two Days Before The Date Of An Election; To Provide That Preelection Voting May Be Conducted In The Registrar's Office; To Require A Person Who Desires To Vote Early To Appear At The Registrar's Office And To Provide That After Signing The Receipt Book Such Person Shall Be Entitled To Vote At The Registrar's Office In The Same Manner As He Would At His Voting Precinct On The Day Of The Election; To Provide That The Election Laws That Govern Procedures For A Person Who Appears To Vote On The Day Of Election Shall Apply When A Person Appears To Vote During The Preelection Day Voting Period; To Provide That All Votes Cast During The Preelection Day Voting Period Shall Be Final; To Provide That The Votes Cast During Early Voting Shall Be Announced Simultaneously With The Vote Cast On Election Day; To Provide That Each Candidate Shall Have The Right To Be Present At The Registrar's Office And To Challenge The Qualifications Of Any Person Offering To Preelection Vote In The Same Manner As Provided By Law At The Polling Place On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Secretary Of State To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary To Effectuate Preelection Day Voting; To Amend Section 23-15-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 23-15-627, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Categories Of Voters Who May Cast An Absentee Ballot; To Amend Section 23-15-637, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Absentee Ballots Must Be Received By The Registrar By A Certain Time On The Day Before The Election; And For Related Purposes.

2810.title: Hancock County; authorize to consolidate its rural utility districts for administrative purposes.
2810.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County To Consolidate Rural Utility Districts Created By It For Administrative Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2811.title: County inmate canteen fund; specify types of items that may be purchased from.
2811.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Types Of Items That The County Sheriff May Expend, For The Benefit Of Inmates And Staff Of A County Jail, From The Inmate Canteen Fund; To Remove The Prohibition Against The Sheriff Purchasing Personal Hygiene Items For Inmates With Monies From The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2812.title: Counties; authorize to remove on private property certain Hurricane Katrina-related slabs.
2812.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Boards Of Supervisors To Clean Private Property By Removing Hurricane Katrina-related Slabs Below The Base Flood Elevation In Residentially Zoned Areas; And For Related Purposes.

2813.title: Project Medicaid shortfall; revise reporting requirements.
2813.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Conditions Under Which The Division Of Medicaid Shall Report Projected Shortfalls To The Peer Committee, And To Further Change The Deadline For Peer To Report On Such Shortfalls To The Legislative Budget Office; And For Related Purposes.

2814.title: Employee Appeals Board; revise membership and terms of office of.
2814.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership And Terms Of Office Of The Employee Appeals Board; To Amend Sections 25-9-131 And 25-9-132, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical, Nonsubstantive Changes; And For Related Purposes.

2815.title: Mississippi Medicaid Program; extend repealer on provider assessments.
2815.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Section Which Provides For Certain Provider Assessments Under The Mississippi Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2816.title: Community public water systems; revise the fee charged by Dept. of Health for management training of board members.
2816.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-26-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fee Which May Be Charged By The Department Of Health For The Management Training Of Community Public Water System Board Members; And For Related Purposes.

2817.title: Open Meetings Act; court shall void any action taken in violation of.
2817.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Court Shall Void Any Action Taken In Violation Of The Open Meetings Act Under Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2818.title: Comprehensive Health Insurance Risk Pool; require approval before expending remaining monies after cessation.
2818.description: An Act To Require Approval Of The Commissioner Of Insurance Before The Distribution Of Any Funds Held By The Comprehensive Health Insurance Risk Pool Association Upon The Cessation Of Operations; And For Related Purposes.

2819.title: Commissioner of Insurance; may adopt regulations for coverage of prescription drugs through a drug formulary.
2819.description: An Act To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Adopt Rules And Regulations That Pertain To The Coverage Of Prescription Drugs Through A Drug Formulary; To Provide A Definition Of A Drug Formulary; And For Related Purposes.

2820.title: Public utilities; require approval of sewer district before taking certain actions.
2820.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Public Utilities To Provide Certain Notice And Approval Requirements To Sewer Districts; To Require The Public Utility To Disconnect Water Service Upon Certain Notice By A Sewer District; And For Related Purposes.

2821.title: Agritourism laws; remove repeal date on.
2821.description: An Act To Repeal Section 69-53-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides The Repeal Date For The Provisions Of Law Regulating Agritourism; And For Related Purposes.

2822.title: MS Forestry Commission; extend repeal date on authority to appoint law enforcement officers.
2822.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-19-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Authority Of The State Forester To Appoint Mississippi Forestry Commission Law Enforcement Officers; And For Related Purposes.

2823.title: Wildlife; enact a moratorium on construction and expansion of white-tailed deer enclosures.
2823.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-58.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From And After July 1, 2018, Enclosures Intended To Contain White-tailed Deer And Prevent The Free Egress Of White-tailed Deer From The Enclosed Area Shall Not Be Constructed, Existing Enclosures Shall Not Be Expanded And Any Breeding Facilities At Existing Enclosures Shall Not Be Expanded; And For Related Purposes.

2824.title: White-tailed deer enclosures; require owners to apply to the Department of Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks for a permit.
2824.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-58.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Owners Of Any Enclosure Containing White-tailed Deer That Prevents The Free Egress Of White-tailed Deer From The Enclosed Area Shall Apply To The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For A Permit; And For Related Purposes.

2825.title: Commission on Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks; require establishment of a mandatory harvest reporting program for deer and turkey.
2825.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-26, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Establish A Mandatory Harvest Reporting Program For White-tailed Deer And Turkey To Collect And Compile Harvest Data To Assist In The Formulation Of The Wildlife Resource Conservation Policy For The State; To Require Sportsmen To Report The Harvest Within 72 Hours After The Harvest; To Provide That The Reporting Requirement Shall Not Apply To Deer Harvested On Private Lands That Are Under The Deer Management Assistance Program; To Provide That No Funds Appropriated To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Be Expended On A Tagging Reporting Program; And For Related Purposes.

2826.title: MS Telephone Solicitation Act; provide separate cause of action for violations of.
2826.description: An Act To Amend Sections 77-3-725 And 77-3-727, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Separate Cause Of Action With Injunctive And Monetary Relief For Violations Of The Mississippi Telephone Solicitation Act; And For Related Purposes.

2827.title: MDAC; authorize cooperative agreement with FDA for enforcement of the Produce Safety Rule of the Food Safety Modernization Act.
2827.description: An Act To Create New Section 69-1-56, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Enter Into An Agreement With The Food And Drug Administration (fda) For The Purposes Of Enforcing The Fda Produce Safety Rule Of The Food Safety Modernization Act; And For Related Purposes.

2828.title: Public Service Commission; shall not have jurisdiction to regulate rates of certain water and sewer districts.
2828.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Service Commission Shall Not Have Jurisdiction To Regulate The Rates Of Water And Sewer Districts Organized Under The Provisions Of Chapter 831, Laws Of 1966, Regular Session; And For Related Purposes.

2829.title: Critical Needs Teacher Forgivable Loan Program; applicants may come from any school district in the state with repayment option.
2829.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Continuation Of The Critical Needs Teacher Forgivable Loan Program As A Four-year Repayment Program And To Allow Applicants To Reside Or Be Employed In Any Geographical Area Of The State Under A Seven-year Repayment Program; And For Related Purposes.

2830.title: School board elections; provide that trustees in Picayune School District added territory shall be elected at large.
2830.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The School Board Trustees In The Picayune School District Elected From Single Member Districts Shall Be Elected From The Added Territory At Large Effective With The Completion Of Their Current Term Of Office; And For Related Purposes.

2832.title: Guaranteed asset protection waivers; allow sales of and regulate.
2832.description: An Act To Create New Chapter 52, Title 83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Framework Within Which Guaranteed Asset Protection Waivers Are Defined And May Be Offered Within The State Of Mississippi; To Provide Definitions; To Provide Requirements For Offering Gap Waivers; To Provide Requirements For Contractual Liability And Other Insurance Policies That Insure A Gap Waiver; To Provide Disclosure Requirements; To Provide For Cancellation; To Provide Certain Exemptions; To Provide Enforcement Of The Chapter; And For Related Purposes.

2834.title: Wetlands Act; all permits issued to governmental entities under may be valid for not more than 10 years.
2834.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-27-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Permits Issued To A Governmental Entity By The Commission On Marine Resources Under The Coastal Wetlands Protection Act May Be Valid For Not More Than 10 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2835.title: Commission on Marine Resources; establish a shell recovery and replenishment program.
2835.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commission On Marine Resources To Establish A Shell Recovery And Replenishment Program For The Purpose Of Management, Improvement, Enhancing And Replenishing Of Oysters In This State, Including, But Not Limited To, Replenishing Shells; To Provide That The Commission Shall Have The Authority To Establish Rules And Regulations And Per Sack Assessments To Establish And Fund The Program; To Amend Section 49-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Special Account In The Seafood Fund To Be Known As The "shell Recovery And Replenishment Account" And To Require The Assessments Authorized By This Act To Be Deposited Into The Account; To Amend Section 49-15-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Penalties For Violations Of The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2836.title: Mississippi Civil Rights Act; enact.
2836.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Civil Rights Act; To Provide That The Right Of A Person To Be Free From Discrimination Because Of Race, Color, Religion, National Origin, Immigrant Status, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Disability, Or Familial Status Is A Civil Right; To Provide Remedies For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2837.title: Dog fighting; revise offense of and penalty for.
2837.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of And Punishment For Dog Fighting And To Clarify The Definition Of Dog Fighting Paraphernalia; And For Related Purposes.

2838.title: Weapons; immunity for property owners who do not prohibit.
2838.description: An Act To Create New Section 95-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Immunity For A Property Owner Or Manager Who Does Not Prohibit The Carrying Of A Weapon; To Provide Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2839.title: Livestock facilities; remove date of repeal on provision of law allowing certain groups to use at no charge.
2839.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-5-114, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Date Of Repeal From The Provision Of Law That Authorizes Certain Groups To Use Certain Livestock Facilities At No Charge; And For Related Purposes.

2840.title: Commission on Wildlife, Fisheries & Parks; may not prohibit trotlines or juglines in Pelahatchie Bay.
2840.description: An Act To Provide That The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Not Prohibit The Use Of Trotlines Or Juglines To Take Fish In The Pelahatchie Bay Area Of The Ross Barnett Reservoir; And For Related Purposes.

2841.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of state general obligation bonds for the Meridian Children's Museum.
2841.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Children's Museum In Meridian, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2842.title: Tunica County; contribution of funds to the Tunica County Economic Development Foundation, Inc.
