2842.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 928, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 934, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Chapter 919, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Tunica County Economic Development Foundation, Inc., Through Calendar Year 2018; And For Related Purposes.

2843.title: City of Waveland; authorize use of low-speed vehicles or golf carts on certain city streets.
2843.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Waveland, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City Of Waveland; To Require Individuals Operating A Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; To Require Certain Registration Of Such Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart; And For Related Purposes.

2844.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to assist Lowndes County in completing a horse park.
2844.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Lowndes County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Completion Of A Horse Park; And For Related Purposes.

2847.title: Appropriation; IHL - General support.
2847.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities For Fiscal Year 2019.

2848.title: Appropriation; IHL - Subsidiary programs.
2848.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities' Designated Institutes, Laboratories And Programs For Which They Are Responsible And The Executive Office Of The Board Of Trustees For Fiscal Year 2019; And For Related Purposes.

2849.title: Appropriation; IHL - Student Financial Aid.
2849.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Support And Maintenance Of Financial Aid Scholarship, Loan And Grant Programs And The Mississippi Office Of Student Financial Aid, For Fiscal Year 2019.

2850.title: Appropriation; IHL - University of Mississippi Medical Center.
2850.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center For Fiscal Year 2019.

2851.title: Appropriation; IHL - Alcorn State - Agricultural programs.
2851.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Alcorn State University Agricultural Programs For Fiscal Year 2019.

2852.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Agricultural and Forestry Experiment Station.
2852.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Agricultural And Forestry Experiment Station For Fiscal Year 2019.

2853.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Cooperative Extension Service.
2853.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service For Fiscal Year 2019.

2854.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Forest and Wildlife Research Center.
2854.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Incurred In The Maintenance And Operation Of The Forest And Wildlife Research Center For Fiscal Year 2019.

2855.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Veterinary Medicine, College of.
2855.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The College Of Veterinary Medicine At Mississippi State University For Fiscal Year 2019.

2856.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Administrative expenses.
2856.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Administrative Expenses Of The Mississippi Community College Board For Fiscal Year 2019.

2857.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Support for community and junior colleges.
2857.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Aid And Support Of The Public Community And Junior Colleges Of The State Of Mississippi For Fiscal Year 2019.

2858.title: Appropriation; Corrections, Department of.
2858.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections For Fiscal Year 2019.

2859.title: Appropriation; Emergency Management Agency.
2859.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency, And For The Purpose Of Establishing A Disaster Relief Reserve Fund And Defraying The Costs Related To Certain Disaster Assistance Programs For Fiscal Year 2019.

2860.title: Appropriation; Military Department.
2860.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi National Guard For Fiscal Year 2019.

2861.title: Appropriation; Public Safety, Department of.
2861.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Public Safety For Fiscal Year 2019.

2862.title: Appropriation; Veterans Affairs Board.
2862.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Veterans Affairs Board For Fiscal Year 2019.

2863.title: Appropriation; Judicial Performance Commission.
2863.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission On Judicial Performance Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2019.

2864.title: Appropriation; Ethics Commission.
2864.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Ethics Commission For The Fiscal Year 2019.

2865.title: Appropriation; Employment Security, Department of.
2865.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security For Fiscal Year 2019.

2866.title: Appropriation; Revenue, Department of.
2866.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Revenue, Including The Homestead Exemption Division, The Motor Vehicle Comptroller Functions, The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division, And The Bureau Of Telecommunications, For The Purpose Of Reimbursing The Counties, County Districts And Municipal Separate School Districts For Tax Losses Incurred By Reason Of The Exemption Of Homes From Certain Ad Valorem Taxes, And For The Purpose Of Purchasing Motor Vehicle License Tags For Fiscal Year 2019.

2867.title: Appropriation; Tax Appeals Board.
2867.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Board Of Tax Appeals For The Fiscal Year 2019.

2868.title: Appropriation; Workers' Compensation Commission.
2868.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Workers' Compensation Commission For Fiscal Year 2019.

2869.title: Appropriation; Mental Health, Department of.
2869.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Mental Health For Fiscal Year 2019.

2870.title: Appropriation; Tennessee-Tombigbee Waterway Development Authority.
2870.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Tennessee-tombigbee Waterway Development Authority For The Purposes Enumerated In Section 51-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Fiscal Year 2019.

2871.title: Appropriation; Transportation, Department of - State Aid Road Construction, Office of.
2871.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Office Of State Aid Road Construction Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Fiscal Year 2019.

2872.title: Appropriation; Chiropractic Examiners, Board of.
2872.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners For Fiscal Year 2019.

2873.title: Appropriation; Dental Examiners, Board of.
2873.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To The Mississippi State Board Of Dental Examiners For Fiscal Year 2019.

2874.title: Appropriation; Funeral Services Board.
2874.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Funeral Services For Fiscal Year 2019.

2875.title: Appropriation; Massage Therapy, Board of.
2875.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Massage Therapy, For Fiscal Year 2019.

2876.title: Appropriation; Pharmacy, Board of.
2876.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Pharmacy For Fiscal Year 2019.

2877.title: Appropriation; Counselors, Board of Examiners for Licensed Professional.
2877.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Examiners For Licensed Professional Counselors For Fiscal Year 2019.

2878.title: Appropriation; Veterinary Examiners, Board of.
2878.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Veterinary Examiners For Fiscal Year 2019.

2879.title: Appropriation; Gaming Commission.
2879.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission For Fiscal Year 2019.

2880.title: Appropriation; Architecture, Board of.
2880.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Architecture And Landscape Architecture Advisory Committee For Fiscal Year 2019.

2881.title: Appropriation; Geologists, Board of Registered Professional.
2881.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Board Of Registered Professional Geologists For Fiscal Year 2019.

2882.title: Appropriation; Motor Vehicle Commission.
2882.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Commission For Fiscal Year 2019.

2883.title: Appropriation; Accountancy, Board of Public.
2883.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Accountancy For Fiscal Year 2019.

2884.title: Appropriation; Contractors, Board of.
2884.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Contractors For Fiscal Year 2019.

2885.title: Appropriation; Agriculture and Commerce, Department of.
2885.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Agriculture And Commerce, For The Fiscal Year 2019.

2886.title: Appropriation; Egg Marketing Board.
2886.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board, For Fiscal Year 2019.

2887.title: Appropriation; Animal Health, Board of.
2887.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Board For Fiscal Year 2019.

2888.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission.
2888.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Fair Commission, The Mississippi Livestock Coliseum, And The Industrial Showcase And Trade Mart Building For Fiscal Year 2019.

2889.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission - Livestock shows.
2889.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Fair Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Dixie National Livestock Show; A Roundup For Junior Exhibitors Of Livestock And Goats; Supplemental Funds For Livestock Premiums; County Livestock Shows In Offering And Paying Prizes Or Awards To Competitors In Approved County Livestock Shows; The Five District Livestock Shows; The Five State Dairy Shows; The Mississippi High School Rodeo; And To Provide How Said Money Shall Be Paid Out Of The State Treasury For Fiscal Year 2019.

2890.title: Appropriation; Banking and Consumer Finance, Department of.
2890.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Support Of The State Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance For Fiscal Year 2019.

2891.title: Appropriation; Finance and Administration, Department of.
2891.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Year 2019.

2892.title: Appropriation; Governor's Office and Mansion.
2892.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For Expenses Of The Executive Department, Being The Governor's Office And Staff, And For Expenses Incidental To The Proper Operation Of The Governor's Mansion And Residence Of The Governor For Fiscal Year 2019.

2893.title: Appropriation; Audit, Department of.
2893.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Audit For Fiscal Year 2019.

2894.title: Appropriation; Information Technology Services, Department of.
2894.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services For Fiscal Year 2019.

2895.title: Appropriation; Personnel Board.
2895.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Personnel Board For Fiscal Year 2019.

2896.title: Appropriation; Secretary of State.
2896.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2019.

2897.title: Appropriation; Treasurer's Office.
2897.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Treasurer's Office For Fiscal Year 2019.

2898.title: Appropriation; Debt Service-Gen. Obli.
2898.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2019, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2019.

2899.title: Appropriation; Development Authority, Mississippi.
2899.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Development Authority For Fiscal Year 2019.

2901.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of rotary-wing aircraft if exported from this state within 48 hours.
2901.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Gross Proceeds From The Sale Of Rotary-wing Aircraft From Sales Taxation If They Are Exported From This State Within 48 Hours And Are Registered And First Used In Another State; And For Related Purposes.

2905.title: Bonds and grants; authorize to assist the Rankin-Hinds Pearl River Flood and Drainage Control District flood control project.
2905.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $50,000,000.00 To Assist The Rankin-hinds Pearl River Flood And Drainage Control District In The Construction Of A Flood Control Project On The Pearl River In Hinds And Rankin Counties; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Use Not More Than $45,000,000.00 Out Of The Unobligated Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act As Grants To Urban Flood Control Districts For The Purpose Of Aiding In The Construction Of A Flood Control Project That Enhances The Economy Of The District Area; To Amend Section 57-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2906.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to assist the City of Jackson in funding improvements to Smith Park.
2906.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Funding Improvements To Smith Park; And For Related Purposes.

2907.title: Ad valorem tax exemption; expand certain ad valorem tax exemptions that municipalities are authorized to grant.
2907.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-21-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce To 20,000 The Minimum Population According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census That A Municipality Must Have To Grant An Ad Valorem Tax Exemption For Privately Owned New Structures And Any New Renovations Of And Improvements To Existing Structures Lying Within A Designated Business Improvement District, Urban Renewal District Or Redevelopment District, As Determined By The Municipality; To Amend Section 27-31-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Municipality To Grant Ad Valorem Tax Exemptions For New Structures Or Improvements To Or Renovations Of Existing Structures Located In Residential Renewal Districts, As Designated By The Municipality; To Amend Section 27-31-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Municipality To Grant Ad Valorem Tax Exemptions For Improvements To Or Renovations Of Existing Residential Structures Or Existing Structures Converted For Residential Use That Are Located In Residential Renovation Districts, As Designated By The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2908.title: Appropriation FY2019; State Board of Education for State Department of Education Early Learning Collaboratives.
2908.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Board Of Education For Early Learning Collaboratives; And For Related Purposes.

2910.title: Sales taxation; exempt retail sales of school supplies during the last weekend in July.
2910.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Retail Sales Of Certain School Supplies During A Period Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The Last Friday In July And Ending At 12:00 Midnight The Following Saturday; And For Related Purposes.

2911.title: Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; increase the amount of investment tax credits that may be allocated under.
2911.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-115-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $50,000,000.00 The Aggregate Amount Of Investment Tax Credits That May Be Allocated To Participating Investors Of Mississippi Small Business Investment Companies Under The Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; To Provide The Taxable Years In Which A Participating Investor May Claim The Additional Credits So Allocated Against His Premium Tax Liability; And For Related Purposes.

2913.title: Income tax; exclude from gross income certain payments made by agricultural disaster programs to agricultural producers.
2913.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income Under The State Income Tax Law Amounts Paid By An Agricultural Disaster Program As Compensation To An Agricultural Producer, Cattle Farmer Or Cattle Rancher Who Has Suffered A Loss As The Result Of A Disaster Or Emergency; And For Related Purposes.

2914.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to repair and renovate the Northside High School building in West Point.
2914.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Furnishing, Equipping, Repairing And Renovating The Northside High School Building, In West Point, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2916.title: Town of North Carrollton; authorize a tax on restaurant to provide funds for various purposes.
2916.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of North Carrollton, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2917.title: Leflore County; authorize sheriff to use radar on county roads.
2917.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Leflore County To Purchase Radar Speed Detection Equipment For Use By The Sheriff's Department Of The County In The Enforcement Of Speed Limits On The Roads, Streets And Highways Of The County Outside The Corporate Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2918.title: City of Biloxi; authorize to make certain improvements to the Point Cadet Property and the city to issue revenue bonds for that purpose.
2918.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Biloxi, Mississippi, To Make Improvements To The Point Cadet Property That Is Jointly Owned By The City And The State For The Purposes Of Establishing A Mississippi Oyster Aquaculture And Conservation Center With Public Off-loading Dock For Oystermen And Oyster Aquaculture Farmers, A Mississippi Seafood Marketplace, A Mississippi Deep Sea Fishing Tournament And Conservation Center, And Related Facilities And Uses, And To Issue Municipal Revenue Bonds To Construct These Facilities And To Authorize Certain State And Institutions Of Higher Learning (ihl) Rents From The Point Cadet Leasing Fund To Be Disbursed To The Point Cadet Waterfront Enterprise Fund For Financing The Facilities Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2919.title: Economic Development; provide state assistance and tax incentives for construction of a major theme park.
2919.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Development Authority To Provide Loans To An Enterprise Operating A Major Theme Park That Will Include Certain Amenities With An Initial Capital Investment In Land, Buildings And Equipment Of Not Less Than $31,000,000.00 And Which Will Create Not Less Than 700 New Full-time Jobs; To Authorize A Job Tax Credit For Income Taxes For The Enterprise Operating Such A Theme Park For Each Net New Full-time Employee Job For A Period Of Ten Years Provided At Least 700 Net New Full-time Jobs Are Created; To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Authorities To Grant Exemptions From Ad Valorem Taxation On Tangible Property Used In, Or Necessary To, The Operation Of Such A Major Theme Park; To Provide That The Time Of Such Exemption Shall Be For A Period Not To Exceed A Total Of Five Years; To Amend Sections 57-75-5; 57-75-11 And 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "project" Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act To Include Such A Major Theme Park; To Authorize The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Authority To Make Grants For Certain Purposes To An Enterprise Operating Such A Theme Park; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Such Grants; To Amend Sections 57-28-1, 57-28-3 And 57-28-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Such Theme Parks Eligible For A Sales Tax Rebate Of A Certain Amount For Approved Project Costs Incurred By The Enterprise Operating Such A Theme Park And To Increase To 50% The Amount Of Approved Project Costs That May Be Recovered; And For Related Purposes.

2921.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize contributions to the Vicksburg-Warren Veteran Transition Center.
2921.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Vicksburg-warren Veteran Transition Center; And For Related Purposes.

2922.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize contributions to We Care Communities, Inc.
2922.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute To We Care Communities, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2923.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize contributions to the Heritage Guild of Vicksburg and Warren County.
2923.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Heritage Guild Of Vicksburg And Warren County; And For Related Purposes.

2924.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize contributions to the Kings and Cedars Head Start Centers.
2924.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Kings Head Start Center And The Cedars Head Start Center Located In The City Of Vicksburg; And For Related Purposes.

2925.title: Town of Byhalia; authorize expansion of its gas system to a certain area outside the town limits.
2925.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Byhalia To Expand Its Gas System Within A Certain Area Outside The Corporate Limits; And For Related Purposes.

2926.title: Lee County; authorize annual contributions to Sanctuary Hospice House.
2926.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Sanctuary Hospice House; And For Related Purposes.

2927.title: Grenada County; extend the repeal date on the Grenada Tourism Commission and the Grenada tourist and convention tax.
2927.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 879, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Last Amended By Chapter 935, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From September 30, 2018, To September 30, 2022, On The Provisions Of Law That Establishes The Grenada Tourism Commission And Authorizes The Imposition Of A Tourist And Convention Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2928.title: Corinth and Burnsville; Corinth may sell water to Burnsville and Burnsville may contract to purchase the water.
2928.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Corinth In Alcorn County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Water Distribution System In The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Burnsville In Tishomingo County, Mississippi, That Are More Than Five Miles Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Corinth; To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Burnsville, Mississippi, To Contract With The City Of Corinth For The Purchase Of Water; And For Related Purposes.

2930.title: City of Oxford; governing authorities may authorize the use of golf carts in certain areas of the city.
2930.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Authorize The Operation Of Golf Carts On Public Roads And Streets That Are Within Designated Residential Neighborhoods Of The City Of Oxford; To Prohibit The Use Of Golf Carts On Nonresidential Areas Of The City; To Prohibit The Use Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads, Streets And Highways; To Provide That Any Person Operating A Golf Cart On The Public Roads And Streets Under This Act Must Have In His Or Her Possession A Valid Temporary Driver's License Or A Valid Driver's License And Proof Of Financial Responsibility; And For Related Purposes.

2931.title: Lauderdale County; authorize to fund Chaplaincy Program of the detention facility from revenue of inmate phone services.
2931.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County, Mississippi, To Fund The Lauderdale County Detention Facility's Good News Jail And Prison Ministry Chaplain And Chaplaincy Program From Nontax Revenue Generated By The Inmate Telephone Service; And For Related Purposes.

2934.title: Alcorn State; buildings erected on university land leased to private entities for student housing are exempt from taxation.
2934.description: An Act To Provide That The Lands And Property Of Alcorn State University Shall Not Be Subject To Taxation And To Provide That The Buildings And Improvements That Are Erected On Any Land Belonging To The University That Is Leased To Private Entities For The Purpose Of Affording Affordable Board To Students Shall Not Be Subject To Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

2937.title: City of Carthage; extend the repeal date on the city's hotel, motel and restaurant tax.
2937.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 2016, To Extend Until July 1, 2024, The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Carthage, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For Recreation And Tourism Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2938.title: Appropriation; additional appropriations for various state agencies for FY 2018.
2938.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of General Funds, Capital Expense Funds, And Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Year 2018; The Office Of The Governor-division Of Medicaid For Fiscal Year 2018; The Department Of Child Protection Services For Fiscal Year 2018; The Attorney General's Office For Fiscal Year 2018; Mississippi State University Alcohol Safety Education Program For Fiscal Year 2018; And For Related Purposes.

2939.title: Town of Sumrall; authorize the use of golf carts on the streets of the town.
2939.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Sumrall, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The Town; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

2940.title: Town of Tishomingo; authorize extension of the town's natural gas distribution system.
2940.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of

2941.title: Chuquantonchee Consolidated Drainage District; authorize payment of certain district funds to Chickasaw and Clay Counties.
2941.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Commissioners Of The Chuquantonchee Consolidated Drainage District To Pay Certain District Funds To Chickasaw And Clay Counties; To Require Such Funds To Be Used By The Counties For Certain Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2942.title: Bonds; authorize for improvements to the intersection of Rockabilly Way and Mississippi Highway 348.
2942.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Improvements To The Intersection Of Mississippi Highway 145, Also Known As Rockabilly Way And Mississippi Highway 348 In Lee County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2943.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of bonds for construction of a law enforcement officer training facility in Harrison County.
2943.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Law Enforcement Officer Training Facility In Harrison County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2944.title: Bonds; authorize for construction of the Unknown Child Holocaust Memorial and related facilities.
2944.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Unknown Child Holocaust Memorial And Related Facilities In Horn Lake, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2945.title: Transportation Infrastructure Act of 2018; create.
2945.description: An Act To Create The "transportation Infrastructure Act Of 2018"; To Impose A User Fee Equal To 5% Of The Statewide Average Wholesale Price Of A Gallon Of Motor Fuel Calculated For The Applicable Calendar Year On Each Gallon Of Motor Fuel Sold For Consumption In Vehicles Operated On The Highways Of This State; To Provide That The Amount Of The User Fee Shall Be Added To The Applicable Excise Tax And That The Commissioner Of Revenue Shall Notify Each Distributor Of Motor Fuel Of The Applicable User Fee Per Gallon Which Shall Be The User Fee In Effect For The Twelve-month Period Beginning On The Next January First; To Provide The Manner That The User Fee Shall Be Calculated; To Provide For Certain Exemptions From The User Fee; To Require The Revenue Collected From Such User Fee To Be Deposited Into The Transportation Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Levy An Additional Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Room Rentals By Hotels And Motels To Transient Guests And Provide That The Revenue From Such Fees Be Deposited In The Transportation Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Create The Transportation Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Amend Section 27-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Levy An Additional Privilege Tax On Certain Commercial Vehicles; To Require The Proceeds From Such Tax To Be Deposited Into The Transportation Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Provide For The Allocation Of Money In The Fund To The State Highway Fund, The County And Municipal Road Aid Fund, The City Of Jackson Infrastructure Fund, The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund, The State Aid Road Fund, The Multi-modal Transportation Improvement Fund, The Mississippi Development Authority, The Air Carrier Incentive Program Fund And The Mississippi Highway-railroad Grade Crossing Account; To Create A Special Fund To Be Known As The "county And Municipal Road Aid Fund;" To Provide A Formula For The Distribution Of Money In Such Fund To Counties And Municipalities To Provide That Money Allocated To Counties And Municipalities From Such Fund And The Revenue From The Ad Valorem Tax Authorized To Be Levied By Counties And Municipalities Under This Act Shall Be Utilized By Counties Solely For The Construction, Maintenance And Repair Of Roads And Bridges That Are Not State Aid Roads And Be Utilized By Municipalities Shall Be Utilized By Municipalities Solely For Construction, Maintenance Or Repair Of Streets, Roads And Bridges Maintained By Municipalities; To Provide That In Order To Be Eligible To Receive Funds From The County And Municipal Road Aid Fund A County Or A Municipality Must Annually Levy A Special Ad Valorem Tax, Not To Exceed One Mill, Upon All Taxable Property Located Within The County Or Municipality, As The Case May Be; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority (mda) Shall Establish An Air Carrier Incentive Program To Match Funds Expended By Airport Authorities For Incentives Approved By Mda Intended To Attract Air Carriers And Expand Air Carrier Services; To Create A Special Fund To Be Designated As The "air Carrier Incentive Program Fund"; To Provide That Mda Shall Utilize Money In The Fund To Match Funds Expended By Airport Authorities To Provide The Incentives Authorized; To Create A Special Fund To Be Designated As The "city Of Jackson Infrastructure Fund;" To Provide That The Mississippi Department Of Transportation (mdot) Shall Distribute Money In The Fund To The City Of Jackson To Assist The City In Paying The Costs Of Road And Street Repair, Reconstruction And Resurfacing Projects, And The Costs Of Water, Sewer And Drainage Projects As Approved By Mdot; To Authorize Video Gaming In This State; To Authorize Boards Of Supervisors Of Counties To Elect To Prohibit Video Gaming In Their County; To Provide That The Mississippi Gaming Commission Shall Have Regulatory Authority Over The Conduct Of Video Gaming Or Related Activities As Described In This Act; To Provide That The Commission Shall Ensure The Integrity Of The Acquisition And Operation Of Video Gaming Terminals, Redemption Terminals And Associated Equipment And Shall Have Sole Regulatory Authority Over Every Aspect Of The Conduct Of Video Gaming; To Grant The Commission Certain Powers And Duties; To Authorize The Commission To Take Certain Disciplinary Actions And To Provide For Appeals From Decisions Of The Commission; To Require The Licensing Of Video Gaming Operators And The Persons Employed By Video Gaming Operators; To Require The Licensing Of Manufactures And Suppliers Of Video Gaming Equipment; To Provide The Requirements For Licensure Under This Act; To Require Testing And Certifying Of Video Gaming Machines By The Commission; To Limit The Number Of Video Gaming Machines That May Be Placed On The Premises Of A Licensee; To Limit The Amount Of Wagers That May Be Made; To Prohibit Anyone Who Is Not The Holder Of A Commercial Driver's License From Playing A Video Gaming Terminal; To Provide Certain Civil And Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Establish The Fees For The Various Licenses Authorized Under This Act; To Levy A Tax On Video Gaming Revenue And Require That The Revenue From The Tax To Be Deposited Into The Transportation Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Provide That The Net Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited Into The Transportation Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act And To Provide That The Additional Tax Levied On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Room Rentals Shall Be Deposited In The Transportation Infrastructure Repair, Renovation And Maintenance Fund; To Amend Sections 57-43-15, 65-18-9 And 65-18-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2946.title: Bonds; authorize to assist Natchez in constructing a Civil Rights Memorial.
2946.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Assisting The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, In Constructing A Monument Commemorating The Civil Rights Movement Of The 1960's; And For Related Purposes.

2948.title: City of Jackson; authorize to create special local improvement taxing districts.
2948.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By The Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

2949.title: Building Roads, Improving Development and Growing the Economy (BRIDGE Act); create.
2949.description: An Act To Create The Building Roads, Improving Development And Growing The Economy Act (bridge Act); To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $60,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Establish A Grant Program For The Purpose Of Making Grants To Assist Municipalities And Counties In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Maintenance And Reconstruction Of Roads, Streets And Bridges; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Administer The Grant Program Created In This Act; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury, Designated As The "municipal And County Road And Bridge Improvement Grant Fund"; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $20,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Grant Program; To Authorize The Issuance Of $10,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 35, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, To Increase From $29,843,000.00 To $32,843,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Reconstruction Or Replacement Of Seawalls At The Ross Barnett Reservoir As Required By The Settlement Agreement In The Case Of Bobby L. Baker, Jr., Et Al. V. Pearl River Valley Water Supply District; To Amend Section 45, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Section 9, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, As Amended By Section 16, Chapter 530, Laws Of 2014, To Increase By $7,500,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund And To Extend The Time Within Which Such Bonds May Be Issued; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Rankin County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Related To The Extension Of Gunter Road; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Water System At Alcorn State University; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Widening Of Portions Of Mississippi Highway 16 In Kemper County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Soil And Water Conservation Commission For Repairs And Improvements To Water Impoundment Structures; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Pay The Cost Of Capital Improvements To The Capitol Complex; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Preconstruction, Design, Engineering, Land Acquisition, Right-of-way Acquisition, Construction And Development Of The Reunion Parkway Project From Bozeman Road To Parkway East In Madison County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The East Metropolitan Corridor Commission, Which Is A Commission Operating As A Local Public Agency Representing The Jackson Municipal Airport Authority, The City Of Brandon, Mississippi, The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, And The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Land Acquisition And Implementation Of The East Metro Corridor Project In Rankin County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Desoto County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Improvements To Holly Springs Road; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Carroll County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Repair, Renovation Or Replacement Of A Closed Bridge On County Road 157; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Covington County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Improvements To Kola Road In Covington County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Lamar County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Improvements To The Intersection Of Scruggs Road And Mississippi Highway 589; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Bolivar County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Preplanning And Construction Of A Mississippi River Landing Dock Facility And Related Facilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Greenville, Mississippi, In Paying The Cost Of Necessary Improvements And Repairs To The City's Water And Sewer System; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi In Paying The Costs For Necessary Improvements To The J.e. Tatum Industrial Drive; To Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Assess A Motor Fuels Tax Registration Fee For Electric-drive Motor Vehicles, Hybrid-drive Motor Vehicles And Hydrogen-drive Motor Vehicles, To Provide The Fee Amounts, To Clarify The Circumstances And Manner In Which The Fees Shall Be Paid, To Make The Fees A Prerequisite To Licensing And Registration; To Provide That The Revenue From Such Tax Shall Be Deposited Into The Economic Development And Emergency Bridge Repair Fund Created By This Act; To Create A Study Committee For The Purpose Of Studying Mechanisms To Facilitate Collaboration Between Responsible Public Entities And Private Partners In Public Facility And Infrastructure Development And Operation; To Create In The State Treasury A Special Fund To Be Known As The "strategic Infrastructure Investment Fund"; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Utilized By The Governor To Provide Funding For Long-term Strategic Infrastructure Investments And May Be Utilized By The Governor To Meet Any Federal Matching Fund Requirements Related To Infrastructure Projects Within This State; To Amend Section 27-103-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Fiscal Year 2018, The Executive Director Of The Department Of Finance And Administration Shall First Distribute An Amount Equal To 1% Of The General Fund Revenue Estimate For That Fiscal Year By The Department Of Revenue And The University Research Center And Adopted By The Legislative Budget Office; To Provide That In Fiscal Years 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022 And 2023, The Executive Director Of The Department Of Finance And Administration Shall First Distribute An Amount Equal To 2% Of The General Fund Revenue Estimate For That Fiscal Year Developed By The Department Of Revenue And The University Research Center And Adopted By The Joint Legislative Budget Committee; To Create In The State Treasury A Special Fund To Be Known As The "economic Development And Emergency Bridge Repair Fund"; To Transfer Into Such Fund $25,000,000.00 From The State Highway Fund Annually Through Fiscal Year 2023; To Provide That Fees Paid For Certain Motor Vehicle License Tags Shall Be Deposited Into Such Fund Through Fiscal Year 2023; To Provide That Money In Such Fund Utilized By The Governor, With The Advice Of The Advisory Board Created By This Section, To Provide Funding For Emergency Bridge Repairs On Public Roads, Streets And Highways In This State And To Promote Economic Development; To Create The Economic Development And Emergency Bridge Repair Fund Advisory Board And Provide For Its Membership And Duties; To Amend Sections 27-19-45, 27-19-47, 27-19-48, 27-19-56.1, 27-19-56.2, 27-19-56.3, 27-19-56.6, 27-19-56.11, 27-19-56.13 And 27-19-99, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Create In The State Treasury A Special Fund To Be Known As The "municipal Sales Tax Diversion Infrastructure Fund"; To Provide That Each Municipality That Receives A Sales Tax Diversion Shall Have An Account In Such Fund Which Shall Consist Of Certain Revenue Required To Be Deposited Into Such Accounts By Section 27-65-75; To Provide That In Order For A Municipality To Access Money In Its Account It Must Deposit Into The Account An Amount Equal To The Amount Sought To Be Accessed And Upon Deposit Of Funds By A Municipality, The State Fiscal Officer Shall Pay To The Municipality The Amount Deposited By The Municipality And An Equal Amount Of The Other Funds In The Account; To Provide That Funds Paid To A Municipality Under This Section Shall Not Be Considered By A Municipality As General Fund Revenue And Shall Be Expended By The Municipality Solely For Water And Sewer System Projects And Road, Street And Bridge Repair, Reconstruction And Resurfacing Projects; To Provide That Funds Remaining In The Account Of A Municipality At The End Of A Fiscal Year Shall Be Transferred To The Economic Development And Emergency Bridge Repair Fund; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Amount Of The Total Sales Tax Revenue Collected On Business Activities In Municipalities To Be Diverted To The Municipal Sales Tax Diversion Infrastructure Fund; To Provide That Such Diversion Shall Be Implemented Only If Sales Tax Revenue Collections Increase A Certain Amount; To Amend Section 63-5-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Weight Tolerance Allowed For Vehicles Operating Under A Harvest Permit And Certain Vehicles Loading And Unloading At A State Port; To Authorize The Tolerance For Harvest Permit Vehicles That Are Loaded At A Point Of Origin With Scales Available For Weighing Each Individual Axle; To Amend Section 65-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Rights-of-way May Be Acquired By The Department Of Transportation Unless The Acquisition Is Approved By The Governor And The Project For Which The Rights-of-way Are Acquired Are Reasonably Expected To Be Completed Within Five Years; To Bring Forward Sections 65-1-1, 65-1-2, 65-1-5, 65-1-7, 65-1-8, 65-1-9, 65-1-10, 65-1-11 And 65-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Which Relate To The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation; And For Related Purposes.

2950.title: Bonds; authorize general obligation bonds for institutions of higher learning, community colleges and state agencies.
2950.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2951.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for various purposes.
2951.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Agencies; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,000,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 35, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, To Increase From $29,843,000.00 To $30,843,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt And/or Dedicating A Certain Amount Of Funds For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $1,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Grants Or Loans To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Amend Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $68,000,000.00 To $69,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act For Projects Designed To Enhance Facilities That Are At Risk For Closure Pursuant To The Base Closure And Realignment Act Of 1991 Or Other Applicable Federal Law; To Extend The Reverter On The Provisions That Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Site Development Grant Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; To Amend Section 8, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, To Revise The Purposes For Which Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The John C. Robinson Mississippi Aviation Museum Fund May Be Utilized; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 511, Laws Of 2016, To Revise The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For Capital Improvements At Jackson State University May Be Used; To Bring Forward Sections 27-69-13 And 27-69-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Tobacco Tax; To Bring Forward Section 27-70-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relates To The Tobacco Equity Tax; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair To Natchez Trace Lake In Pontotoc County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of The Pearl River Community College Workforce Development Center On The Campus Of Pearl River Community College In Hancock County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Improvements To Rockabilly Way (mississippi Highway 145) In Lee County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Saltillo, Mississippi, In Paying The Cost Of Necessary Improvements And Repairs To The City's Storm Water System; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The Tupelo Public School District To Pay The Cost Of Roofing Church Street Elementary School; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Crosby, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Reconstruction And Improvement Of The Town's Surface Water Drainage System; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of A Workforce Center Near The Desoto Career Tech Center West Campus In Horn Lake, Mississippi, Called The Desoto Technology Park; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College In Paying The Cost Of Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping A Science, Technology, Engineering And Mathematics (stem) Building; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, In Paying The Cost Of Damage To The City's Infrastructure Caused By A Tornado That Struck The City In 2017; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Monroe County, Mississippi, In Paying The Cost Of Repair And Renovation Of The Monroe County Courthouse; To Amend Section 65-4-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $1,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Construction Of Two Ion Exchange Filtration Systems For The City's Water Supply System; And For Related Purposes.

2953.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of state general obligation bonds for a workforce center in Horn Lake, Mississippi.
2953.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of A Workforce Center Near The Desoto Career Tech Center West Campus In Horn Lake, Mississippi, Called The Desoto Technology Park; And For Related Purposes.

2954.title: Bonds; authorize state general obligation bonds for I-10 Connector Road in Jackson County.
2954.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Jackson County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Phases Ii And Iii Of An I-10 Connector Road In Jackson County; And For Related Purposes.

2955.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of state general obligation bonds to construct the Mississippi River Museum in Greenville.
2955.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of The Mississippi River Museum In Greenville, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2956.title: Bonds; authorize for extension of the Tanglefoot Trailhead Extension in Houston, MS.
2956.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Houston, Mississippi, In Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping An Extension Of The Tanglefoot Trailhead Pavilion In The City; And For Related Purposes.

2957.title: Authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for improvements to Jackson-Evers International Airport and Hawkins Field.
2957.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Jackson Municipal Airport Authority In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements At Hawkins Field Airport And Jackson-medgar Wiley Evers International Airport; And For Related Purposes.

2958.title: Bonds; authorize g.o. bonds to assist in repair, renovation, restoration & expansion of the Houlka Community Center.
2958.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Houlka Community Center In Chickasaw County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2961.title: City of Saltillo; authorize the governing authorities to impose a tax on hotels, motels and restaurants for certain purposes.
2961.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Saltillo, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Generating Revenue To Enhance Tourism, Economic Development, Infrastructure, Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2962.title: City of Greenville; authorize enforcement of sewer ordinances in areas served outside the city.
2962.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenville, Mississippi, To Take Any And All Actions Necessary To Enforce The City's Sewer Ordinances As They Affect Customers Who Reside Outside The City's Corporate Limits Who Are Served By The Sanitary Sewer System Of The City; And For Related Purposes.

2963.title: City of Ocean Springs; authorize use of golf carts and/or low-speed vehicles on certain public roads and streets.
2963.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ocean Springs, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts And Low-speed Vehicles On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart Or Low-speed Vehicle To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; And For Related Purposes.

2964.title: Prentiss County; authorize certain expenditures from the county's Inmate Canteen Fund.
2964.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Prentiss County, Mississippi, The Board Of Supervisors Of Tishomingo County, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Alcorn County, Mississippi, To Authorize The Expenditure Of Funds From Each County's Inmate Canteen Fund To Purchase Equipment And Supplies That Benefit Inmates Incarcerated In The County Jail In Addition To The Purchases Authorized By Section 19-3-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

2966.title: Greene county; authorize to construct or acquire a county jail anywhere in the county.
2966.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Greene County, Mississippi, To Construct Or Acquire A County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

2967.title: City of Pearl; authorize to levy a 1% sales tax to be used solely for infrastructure improvements.
2967.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 60% Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City Solely For The Purpose Of Improving Infrastructure In The City Including, But Not Limited To, The Overlay And Resurfacing Of City Streets; And For Related Purposes.

2968.title: Stone County and City of Wiggins; revise the membership of the Stone County Economic Development Partnership.
2968.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 960, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, To Revise The Membership Of The Stone County Economic Development Partnership; To Provide A Procedure For An Election To Be Called On The Continuance Of The Tax Authorized By This Chapter If Such Tax Was Imposed Without A Vote Of The Electorate; And For Related Purposes.

2969.title: City of Pearl; authorize the imposition of a tax on hotels, motels and restaurants to promote tourism, parks and recreation.
2969.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2970.title: Town of Vaiden; authorize a tax on restaurants to provide funds for tourism and parks and recreation.
2970.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Vaiden, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Promotion Of Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2971.title: City of Columbus-Lowndes County; extend repeal date on restaurant tax & revise membership of the Columbus Lowndes CVB.
2971.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 870, Local And Private Laws Of 1986, As Last Amended By Chapter 948, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law That Authorize The Mayor And City Council Of The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Lowndes County, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax On Retail Sales Of Beer, Alcoholic Beverages And Prepared Food Sold By Restaurants; To Revise The Definition Of The Term "restaurant" In Such Law To Remove The Annual Sales Requirement; To Amend Chapter 953, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Revise The Membership Of The Columbus-lowndes Convention And Visitors Bureau; To Require The Bureau To Annually Contribute $250,000.00 To The Golden Triangle Development Link; And For Related Purposes.

2973.title: Monroe County; extend the repeal date on the law that establishes the Monroe County Beautification Commission.
2973.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 933, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Establishment Of The Monroe County Beautification Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2974.title: Monroe County; extend the repeal date on law authorizing contributions to the Monroe County Chamber of Commerce.
2974.description: An Act To Reenact And Amend Chapter 916, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Last Amended By Chapter 906, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Monroe County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds Annually To The Monroe County Chamber Of Commerce; And For Related Purposes.

2976.title: Jackson County; authorize the cleaning of certain blighted property.
2976.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County To Conduct Hearings To Determine Whether Certain Property Within The County Is Blighted Property; To Require The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Notice To The Owners Of "blighted" Property; To Provide The Form And Manner Of The Notice To Authorize The County To Charge The Actual Costs Of Correcting The Blighted Property; And For Related Purposes.

2978.title: Jackson County; extend the repeal date on the county's hotel and motel tax.
2978.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 932, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon Hotel And Motel Room Rentals In Jackson County And Provides That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Paid To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention And Visitors Bureau To Be Used For The Promotion Of Tourism On The Mississippi Gulf Coast; And For Related Purposes.

2979.title: Jackson County; authorize contributions to the Mississippi Maritime Museum, Inc.
2979.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Mississippi Maritime Museum, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2980.title: Warren County; authorize construction of a jail on property outside the City of Vicksburg.
2980.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Construct Or Acquire A County Jail On Certain Property Outside The City Of Vicksburg; And For Related Purposes.

2981.title: Rankin County; provide efficient method for debt service to be paid on bonds issued by West Rankin Utility Authority.
2981.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 977, Local And Private Laws Of 1994, As Last Amended By Chapter 955, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Provide An Efficient And Effective Procedure For Payments To Be Made By Public Agency Members To Pay Principal And Interest On Bonds Issued By The West Rankin Utility Authority; To Require That The Payments Be Used Exclusively For The Payment Of Such Bonds And Be Pledged Exclusively To Secure The Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

2982.title: Lowndes County; increase the amount that may be contributed to the United Way.
2982.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 918, Local And Private Laws Of 2017, To Increase The Amount That The Board Of Supervisors Of Lowndes County, Mississippi, May Contribute To The United Way Of Lowndes County; And For Related Purposes.

2984.title: Suffrage restored to Edward Carter of Claiborne County.
2984.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Edward Carter, Sr., Of Claiborne County, Mississippi.

2986.title: DeSoto County; extend the repeal date on the authority to donate to the DeSoto County Economic Development Council, Inc.
2986.description: An Act To Reenact And Amend Chapter 901, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Extend Until December 31, 2019, The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Donate Funds And In-kind Donations And Support To The Desoto County Economic Development Council, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2987.title: Jackson County; authorize contributions to the Junior Auxiliary of Pascagoula-Moss Point.
2987.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Junior Auxiliary Of Pascagoula-moss Point; And For Related Purposes.

2989.title: Tunica County; authorize to impose a license tax upon gaming devices.
2989.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Impose A License Tax Upon Gaming Devices Located On Vessels Which Dock In The County; And For Related Purposes.

2990.title: Suffrage restored to Stanley Barnes of Claiborne County.
2990.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Stanley Barnes, Of Claiborne County, Mississippi.

2991.title: City of Ridgeland; authorize the levy of an additional tax on hotels and motels.
2991.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ridgeland, Mississippi, To Impose An Additional Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote And Improve The Attributes And Facilities Of The City As They Relate To Tourism And Parks And Recreation And For Promoting Tourism, Parks And Recreation Events And Activities In The City; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Additional Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

2992.title: Extend the greetings of the Mississippi Senate to Mrs. Sallie Mae Cooley on her 109th Birthday Celebration.
2992.description: A Resolution Extending The Greetings Of The Mississippi Senate To Mrs. Sallie Mae Cooley Of Jasper County, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of Her 109th Birthday Celebration.

2993.title: Commend Ole Miss Golf Standout Braden Thornberry for representing the United States in the 2017 Walker Cup Matches.
2993.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ole Miss Golf Team Standout Braden Thornberry For Winning The University's First-ever 2017 Men's Ncaa Individual Golf National Championship And For Representing The United States Leading The Usa To Victory In The 2017 Walker Cup Matches.

2994.title: Mourn the passing and commend the life of Bishop Hollis Musgrove Prelate Emeritus.
2994.description: A Resolution Extending The Condolences Of The Mississippi Senate To The Bereaved Family Of Bishop Hollis Musgrove Prelate Emeritus.

2995.title: Express the sense of the Senate regarding the comparison of education funding formulas.
2995.description: A Resolution Expressing The Sense Of The Mississippi Senate Regarding The Comparison Of Education Funding Formulas.

2996.title: Recognize Representative Steve Holland.
2996.description: A Resolution Recognizing Representative Steve Holland Upon His Receipt Of The 2018 "red Rasberry Humanitarian Award," For His 36 Years Of Legislative Service To The State Of Mississippi, His Continued Commitment Of Service To His Constituents And His Literary Work As An Author And Humanitarian.

2997.title: Recognize service of Dr. Hickman M. Johnson on his 50th Anniversary as Pastor of Historic Farish Street Baptist Church.
2997.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Legacy Of Service To Church And Community Of Dr. Hickman M. Johnson On The Occasion Of His 50th Anniversary As Pastor Of Historic Farish Street Baptist Church In Jackson, Mississippi.

2998.title: Recognize Historic Farish Street Baptist Church on its 125th Anniversary Celebration.
2998.description: A Resolution Extending The Greetings And Congratulations Of The Mississippi Senate To Pastor Hickman M. Johnson And The Congregation Of Historic Farish Street Baptist Church In Jackson, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of Its 125th Anniversary Celebration (1893-2018).

2999.title: Join University of Mississippi in commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the 1968 "Mule Train" March from Marks to Washington.
2999.description: A Resolution Joining The University Of Mississippi In Commemorating The 50th Anniversary Of The 1968 "mule Train-poor People's Campaign March" From Marks, Mississippi, To Washington, D.c.

3000.title: Commend Milford Currie for 40 years of outstanding service to the State of Mississippi.
3000.description: A Resolution Commending The Outstanding Legacy Of Public Service Of Milford Currie After 40 Years Of Dedicated Service To The Governor's Office And The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History.

3001.title: Commend life and public service of former State Senator and Representative Rob Smith.
3001.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Remembering The Dedicated Public Service Of Former State Senator And Former Representative Robert H. "rob" Smith And Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature To His Bereaved Family.

3002.title: Commend Pearl "Pirates" Football Team and Head Coach John Perry for first-ever State Championship and perfect season.
3002.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Saluting The Pearl "pirates" Football Team, Coach Of The Year John Perry And Player Of The Year Tylan Knight For Winning Their First-ever Mhsaa Class 6a State Championship And For Their Perfect Season.

3003.title: Commend Belhaven Baseball Coach Hill Denson upon induction into American Baseball Coaches Hall of Fame.
3003.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mississippi Hall Of Fame Belhaven Baseball Coach Hill Denson As The Eighth Mississippi Baseball Coach Chosen For Induction Into The American Baseball Coaches Association Hall Of Fame.

3004.title: Commend Simmons-Hollandale High School "Blue Devils" Football Team for third straight Class 1A State Title and undefeated season.
3004.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Saluting The Simmons-hollandale High School "blue Devils" Football Team And Coach Wade Tackett For Their Third Straight Class 1a State Title And Their 40th Straight Victory.

3005.title: Commend Ocean Springs High School Cheerleading Team as 2017 MHSAA State Champions.
3005.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School "greyhounds" Cheerleading Team As The 2017 Mhsaa State Champions For The Large Varsity Division.

3006.title: Commend the St. Martin High School "Jackettes" Varsity Dance Team for winning State Title.
3006.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Martin High School "jackettes" Varsity Dance Team And Coach Amber Rivera For Winning The Mhsaa Small Jazz Division State Title.

3007.title: Congratulate Kossuth High School Boys and Girls Bowling Teams for sweeping the State Championships.
3007.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Both The Kossuth High School Boys And Girls Bowling Teams And Coach Michael Lee For Sweeping The State Class 1 State Championships For 2017.

3008.title: Recognize Ole Miss Wide Receiver A.J. Brown for winning the 2017 C Spire Conerly Trophy.
3008.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Recognize "ole Miss" Star Wide Receiver A.j. Brown Upon His Receipt Of The Coveted 2017 C Spire Conerly Trophy And To Commend His Stellar Football Career.

3009.title: United States Constitutional Convention under Article V; apply for federal debt limitation and congressional term limits.
3009.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A United States Constitution Article V Amendments Convention Specifically Relating To The Federal Debt And To Congressional Term Limits.

3010.title: United States Constitutional Convention under Article V; apply for federal balanced budget consideration.
3010.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A United States Constitution Article V Amendments Convention Specifically Relating To A Federal Balanced Budget Requirement.

3011.title: Article V Constitutional Convention; urge Congress to call for requiring single-purpose legislation.
3011.description: A Concurrent Resolution To The Congress Of The United States Urging Congress To Call An Article V Convention For The Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States To Provide That Every Law Enacted By Congress Shall Embrace Only One Subject, Which Shall Be Clearly Expressed In Its Title.

3012.title: Congratulate Taylor Machine Works on its 90th Anniversary and for representing Mississippi at "Made in America Week."
3012.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Taylor Machine Works In Louisville, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of Its 90th Anniversary Celebration And For Representing Our State At President Donald Trump's "made In America Week" And Governor Phil Bryant's "made In Mississippi Week."

3013.title: Commend service of LTJG Wallace Eugene Burch of Horn Lake, Mississippi.
3013.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Service Of Lieutenant Junior Grade Wallace Eugene Burch, 25, Of Horn Lake, Mississippi.

3014.title: Commend MDWFP Team Wildlife for top honors in the 2017 LawFit Challenge.
